S0Ck7Rk3-Jzge2EZKFIldA.text: Their food is just too good to not give them 5 stars even if sometimes the staff is a little slow.  Good food is worth the wait!

y46EZ1ivlURzhlI4uKHeJg.text: Great Pozole and awesome bloody mary's.  We come here often on the weekends and we love this place.

lRo4vXMz3-XY5kZzs6yeaw.text: The atmosphere is classy and fun . Always love the food the spice can be a little hot. Pepsi served in bottles, no free refills. Brought my girls and thought it was not very kid friendly.

MEn_3UHQPkEePtORDN8F0A.text: I rarely give 5 stars, but this place was AWESOME.  Definitely not many of it's kind in Phoenix, in my opinion, or any for that matter!    Went for the first time on Saturday, Jan 4th and Jason was our server.  His service was outstanding, and he didn't make us feel rushed in any way, and answered all our questions and chatted with us a while.  The atmosphere was very inviting and had an authentic feel to it.  I ordered the Rellenos and Eggs with green chile and my friend got the Pork Chop and Eggs.  We both loved our dishes and ate everything on the plate.  The Relleno peppers are filled with your choice of pork, beef or turkey.  I ordered the pork and beef and it had such a delicious smoky flavor to it, like it was slow cooked.  Also ordered up a couple Bloody Mary's, only 5 bucks each and outstanding.  I will DEFINITELY be back to this place, and don't know why I didn't go sooner.

lVN_ifSirYwHf12ZFWRnBw.text: The food was just a normal food but it was so expensive. Services was not good. It took alot to take our orders. I did not like the place.

SOybDkE99afRh8T8Z9FJKA.text: What's the deal with Rokerij and Richardson's?  We thought we were hanging out at Rokerij and it turned out to be Richardson's.  They aren't the same place but they are in the same place?  The valet parking is set up so that it drops you off at Richardson's entrance, see the confusion?  As we were sitting there I remember thinking, "I don't know what all the fuss is about."  The oysters were good, the wine was alright, the ambiance was okay - western decor isn't really my thing.  My friend and I sat at the bar and the bartender was sweet but not really attentive.  Hopefully we'll pick door number two next time and end up at the right place.

4ppmqVnYKFcgEjZ-ZAaoxQ.text: This is one of my favorite spots to accompany my wife too. The hammered copper bar top is cool while the ambiance is just plane awesome in this New Mexican cuisine restaurant. We usually start with their Chips, salsa, and guacamole while I get a beer on tap. The wife gets a prickly pear margarita or a glass of wine from their great and reasonably priced wine list.  Although I have tried just about everything in the menu and many of their specials, I find myself going back to the chile rellenos platter. They offer two chiles stuffed with one of their several different stuffings. I like to mix it up and get one topped with red sauce while the other topped with green sauce. My wife is from NM, and she has stated many times that this is by far the best spot in AZ for NM styled food.

TG3bG3qOdoOO85CbstFpgA.text: I considered myself a American patriot until Richardson's took their red, white & blue enchiladas off of the menu.  Now I don't know what to stand for anymore.

2eYlGRK7wwY8WYcccC18BA.text: I've been going to Richardson's since 1995.  Yes, I have.  That was 1.  before the place burned down,  2.  when they had a separate pizza menu with 25 delicious zzas that they served until 1 a.m.   3.  they had a short-glass full of loose cigarettes at the bar that patrons could just help themselves to  4.  when they'd serve free appetizer bites to folks around the bar  5. you could park your OWN car, and enter through the secret door in the back, and 6.  when the staff weren't jerks and appreciated the customer.  That's the part that gets me about this place now.  The food....great.  It's unique.  Try finding anything else like it anywhere, except New Mexico. I dare you.  Portions are ridiculous. You pay for it, but you can spend $20 easy for dinner at Red Lobster.  And this is no Red Lobster.  The atmosphere...great too.  Music is usually spot on. The place is comfortable. I like the no-windows thing, especially in the summer....it's cave-like.  The staff....jackasses.  Look, I know there's a line out the door, but you're still in the hospitality business.  So quit making me feel like i've got some-nerve asking to eat here. Get over yourself.  It's your jobbbbbbbbbb.......  I will say this, the cooks are some of the hardest working folks I've ever seen.  They are machines, and work magic in that tiny kitchen...somehow never running into one another. So, bravo cooks, keep it up.  So, go.  Just don't expect to feel welcomed.

t8CYDugSZbO9cRlCMhSvew.text: My daughter recommended this Resturant & said the food was good & a fun place. We loved it & plan to go back soon!  She was right on!

8lvMdZvIqdTzK_WsFmkhNQ.text: My first experience with Richardson's was actually at the Rokerij.  When I finally got to eat in their newly redone restaurant I became a fan FOR LIFE. My boyfriend and I decided to try to get in last minute on a Saturday night, which in hindsight, was a ridiculous thought. However, on the way out a manager flagged us down and encouraged us to take advantage of their tables in the bar. This actually worked out perfectly and wasn't offered to us by the hostess, but I will most definitely look to sit in that 'hidden' area again.  I ordered their signature dish, the Pasta Heidi, and OH MY GOD. Insane. I didn't understand how pasta could be what put them on the map, but SERIOUSLY this was so good. Green chili pasta, grilled chicken, a yummy cream sauce all served on top of a tortilla. I crave this on a regular basis now.  Great ambiance with big tables which make me want to host a big dinner their just to utilize the cute space.   This place is a must, just think about maybe making reservations ahead of time.

aaqqe86mSb0020s55weeKw.text: Richardson's has great, unique food, and definitely a fun vibe. I am excited to go again.   I think it's important to note that it is a bit dark, cramped and loud at times. This would not normally be a problem, but I went with my grandparents and this was a bit of a problem, because it was very difficult to see the menu and steps in the restaurant, and hear each other.   I'd recommend this place more for an outing with friends, to grab dinner and drinks, and less of a quiet family dinner kind of place.

ZmlWQuyKMoyQzwmaUDPFLQ.text: WARNING, do not sit on the patio. During this wonderful weather, you may be tempted to bask in the outdoors while you leisurely indulge in a mimosa or bloody mary. This restaurant is not the place to do so. For two weekends in a row I have sat on the patio only to be sorely neglected. I waited for 20 minutes to get a drink each time I sat down. This was because I discovered that the bartender outside is also the waitress for the entire patio. She is heavily bogged down and cannot accommodate patrons sitting at the tables. There were 5 of us, all four adults got their meal and were done eating when the 5th persons food finally arrived. I have no complaints about the food, but I also have no desire to give money to a place that has great food but crappy service.

G_9DQicPAh-igV3n2Wem9w.text: What can I say about Richardson's?  It's a Phoenix staple with delicious food and amazing atmosphere; however, the service is lacking.  What does that mean exactly?  Let me tell you... We stopped here with four other couples on a bike pub crawl over the weekend, and sat on the patio to take advantage of a spectacular Happy Hour menu.  After ordering a few cocktails and appetizers, when it came time to settle our bill, our server said there was no way  she could split a check.  Moreover, after we questioned the logic (because who really doesn't have the means to split checks today?), she claimed that it clearly states this rule on the website.  Really?  That's the argument?  I checked the website, and there is nothing stating anything remotely close to her claim; and regardless, if that IS policy, why not clearly state that on the menu with the other "You order, you own it" rule? So what did we have to do?  We had to isolate each order, and write on the check the amount we wanted charged to each card, and had to ask the cashier to run each one separately.  Sure, we could have paid all on one card and figured it out among ourselves afterwards, but it's now about principle.  Moreover, in retrospect I wonder what she would have done if we all claimed not to know one another, thus required that the checks be split accordingly?  It's this type of policy, or simply lazy service, that makes me dislike a once highly recommended dining spot. It's to note, we never have any service issues while alone as a couple; it's only with others where we have concern. Additionally, service challenges aside, the food here is spectacular.  The bacon wrapped shrimp, along with the presentation, is one of the best happy hour selections one can make in the valley.  And the entrees are nothing short of amazing as well.  The blue corn smoked turkey enchilada is comfort food at its finest, and the smell of pecan wood just heightens the senses. Overall, we'll surely be back; however, between now and then I hope they can figure out a way to accommodate split checks.  If I can find an app on my phone in less than 30 seconds that does it, I would think a restaurant of this quality should have a similar solution.

cCRGanYlNmojlroumZCWpQ.text: The husband and I came to Richardson's for happy hour to celebrate our 9 monthaversary (and we had a gift card, so that helped). We sat at the bar, the husband got a beer, I asked for a bellini (since it said they had them on special on their menu) and the bartender looked at me like I was insane... I guess they don't make those anymore? Not sure. I ended up getting a mimosa, which was very good. The OJ tasted fresh and the glass was a generous size. We had a feast of happy hour food items that included: Blackened scallops, chicken tostadas, chipotle ribs, green chili sliders, and a green chili potato. Some items were delicious and some were not so much. The scallops (HH priced at 15$, so still fairly expensive) were the best of the bunch in my opinion. They were perfectly cooked and came with 4 different sauces, beans, and rice... it was all delicious. I would come back and just get that. The portion size was very generous. The ribs were the second best item. They were very tender, fall off the bone, and flavorful. The green chili potato was ok, but really not as special as I would expect for a restaurant's signature item. It is essentially a twice baked potato, but instead of putting the potato innards back into the potato skin, they stuff it into a pepper.... I thought the pepper was too firm and the flavors didn't completely complement each other. The filling could have been seasoned better. The sliders were alright, they were like little french dips sort of with chilies on top. I didn't love them, they just weren't that flavorful or special. The worst dish of the night was the tostadas... they lacked flavor, fell apart, and just were boring. When a menu states that when you order chilies, you're responsible for the heat level, I expect something will be spicy... but nothing was. I liked this place alright overall, but it was a bit inconsistent. I would probably come back for happy hour, but it wouldn't be my first choice in town.

ITudZ8iThkgqJz8Jl2eKUw.text: This is a New Mexico Mexican food restaurant. I liked hearing this when I first arrived. I personally do not care for spicy food and so it may not be fair for me to leave this review because just about everything on that menu did not sound appetizing to me. I did tell the server I did not like spice and was not given any alternative suggestions. The area we sat in was extremely cold all of us were shivering. Overall the food was alright. I did like the atmosphere. I'd go again but definitely would not be my first choice.

K7AQh-HuVgryH0K7NsX4nA.text: How this place has less than 4 starts is beyond me.  This is the best New Mexican food you can find outside of NM and one of the best restaurants in all of phoenix. The food is incredible (get the carne adovada or the chile rellenos) and the bar selection is great.  Service is good and atmosphere is great.  Fantastic place.

UbAEpBfROR9ALZ0FjUgzfQ.text: I stumbled upon this place through my Thrillest app, looking for a good place to eat after my girlfriend's graduation from Arizona State University. I have to say this place is truly exceptional from the hot plates and exquisite food to the decor. If you find yourself near Phoenix I highly recommend this place, you will not be disappointed.

07yEErjVUQOfvciYPhFZ7A.text: A special shout out to our wonderful server, Misty!   Thank you for making our brunch so special!  The food and service amazing. What a gem to have in our fair city. Simple casual atmosphere with great food!  Can't wait to go back again!

ZDthnvrqtyk-_BhQsNy_XQ.text: Dark cozy spot with a great menu and nice selection of cocktails, wines and beer.  Food was solid , with  our group ordering a nice selection of small plates, including scallops, and beef skewers, served with a tasty selection of salsas.   Our server seated us immediately, walked us thru the menu and then disappeared .  Subsequent service was slow, with orders arriving at different times and one not at all.  Good if you have time and are in the neighborhood.

WI_LztWfzE_Q-8OKM4yv3Q.text: Took the wife to Richardsons for our fifth year anniversary splendid time in a little booth with great food and yummy bloody Mary's.

-uh69WQ5nTe_LLAMO-iVTQ.text: This is going to be in a weird order, so sorry.  First I want to say that this is a beautiful restaurant. In fact it is one of the most beautiful restaurants I can remember going to in the recent past. The neighborhood and the very exterior are Meh, but as soon as you walk through the gate, just gorgeous. Even though I can't recommend it, it seems like a great place to sit outside at during the nicer months. The inside is nicely decorated, dark and cozy. Place is fancyish.  If you like wine and drinking, and excellent food or great service isn't really high on your list of priorities for a dining establishment, I would recommend this place to bring a date. It's nice and dark, and if my experience is representative of their service, you'll have plenty of time to chat with your date uninterrupted.  Unfortunately for me, I don't have a lot of game, so I go ahead and eat at most restaurants I go to, since that is what they are there for. I want very badly to find a New Mexican restaurant I like on my side of town, and today this was the place.   I may have made a mistake by doing so, but I sat outside for a minute and read a few of the yelp reviews beforehand. What I was looking for was an idea of a great dish, what I found was a few too many mentions of poor service.   Some of the reviews mentioned condescension and patronizing responses, but I might have preferred that. I got a lack of attention as well as lack of friendliness/helpfulness. The onus should be on the server to get a dialogue going and get some rapport built. It would take minimal effort.   As far as the food, this place is a step above your normal family restaurant price-wise, so if they are justifying the prices on the food, I just could not see it. It was decent, but not "OMG this is great New Mexican food!" If you value your money and would be upset by wasting it, my advice would be to try it on your own before taking the financial bath of bringing your family.   There are plenty of decent Mexican places around far more reasonably priced, and this place just didn't justify the cost.   My search continues. I don't think I'll be back to Richardson's any time soon. Not worth it. Sad.

MwfTJNLQOybCFmKqmmvo9g.text: I absolutely love this place. I have been coming here for years. Now it's Tuesday tradition to come and drink and eat some amazing food. Tony and Eddie are epic. They never let my drink go dry and we have the best conversation. I have never eaten something here that I didn't love. I can't survive my crazy week without Richardson's!

UW-WHD-vLTQXJTghwNfaAQ.text: This was not our first trip to Richardson's. Place is comfy, has fireplaces, and plenty of comfy nooks.  We entered around 2 pm and the place was mostly empty. They sat the 2 of us at a gigantic booth for 4 (6?) or more. The waiter was very attentive at first. We ordered drinks. One came with a little black bug in it.  We returned it and receive another. We ordered breakfasts and everything was really yummy.  My dinning partner order another drink.  It came with another bug in it.  We had a hard time finding our waiter in the empty place.  He finally came, and when we pointed to the bug he said, "we have them all over." He didn't know where they came from, but wasn't concerned.  Brought a new drink again (What?)  We finished the very good food and waited for the bill.  We finally yelled across the room at the waiter and asked for our bill.  I don't know about you, but the bugs are a game changer.  Though the food was good, and the service slow at best, I can't go back and eat at a place where bugs are a common thing.

6U1THRgSUPJwHlhjQZRx7A.text: I have not been to Richardson's since they were on the corner of 16th St and Bethany Home.  One of my favorite Phoenix places for a great dinner and great wine, the place burned down years ago and I finally visited their newly rebuilt restaurant last night.  I was blown away at how similar the layout was and of course nothing has changed.  Still some of the best New Mexican style cuisine I've ever had.  And their wine list is solid.  If you haven't been here, you need to give it a try.  Stay casual when you go.

snS3oggap-lwldiYwYX3Mw.text: Richardson's was recommended to us for brunch while we were visiting Arizona for Spring Training. I'll state right now that I have a thing against restaurants that pretend to be something that they are not. Richardson's came off as very pretentious. I do not understand why they have valet parking when there is plenty of parking to go around. On top of that, the host actually asked us if we had a reservation when there were plenty of open tables and when we replied that we didn't, the host made it seem like he was doing us a favor by giving us a table. It would have been better had the service improved as our meal progressed but it actually got worse. It took forever to get our food. In fact, it took so long that the server apologized multiple times and offered my husband a free iced tea.   We ordered the Huevos Rancheros (three eggs, blue corn tortillas, red or green chile & cheese, potatoes or hash browns, beans & a tortilla) and the Carne Adovada & Eggs ( three eggs, smoked pork simmered in red chile, potatoes or hash browns, beans & a tortilla). Apparently their main seller is the Adovada. I did not care for it at all because it was smoked too heavily. But this is just a personal preference. My husband liked it and loved the generous portion size. He could barely get through it actually which was surprising since he's a pretty big eater. I liked my Huevos Rancheros for the most part but it was just so expensive for what it was. I added some ham to go with my eggs but the dish just felt way to heavy for me and I didn't enjoy it enough to finish it. With that said, I definitely preferred the green chile sauce over the red so please order the green sauce if you get the chance. Oh and Richardson's? Stop skimping people on the tortillas. For the amount of food that was served, you can definitely serve more than one tortilla.   I'm not sure that I can recommend Richardson's. I mean it wasn't bad in any shape or form but it also wasn't anything that justified the price we paid for brunch. It was just too expensive even though I'm sure everything is high quality and such. And that valet. Unnecessary. Plus, living in California means that I'm exposed to some fantastic Mexican cuisine and Richardson's did not blow my mind. A pass for me! 3/5

FgWh3w6aYQH7sYowEBJkrw.text: Very disappointed in the experience from the mixed up, they booked the wrong restaurant, reservation to the meal delivery, every 5 minutes they brought one plate, to the manager that was clearly not interested in discussing my concerns when I asked and they daid he would be right over. Had he done so I would have possibly returned in the future. Their loss not ours. 10 customers lost.

RahUbmMWgjTnv3MoPEwf-w.text: Amazing Sunday breakfast w/fam and this is all due to our amazing  server Rick! Thanks Rick!!! Food, drinks, experience.

u2tN_EUj_XMGH8EIChtAUw.text: Tried to have a joint birthday celebration.  A portion of our food was delivered and the restaurant chose not to deliver the remainder.  Ignored our repeated requests to receive the salads that were supposed to be delivered with our meals.  Place has gone way way way downhill.

UILqdahPH1PS4OZNA_hjEg.text: Deliciousness - 3.5/5 Happiness - 2.5/5  Richardson's is fine, but I don't think it is worth the price. The building itself is very unique and I have always enjoyed my time most when sitting in the outside lobby during happy hour. The restaurant itself is very cramped and very dim. You can hear every conversation and there simply is a lack of space. Water pitchers were constantly placed on the booth where my wife was sitting, meaning she kept looking over her shoulder to make sure they weren't dropped on her head. In my experiences, the servers never seem too engaged either. You get a bottle of water to fill yourself and rarely ever see the waiter post-order. On my recent trip, we got the wrong tab handed to us and it took us about 15 minutes to flag down the waiter to redress the issue.  The menu is relatively limited but full of unique offerings. My favorite is the pasta heidi - green chili linguine in a chipotle sauce. Very delicious. Their double baked green chili potato is also unique to Richardson's and quite delicious. I have also enjoyed their steak and fish offerings. But there are also plenty of just fine, nothing special options. That includes the Santa fe Chicken and their pizzas.   My biggest complaint is though the food is good, it simply isn't worth the price (mid $20s to mid $40s). A lot of the appetizers are the same price as the entrees, and I simply don't think the food justifies the prices.  It's a fun location, and the food is good. I simply have never felt compelled to make this a top option when I go out to eat.

om6v7a0WavCDtk48ksLtsg.text: We're in town from Los Angeles and found this spot on BringFido.  Once again, BringFido delivers!  We were immediately greeted with a bowl of ice water for the pups and seated on the cool, shaded patio.  Overhead fans keep the area in the 70's in spite of triple-digit temperatures outside.  The chips and salsa are a MUST (housemade warm chips and 3 amazing salsas).  Very dog friendly (they have pork and chicken menu options for your pups at a reasonable price), and service and food were impeccable.  I had the New Mexican platter with a sampling of dishes - cheese relleno (excellent - my favorite!), chicken burrito (moist and flavorful), bacon-wrapped shrimp, rice and beans and red and green chile sauces.  The presentation was beautiful and the portions were enormous!  Paired with a margarita, it was a very memorable meal.  Service is warm and friendly here.  They clearly care about your experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dog friendly shaded patio
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great drink specials and Yappy Hour (proceeds go to dog rescue) on Saturdays

n5i4s_RgqpWEDdms2w13zw.text: If you visit, order the New Mexican dishes because that's what they do best. The Enchiladas with Red and Green Sauce (Christmas) and the pork-stuffed Poblano Pepper were fantastic (both traditional New Mexican dishes).  They offer a lot of different types of fish, but the preparation seems a bit of stretch to make it New Mexican. For example, I ordered the Sea Bass with an Orange Chili Glaze. In theory, this sounds delicious, but it was overly sweet with no chili heat for balance. This is a great date spot because many of the tables  and booths are in little nooks for privacy. The sweet potato filled chili is supposed to be what they are known for but for me, it was a bit meh and obviously made en masse before service (which is fine, but make sure it is hot when it is added to the plate). Great cocktails, especially the margaritas.

kfYxzNH6lWvQzcu7pd7cag.text: I had lunch here yesterday with friends and it was just OK.  I was disappointed because I love Mexican food, but can't eat hot spicy. It is recommended that you ask for a 'sample' before ordering a dish and I did so. The sauces had a lot of flavor, but were just too hot for me. I asked the waitress what she would recommend on the menu that was more suited to my taste buds. She said there was nothing but perhaps a pasta dish or hamburger. So, my friends got huge, beautiful, aromatic dishes of steaming food and I got a plain hamburger with skinny, cold fries. I was so disappointed. I'm not sure why restaurants only cater to clients who can add heat to their dishes with hotter sauces, but leave others wanting.  My friends loved their food and kept raving about them. So, if that is what you like, super, but don't invite your friends that you know can't enjoy it.   As if that wasn't bad enough, on the way out, we passed the patio area and there was a couple with their dog sitting next to the man in the booth, eating off the table!  This was NOT a service dog, it was a spoiled pet and it was disgusting to watch. I personally don't want to sit on a cushion where a dog has been licking tidbits off the seat and I certainly don't want to see a dog eating off a plate on the table. People are abusing their privileges of being allowed to take their pets onto the patio. I'm wondering what the health department would have to say if they witnessed such a thing. Yes, I complained and the employee placated me by saying he 'understood' and that things were 'sterilized' after dogs leave, but he didn't do anything about asking the people to put their dog on the floor!   There are tens of thousands of wonderful restaurants in Phoenix competing for my business. I don't think Richardson's will be on my list again anytime in the future.

F0E2UOZk1k4_VMLGoQXNtg.text: Friday night was my last night of my business trip. My friend took me to Richardson's. New Mexican style food...yes, yes, yes. I had the BLACKENED SCALLOPS. Mmmmm!  Got there just after 6, so we missed happy hour.  It's not a large venue, but luckily there were two seats at the bar.  There were so many selections that sound so delicious. I must go back to try those green chile potatoes.   For Happy Hour enthusiasts...on the menu  "During Happy Hour 3pm-6 pm & 9 pm-Close Until We Change Our Mind!"  We got there just after six, so we missed Happy Hour, so go early. It's also valet parking.   I have no pics. I ate it all before I remembered.

22DaAZVSAU34MNGNjQLNMA.text: Atmosphere is a 4- very casual, great date night place. Service is a 4- solid,attentive, and very knowledgeable about the menu  FOOD- is a 4, awesome appetizers, and great fare. My favorite is the pork shoulder (advova) dish, and the enchiladas. I love the queso, elephant garlic, and the rib appetizer.  its awesome, you have to go if you are in town.

yAUTcjFLzGBQNk_HzMyRYA.text: This is our favorite restaurant in the valley. The menu changes often with great specials. The food is spicy New Mexican which is fantastic. We have never had a bad meal. It's very busy but worth the wait. The prime rib is our favorite.

siE6ljd-0NERrS4WqqbB1A.text: Where do I start? I'm from New Mexico, northern New Mexico, and I am picky about places claiming to serve our amazing cuisine, but clearly the Richardson's restaurants know their stuff.  Oh my goodness: I ordered the breakfast burrito with bacon, potatoes, Christmas (red and green chile together) and my mouth was in chile heaven. Wait. How did I forget? Sunday is happy hour ALL DAY until 6pm. My fiance ordered the rellenos and eggs and his steamy plate came out covered in chile and cheese goodness. Truly, this is a diamond in the rough.   Our food came out piping hot, the only way to eat a fantastic meal, and our drinks were fantastic.  This place is beautiful! We sat at the outdoor bar, enjoying the beautiful weather, company, and ambiance. You can smell the wood oven and watch pizza and drinks being made right in front of you. The outdoor patio seating looks amazing and we'll definitely be back. Most definitely.   Do not skip this amazing place. It's wonderful and then some!

YFZAqRyuCBLuXf5EMH5mdA.text: Came here with my family. Have been coming here for years. My step dad Alex is friends with Eric and Phil. We waited for more than 40min to get seated and noticed 2 people got seated ahead of us when they had came minutes after us. We spoke with the manager Clark and instead of just saying he would speak with the people who are in charge of seating us, he kept talking back to my step dad. I don't know what happened to customer service, but it has gone down slowly. Very disappointed.

R22OC5eWCXRXXZBRKcZLgA.text: I've been coming here since the original location on 16th & Bethany before it burnt down.  I recently moved across town and now I'm 5 minutes away so naturally I've been going about once a week.  One of the best places for brunch in the city.  The portions are huge, the food is very spicy, and love the low-light ambiance.

mjaYvwEkDtJkEivqTQVlNg.text: Hour plus wait after ordering. Nobody came to check on us during wait. Brought all three meals out separately and left the child until last. Poor execution. Daughter is crying.   Place is all fail today   Food was excellent as always however.

S0299QaIwl1cUqrok4S_ng.text: Truly outstanding food!! I had the steak with crab! Wow. The shrimp appetizer was excellent as was the roasted garlic plate!! Service generally good. If the food weren't this great, I wouldn't give 5. I will say the average of 3.5 is definitely way low

KK8Gcz34oBLdJI_-BIGU-w.text: Went on a whim based on a friend's recommendation.  This is not "tex mex" but upscale food with Mexican or New Mexican influence.  Prickly pear margarita was excellent, the house salad that came with the entree was good, the jalepano ranch was not at all spicy, but had good flavor.  I had the steak and the portion was huge.  After eating an appetizer (chorizo spinach queso) I couldn't even eat 1/2 my entree. :) the twice baked potato in the green chili was cool and it isn't a sweet potato :) the atmosphere was laid back and decor was cool.  The outdoor space is another restaurant? All in all a good meal and experience.

Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad and maragita

qdRSsKHg_InUke3aHHxtaQ.text: Food was delicious as expected but the atmosphere at dick's is more my style. If you like New Mexico hatch chill cuisine, you can't go wrong with Richardson's. Big portions and always piping hot out of the kitchen.

ZgJgbsqX3TT6-2zDhETBWg.text: Atmosphere was nice. Food was ok, not very flavorful. but, worst of everything was service. the service was terrible. I ate here years ago and tonight was very disappointing. I won't be coming back.

oHiTNTwLwVh1c0DiEch07A.text: all i can say is WOW.. food was delicious.  atmosphere was cozy, not very large area, but nice. we had the skewers and calamari for appetizers, and they were flavorful and cooked just perfect.  next came the main dish,  oh my,  i ordered the chicken burrito and chili relleno, and it was enough to feed my two kids and myself.  hubbs ordered the tenderloin medallions,,, again just perfect.  staff was very friendly  we will be back

j2tldMKcJpIBE4AckgCH3w.text: The waitstaff has come off as fairly miserable on my last few visits.  The food is either not great or inedible due to inaccurately described spiciness levels.  The last time I went, I ordered the chilaquiles off the board.  I know this dish can vary greatly between establishments, but I've had excellent luck up until now and I order it whenever I see it.  It was awful.  Firstly, it came on a plate that was about 2' long.  Thanks for the head's up, waitress.  Secondly, the eggs were so incredibly spicy that I could not eat them.  Any of them.  Since the egg portion of the meal was the size of a regular dinner plate, this was a lot of waste.  The waitress apparently thought so too, because she became agitated when I declined her offer to box it up.    I told her I didn't want them because I couldn't eat them, because they were incredibly goddamned spicy.  She ignored that part and asked me if I would perhaps want to eat them later.  I said I figured they'd still be spicy then.  Then she asked me if I could take them home to someone.  I said I would never give this food to my animals.  THEN SHE TESTILY ASKED IF I KNEW SOMEONE ELSE I COULD GIVE THEM TO.  This B really didn't want to see the food go to waste, but wasn't super concerned that I had just purchased pounds of food that I hated.  I said no, that I wouldn't be ringing up my phone tree to see who likes their eggs with an entire jalapeno, and as she began to angrily suggest yet another option for the reuse of the food, my dining partner interjected and said that jesus christ he would just take the bloody eggs.  Waitress needs to STFU.  Seriously?  Seriously.  This isn't the first time I've been served something I couldn't eat.  I know it's ~Richardson's~, but write "spicy" on the goddamned menu when something is spicy.  Just do it.  As for the waitress, sister needs to research some food outreach programs to volunteer for.  She's wasting too much of her vigor being shitty to customers about eggs.

AsJjf_-kkY2p_8DAmOmBag.text: Wow! What a great restaurant. The food was out of this world! The service was perfect.  We all had a different dish and we were very happy. Can't wait to go back. Be sure and try the appetizer  Roasted Garlic Platter! Like nothing we've tasted.  Their Guacamole was another wow dish.

VGc6ZF5Ik51Hg-nrhpTq6g.text: For starters, it's dark as hell inside. They never asked if we wanted to be indoors or out. That sucked. Ambience and design is cool. Lots of dark wood, bright copper and adobe. Our server was very good and attentive.  My draught beer was flat but I left it at that. Ordered only one.  I can't stand booth seating unless at a diner so I was somewhat uncomfortable the entire time.  Food was good. I got the tacos ala carte. Pork and the tilapia were very good but the lamb was nasty grizzly.  Rice and beans were tasty and cooked just right.  My one daughter's brick oven pizza was well liked and my other daughter's skewers were great. My wife's shrimp quesadilla was over the top great according to her but she was buzzed! I'd say Richardson's would be an excellent place to bring or meet friends but as for families or business clients, not so.

_OhOwKPK-HWVQEhQyb4wqw.text: Everything I had was wonderful during two visits.  The Chipotle ribs were to die for - perfect spice and loads of flavor.  The New Mexico spiced sausage were also a wonderful balance of spice and flavor and accompanied with some of the best pinto beans that I have ever had.  Then there was the CARNE ADOVADA which was perfectly cooked and wonderfully flavor filled.  The NEW MEXICO ENCHILADAS were accompanied by Christmas sauce - both red and green.  The green sauce was perfectly spiced unlike most more bland green sauces.  I only regret is that I never had room for dessert.

flkYWVqUgrJc292cxP2ipg.text: I have been to Richardson's many times and it still remains one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix.  For the people complaining about the food being spicy, um, it is a restaurant serving New Mexico cuisine - it is supposed to be spicy.  My favorite dish has to be the Relleno Platter.  I usually split it with a friend because the portion is huge: two rellenos with rice and beans.  I especially like the pork rellenos with verde sauce, but there's also smoked turkey, beef and regular cheese.  Their margaritas are outstanding...honestly, I haven't had anything that was bad at this restaurant.  And the wait staff is friendly, too.    I love their patio renovation.  It is stylish and sophisticated with a modern New Mexico ambiance.  Great for having dinner and/or drinks outdoors on one of our beautiful Phoenix evenings.

dwl7FsTDOVgqmHys9A7PtA.text: Went for my 40th birthday at the large patio table. It was a great choice. The ambiance was amazing, the food was so good. Our server Tana was a 5 also she was engaging and we had great conversation with her. It was like she was a part if our table and party. After dinner we visited the basement bar and found it to be so cozy and inviting. This is an excellent restaurant and I will be back!

yd61hWPuLSSitUQjl0aHXA.text: I like the place... Very quiet. The staff is attentive. Other patrons are pleasant. Great menu... Something to please even the pickiest of eaters.  Totally not a fan of the ceviche. They do not cook the fish in lime juice...so I was told by a staff member. The shrimp delivered on a bed of rice was delicious tho!

Omcn3eygAM_NgOnHwDudFQ.text: Excellent!  Love their garlic appetizer and they green chili stroganoff is my favorite.  My husband gets the enchiladas which are terrific, and it is always my dad's go to restaurant for his birthday...

8z5rIZyfE4a7bmRakQv6Kw.text: We have been to Richardson's many times in the past -- but after moving away and returning recently we decided to go with some local friends last night.  We have not been to Richardson's since the original (which we LOVED) burned down.  We had a 6:45 reservation and could only be seated on the patio -- which was fun, festive, and comfortable.  However, we had to wait a bit for our table so we sat at the bar and ordered up a few drinks.  The bartender was inattentive and aloof -- and the drinks -- margaritas, were horrible!  We were a bit surprised by this.  When we were seated at the table the bartender, again, was our server.  Before we even had a chance to get settled in she came over to take our appetizer order.  We explained that we needed some time because we were just getting settled in, and we still had our bar drinks in front of us.  In less than 5 minutes she was back again -- and quite annoyed that we weren't "ready."    We decided to order appetizers.  When they arrived we were told the plates were HOT and to be careful.  Actually, the plates were barely warm!!  The queso was nearly cold and the skewers were cold as well!  We waited for her to return but she didn't -- so we picked at the appetizer and continued to talk.  When she finally showed up she was ready to take our order but didn't ask about the appetizers, so we told her they were presented cold.  She said, "Hmmm, well you managed to eat most of it!"  How inappropriate was THAT?? And, again, we weren't ready to order because we were busy talking AND we wanted her to get back so we could tell her the appetizers were unacceptable.  Finally, we ordered.  We asked her to please be sure the entrees were warm. Oh, they were warm, alright.  Each of us ordered something different but our plates looked almost identical -- TONS of red chile and everything was dark brown -- burned looking.  My burrito was unrecognizable and so covered in the red sauce as to be unpalatable.  The chile relleno was so-so.   We LOVE spicy food and love spicy chile! This was just unacceptable! Each of us picked at our plates and decided to give it up.  It was horrible! When the server resurfaced and asked if we wanted boxes (because most of our entrees were still on the plate), we told her we didn't.  Again, she didn't even ask if there was a problem!  This visit was not only disappointing, we will NEVER return.  Oh - and the tab for 4 of us was $180.  That would be okay IF the service and food was good!! This server was inattentive, annoying, and not service oriented AT ALL!  She got a 10% tip (and we are typically 20-25% tippers) and left.  We were also quite surprised that a manager didn't come around to check on things.  I can't believe they get repeat customers if that bartender/server is what they have to offer on the patio.  HORRIBLE!!!!!

rCU2KJJA_bvs4FvQtiB3Xw.text: If you are looking for New Mexican food you might as well drive 6 hours to Albuquerque. The food here is mediocre and the red chile tasted burnt. It tastes like the red chile has been made by red chile powder and way too thick. I had 5 people with me. All pro's on NM food. No sopapilla's at all. On a positive note the green chile pasta was pretty good even if the chicken that came with it was dry. The food was heated on the plate and half of the chile was stuck/burnt to the plate.

9asmuytaHKa6v9QQvghTRw.text: We took friends out to dinner last Saturday night- food was a 4 but service was horrible which is why we give the restaurant a 1.  First- it took 2 calls to get a reservation.  When we initially called, the woman that answered said she had to "confirm with her manager" and would get back with us in 48 hours.  After receiving no call back for four days, I had to call them back.  Next, at the table, the waiter just could not fathom or remember that our friend was unable to have milk product.  Even after the loooonnng, drawn-out conversation while ordering, he STILL brought her salad with cheese on it (totally discussed during the ordering process).  Finally, and this is the biggest downer of the evening, the bill seemed high and I couldn't see well in the restaurant because of the dimmed lights, but I signed it and paid.  Next day I look it over... We were totally OVERCHARGED... charged for 2 drinks we never had, and the drinks we actually ordered we wrong on the bill.  OVERCHARGED!!!  Don't trust this restaurant... I tried to contact them 4 days ago, received a VM that said to leave a message and they would call back.  No call back.  I left another message a bit ago.  This is seeming like a scam... I'm about to go to the authorities and report it... Very frustrating.  We will not be back and I don't think you should consider going.

p1AjSKDWF7G8GUwml31y8A.text: It was a disappointing evening last Saturday when a group of us went out to celebrate our Friend's Anniversary.  It was mainly the service by our waitress that seemed lackluster and nonchalant.  In addition when I asked a couple of question about the menu, she seemed confused and not very knowledgeable about the menu items. In fact another person in our party also asked a question and her response was a blank stare and lack of knowledge.  In a menu that's not typically traditional, knowledge is essential.  There was also a mix up where our order of mushrooms ended up going to another table while we waited an unreasonable amount of time for it.  I ordered the NY strip which was ok, but not worth the price.  I did like the butter corn side though, that was tasty.  I really have no reason to return to Richardson, the menu isn't my taste, which is not their fault, just personal preference, but I feel that if we had a different server, our evening would have gone a little better.

H1q_m6iFLXKRr1ow8qc0xw.text: I am New Mexican. The food is mediocre and overpriced. The staff and management don't care what their customers think. I took my staff for a birthday dinner. I was thoroughly disappointed. This is not New Mexican food but a glorified attempt. Don't waste your time or money at this uppity joint!

rL2jNq_4yl7G6Jh7vZSbsA.text: Honestly was not at all impressed. The atmosphere is really nice, but that was where it stopped. Went with a group of six, we all agreed that our food was too spicy to really enjoy. On top of that, it is fairly expensive for what you get. I have a hard time paying $20-$30 for Mexican food.

OSXQnTb8KUxE-brKAHBzxw.text: I love this place.  It's consistent, it has great flavor and a myriad of options.  I never get bored eating here.  I sometimes just get an appetizer and that is PLENTY of food.

Ovyp3FTBc5mHGZPWkHzCSw.text: Everything here is very delcious.  The red chile is amazing. Great atmosphere and wonderful  food.  Perfect place for a date..

9qekwIGG2dS2lm2yW3FIpA.text: The most amazing New Mexican food anywhere.   We keep trying to find similar and can't!  Enough said!

vb5UKcJJScOC8wdCOXqvdw.text: I've heard so much about this place, but I was not impressed.  The service was subpar, and that's a compliment. We had 2 to 3 servers, who didn't communicate with each  other, so we never got what we requested. We had fish that was overcooked, and waited forever to get knives to even begin our meal.  The food was good, but for the money and the bad service... Not worth the price.

gqf5fANi7xKwBtmdwxtFyA.text: Food was very good.  The service was terrible. We waited at least 5-10 minutes to be greeted by our server after being seated and it never got better.

OvGciiIUqskHQn_oi0nJsQ.text: Enjoyed a lovely date night dinner here. Carne avodados was the highlight of our meal, though the trio of desserts and prickly pear margarita were excellent as well. Portions are large and love the atmosphere.

6aPAQ1siNiqkXvHblL7hMQ.text: The very best New Mexican cuisine the Valley. In fact it was better ( in my opinion ) than some of the Mexican food I have had in New Mexico.( Sorry New Mexico but I just had to say that)......Frank Parks....Scottsdale

zcoL8cb68ZPemT3NZkjjTg.text: New Mexican cuisine! This is the perfect neighborhood spot! The Green Chili Potato is a must, but don't jump into it until you ask for a taste first!! The heat will take you to another level! No refunds!! LoL The Mole is tasty and I love the overall cuisine served here. The atmosphere is typical southwestern with a nice patio area. They have regular Valet service and the staff are pleasant.

yNQmPMAY-uMNGgXABsEkQA.text: We were a group of 6 with reservations. Horrible experience.  Food came out in groups of 2 in 20 minutes increments.  2 meals were burnt and had to be remade.  We couldn't even eat a meal together!!  When explained to the manager's all we hear is how they are busy.  No apology and didn't even seem to care.  I guess they are trying to become less busy.  This is clearly 1 way to make sure that happens.  Avoid this place.

UuktlujgEVYJZfF5St4PAg.text: Funny still have the same opinion of this restaurant. I ordered over the phone. Pasta Heidi and a chocolate cake. It was okay but not worth the cost. I forced my self to eat my 10$"cake" and the pasta was more al dente than I have ever had in a restaurant.... NM sorry this resteraunt represents your amazing cuisine

4mCylVd32czAKDTj43nmbw.text: What an unplanned treat. Sad to admit that we have not been here since the big fire many years ago. We liked it then, but always found a new restaurant to try instead - then after a long hiatus, it was off our radar.  Well last night we were in the area close to happy Hour and both said " let's see if it's still as good. The place was hopping. Not an available table in sight - but there were 2 seats at the bar. A deep dazzling shiny copper bar with a very busy, but attentive bartender. We ordered our drinks and dinner. Everything was  Delish. It is a noisy place inside, so not conducive to chat with friends, but in cooler weather the patio looks so inviting.  Can hardly wait for the triple digit days to end, so we can try it. And, the patio is dog friendly, if your doggie is too!

o_btswuGnHD-zsg_dxRpIg.text: This place was amazing!! My mom is from New Mexico and typically wants to eat New Mexican style food for her birthday so we took her to this gem.  The garlic app was definitely amazing and fulfilling. For some reason none of seemed to think the plates would be that big but they are HUGE!!!  We had leftovers for days. Would definitely return in the future.

-eiqo4pu6HfBpeNmHiE9Sg.text: I am very disappointed in this restaurant.  We made a reservation to meet friends out on a Saturday night to celebrate my husband's birthday - we reserved the table on OpenTable at least 4 hours prior, and included notes in the reservation that we would need a high chair for our baby.  The restaurant description made it seem like a family, friendly, casual place, but to our disappointment when we arrived they told us they did not have high chairs or booster seats.  Their solution was to put us in a booth.  Our young child can't sit up by himself while trying to self feed in a booth.  He can't even reach the table!  We asked if their adjoining restaurant had a high chair or booster seat we could borrow, and they said they didn't have any either.  This blew my mind.  Maybe I am being naive, but we have taken our son to some fine dining establishments in the Valley and they have always been able accommodate our need for a high chair.   This sounds like age discrimination to me.  They have to provide ramps for ADA or elderly people that use wheelchairs or walkers.  Due to our son's age, he too requires assistance during dinner in the form of a high chair or booster seat.   Unfortunately we had to cancel our plans with our friends because it was a Saturday night and it was too late to get a reservation elsewhere.   I am upset that they couldn't have even called us based on our note in OpenTable about needing a high chair, and given us a curtesy heads up that they didn't have any.  Had they done that, at least we could have found another reservation in a timely manner elsewhere, to celebrate my husband's birthday.  Btw- our child is very well behaved and doesn't create an unpleasant dining experience for others eating in the restaurant.  If he did,  we wouldn't take him out.  And if the restaurant is trying to avoid having small children, I have experienced plenty of unruly toddlers eating in restaurants that do not require high chairs - so they still are exposed to slightly older kids coming there.  They should just post on their website, or at the very least put a sign on their door reading "small children unwelcome" next to the "no firearms" sign.  I mean, they are basically one in the same, right?    #babieshaverightstoo

t9D0G4_ozVskQB2ilxLhnA.text: It had been a while since I'd been to Richardson's and not since it moved to the new location in combination with The Rokerij. Maybe it's because the now two times I've visited recently I've sat at the bar ( and am only reviewing based on those experiences, admittedly ), maybe it's just that I have too much bias from my memories of the old location but it's just not the same. While we were able to park our own car today, the usual mandatory valet requirement is a huge turn off.   The bar at the old Richardson's was a comfortable, friendly place you wanted to hang out at with friends, the restaurant was usually busy, vibrant and fun; you didn't much mind the wait to sometimes get in. Now it just feels like a bar. The interior here is impressive and frankly pretty cool, but the feel is different. A usual staple, the Prickly Pear margarita, is much too sweet now and seems to have not much kick to it. I'll stick to the nice wine or beer selection from now on if I return.    What does remain is that distinct aroma of wood-fired goodness promised within but I'll reserve comment on that as well until I try more of the menu; I did sample the calamari, which I enjoyed a lot but wasn't crazy about the sweet dipping sauce. I expect the food is still pretty good though overall the prices seem a bit high in general. The staff has been generally friendly but not overly enthusiastic.   I will very likely update this review some time in the future once I put more time in here, try out the restaurant proper and maybe the Rokerij. Still, to me, the character is decidedly different and I'm not sure whether that's good or not.  May have to see how Dick's Hideaway has fared since....

9bIgCU2r_si_5CYxBwKbQQ.text: I had really shitty service here, and the food was mediocre. I'm from New Mexico and was looking forward to some homestyle cuisine.

LcWYzUWdduuVGdJG54p1vQ.text: Took the family there for my anniversary. This was a recommendation from a co worker. The parking is complimentary which is a good thing as it is coupled with another restaurant and they seem to be land locked. The restaurant has a cozy feel about it with a mixture of bar, booth, or patio seating. The Mrs. and I both had top shelf margaritas and we were not the least bit disappointed. We then moved to some of the best calimari I have ever had. On to the main course. Our top sirloin steak was cooked perfectly and had great flavor with the portables mushroom and seasonings. My wife got the Brussels sprouts with her steak. I hate Brussels sprouts with a passion, but WOW we're these good. I had the corn which was excellent. The green Chile potato was excellent. My son had the sea food pasta which he said was very good. The shrimp and scallops were nothing to laugh at, they were yuge! Desert was a chocolate cake served with chocolate sauce and raspberries and blue berries. Yummmy!   Well, that's was out 26th Anniversary, and I am glad we spent it in such a quality restaurant. Next time I'll have some fish or Mexican food. They have a nice variety but don't overwhelm you with to many choices. Price was adequate for the quality of food. I highly recommend reservations!

6zqpj5cyX36TU-4b9vbppw.text: Went last sat night. Walked out without eating. Walked in and all I saw were flies all over the place. They were on the tables, flying around the room, all over the place. The last straw was ordering a drink at the bar and there were flies all over the lemons, limes, olives. The bartender swipes at a fly on a lemon and then grabs the lemon and puts it in my drink and wants to charge me $11.00 for a gin martini with fly juice. Gross! Never again.

Mkcs9Qeg7PPAG0sKP5uG0A.text: Having lived in New Mexico for 16 years, I ate and drank all that was. I believe I have found my New Mexican fix here at Richardson's. The menu is imaginative, extremely well presented and very, very delicious. I had the Chimayo Chicken that came with acorn squash and a green chile potato and it was pure heaven. My wife had the Carne Adovada burrito and it was very tasty as well.  The red chile sauce was thick and lingering just as it should be. I highly recommend Richardson's for those of you who crave your New Mexican fix and those of you who have never had the pleasure.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Lunch Menu
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The New Mexican con Queso is just right. Spinach, onions and chorizo make this appetizer awesome.

WpREVqY_oV5PAMfbW3QyUg.text: Food is acceptable.  A bit over done a bit Over priced for what it is.  Worst is the power game the parking lot valet's cocky attitude.  I want to self park but it is not allowed. In spite of being willing to tip the ppl.  Very rude unpleasant valet. I have been here 5 times and can never say it has been a good over all experience.  I will never go back to endue pain and suffering.  I'm done.

rrWFiMFT061D-0xKe5fLAA.text: As you can see by my 5 star rating, I love this place.  My wife and I have been Sunday brunch regulars here for years and I can't imagine spending my Sunday morning anywhere else.  If you like New Mexico cuisine, this place is ground zero (White Sands reference intended).  For me, the Eggs Breakfast is nirvana, especially if I just finished a Sunday long run.  There's nothing like a big plate of eggs (over medium), pork medallions and hash browns to satisfy the hunger generated by a marathon training schedule.  Everyone from the valet staff to the servers to the cooks know us, because they're all here every time we come.  The lack of turnover is another sign of how well run this restaurant is.  Give it a try, you'll probably like it.  The love affair will come after a few visits....

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RWY159pM5Ez5KHx0kMinZQ.text: The food and atmosphere were good. Service was great. The problem I had was since there's no self parking we used Richardson's valet. We got our car, drove home then the next morning saw that my car, my Jaguar, was damaged by the valet. I have called 4 times starting at 8 the next morning and no one will take or return my calls. I am so disappointed! I will never return and will make sure other potential guests are aware of this! Very unprofessional!

2a-2IUaXgA61a-6gKOgbyg.text: Food was good, drinks were alright, our server, Michelle was sweet but it didn't really seem like she knew what she was doing... She didn't mention any of the drink specials and did not pace any of our food out, so it all came at once. And then she brought us the check when we didn't even ask for it? It was our cousins 50th birthday and we spent quite a bit of money. Perhaps she is new and in need of more training....?

8S0mLqgXJgxAeqs77abapg.text: Had the pan seared salmon it was so unbelievably great perfectly seared on each side pink in the middle with the capers in the sauce Homerun.

OTnVUej8z_C-vhSmpYDczA.text: My favorite out to dinner place in PHX.  Service is spectacular, CJ in the outside bar is funny as Hell, and Jamie, well she's very friendly, and quite a looker.  Oh, the food by the way is outstanding.  Try the enchiladas, pork chop, and my favorite, the pasta Heidi.  If you only have one place to eat in PHX, this is it.

k0zAmIwgh8NdJuGNQ7n-qw.text: I only come here for breakfast/ brunch and I only order one thing the Eggs Benedict Jalapeno. I've had most of their breakfast and lunch items but every time I order something else I regret it. As a younger man I had them the first time I was there and it was love at first taste. I came back as frequently as I could trying everything I could on their menu. As I have aged Richardson's has taught me that I don't need to be so damn adventurous. I mean I had to honestly ask myself do I really need all of the heart racing excitement of ordering the unknown, wondering if it is going to be any good. The honest answer here is when you find the perfect breakfast item at a place just roll with it. Richardson's Eggs Benedict Jalapeno is my breakfast soul-mate.

1T26SiPpsTBBtLwALGGAEw.text: Many people are recommending the Chimayo chicken & I agree it was delicious! I am from New Mexico so it is a little different but feels like home

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chimayo chicken

pFQmOjFU-yyO9RI9PIPZjA.text: The food was wonderful, but the service at the bar was TERRIBLE. I MEAN THE WORST EVER. The bartender got my first drink and never came back to ask if I wanted another one. Then he looked and saw me with my card in my hand and ignored me. It took 10 minutes for him to bring me my check I felt like I had been taken hostage. The food was great but I'd never come back due to the poor service.

nyS1-eoy0Hmz43AaYhX8wg.text: They do not offer self-parking, the parking is all valet.  We parked on the lot, and the valet company used someone's car to block us while demanding keys.  We said "no" and were further harassed.  When asked about self-parking we were told to park at a different business.  Now furious, trying to leave, the valet used the patrons automobile to block the exit.    Be very afraid of a valet person using your auto as a weapon.

Jw56KvkBkCSsPUNOx0bpLw.text: Food is awesome being from NM- like amazing. But service - being in the industry.. ehh.

dbTboY4xSPOPnVMWkZT33w.text: Very cool atmosphere. Five of us had brunch. Everything was very tasty and the portions were huge.  Would like to go back without kids and enjoy the multiple bars.

Vzi9Ruo3g0nNo4BwWdAPCA.text: I've always wanted to eat at Richardson's and I finally did-  My family of three walked in on a Saturday night (around 5:30) without a reservation and we were sat in a corner booth full of pillows. I loved that it was dark and private with the Red Hot Chili Peppers playing softly over the speakers. The bar was packed and so was the dining room.   When you are an Arizona native you know that salsa is important - three salsa's were served: habanero, spicy pico and a mild (for the kid!). I ordered the blackened scallops with three dipping sauces, rice and beans. 2 thumbs up! My husband ordered the tasty Santa Fe chicken - lot's of flavor! The buttermilk ranch dressing is heavenly if you like that sort of thing.   Nice beer and wine list. They also have top dollar margarita that I plan to partake in after my pregnancy. We will be back! Maybe for breakfast?

VM3XW0MRrEkt0n0aivkpHg.text: ******* 1 star service/ 4 star food ******  What a nightmare!!! What was supposed to be a birthday meal meal for a friend, quickly turned out to be a sideshow...  When we asked the waitress if the special of the night "green chile pasta" had seafood, she adamantly stated no. When asked what type of pasta it was made with she had no clue. She the proceeded to inch her way over to the next table of diners and poke them for the answer. After much debate the patrons determined it was a rice noodle. This was very uncomfortable for all parties.   2 of us received our meals. When Our birthday friend received his pasta special... It was decorated with shrimp. We specifically asked about seafood due to allergies and were told no seafood was included. When we advised our server that we could not accept the meal due to the seafood, she shrugged us off and said she would send over the waitress. Once the waitress arrived we explained the allergy situation again and advised her that this could not be eaten... Instead of apologizing for her error, she asked if we wanted them to "remove" the shrimp??? We stated to her that it would need to be remade. With some resistance she took the plate. 10 minutes later a shrimp free version arrived.  Our birthday guest had to wait 10 more minutes than we did to receive his food. We opted to eat our dishes, otherwise, we would have had cold dishes ourselves....  The total bill for this event was $ 154.00 + tax. I tipped the waitress $40.00 as a courtesy as I was advised she split tips with the busboy and server- who very polite and on point.  I proceeded to email Richardsons to advise of the experience. It has been 2 + weeks and not a word from this restaurant. I was not looking for anything except an apolgy and ownership for ruining a birthday celebration.  This restaurant is far from a 3 star service level... What a shame as the food is exceptional. Recognizing that the entire experience is key when charging $25.00 + price points for meal is a must in this competitive market.  Stick to Barrio Cafe as they have the formula for success down. I will never eat here again and route all co-workers, family and friends elsewhere.

9r-QngMI3HRUnnDyYSeu0g.text: My son and his fiance brought us and a friend here Saturday night for dinner. We had a reservation but arrived an hour early to sit at the bar for a drink. The hostess was pleasant (with beautiful light lilac colored hair) and said she could get us a table early, which she did within 20 minutes.   Our server was prompt, knowledgeable and very helpful. I am a vegetarian so I read menus whenever possible before my first visit to a restaurant. I knew going into this place that there wasn't a selection for vegetarians, but I held out hope that the there were sides not listed on the menu that I could have them put together for me, which they did.   We ordered appetizers - the roasted garlic plate was delicious! I didn't try the other appetizer plate that was primarily dead stuff, but everyone else said it was wonderful. For dinner I tasted one of their potato stuffed chilies and that was very tasty; I also had sauteed vegetables, rice and beans. I presume the rice was cooked on broth, but I didn't ask. The beans were really good, but very salty. Most restaurants salt the heck out of their beans, though, so I won't deduct for that. I turned my plate of food into 3 meals!   Everyone else at the table loved their entrees. They said their meat/seafood was cooked perfectly with the right amount of sauce/seasoning.   I must commend our server again, he was a young guy who couldn't have been more accommodating. I read reviews where service was the biggest issue for other customers. Fortunately, that was not our experience.   We will definitely eat here again.   Pros: Unique Ambiance - great place to bring a date Service Accommodating  Food was fresh, hot, good flavor Valet parking Charming/cozy patio seating Intimate indoor setting Wine selection  Cons: Very little vegetarian faire  Valet parking the only parking option A little on the pricey side

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted Garlic Plate - Very good

rx4uwiTh6M0LpMHKcrCJFA.text: Fantastic ambiance and fresh, tasty food!! We had never had New Mexico cuisine before and were pleasantly surprised. Prices ranged... It was worth every penny for the $4o Sea Bass. My only complaint was that my red wine was served too cold... We enjoyed having a drink in the joining bar downstairs... Quaint and cozy and busy. Had to wait awhile to get served.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AgifSxMrXNIT4q1z1FNKlw.text: We were referred by the Sheraton Grand hotel.  The front of the house staff were friendly and informative. The Pueblo style and warm ambience were inviting.  The layers of flavors were quite remarkable.  Overall an Outstanding experience. We will be back.

mZfW4vo9t2jk2z_bF5pahg.text: I go to Richardson's on every visit to Phoenix just for their Huevos Rancheros. It never disappoints!!  On my last visit, my cousin ordered Eggs Benedict Jalapeno with a jalapeno hollandaise that was wonderfully flavorful without the heat. I loved it so much that I put some of her hollandaise on my food!  I've only eaten breakfast here, but I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros- yum!!

dsJCcWE9BejE4Rg6KZu3WA.text: Ouch, where do I start? I should have known better when I realized they only had valet. Our dear friends recommended this place and were meeting us there, that is the only reason we stayed. We asked for self parking and they said to park at Runner's Den.... now I am wondering if they have an agreement with them or if they send people there just because. We sat and were welcomed by "Absolutely no split plates" and "no separate checks" notes on our menus. : ) Friendly business, uh? Our server was pushing for appetizers (asked multiple times before and after our friends arrived), but once we were ready to order she was nowhere to be seen for a while.  We also asked for straws and she gave them to us grabbing them from the top where your lips are supposed to go! I think that was by far the worse. Other than that she was OK and friendly. I do not know anything about New Mexico food but I do not have respect for places that spell adovada with a 'v', and that do not peel the green chiles : o Over all I thought the place was kind of 'uppity' for my taste (I am a very very simple gal), and I would at least have expected them to have options for artificial sweeteners, but they (oh surprise) only had the pink saccharine ones. OK, enough bickering : ) The food was good, the portions (other than the adovada) were generous and everyone agreed they were tasty. I think one of our friends had the New Mexico plate and it was huge. I am OK with the food, but for the prices they have I would expect excellent customer service and Stevia, Splenda or at least Nutrasweet. I am on a special diet but was even afraid to ask, lol... The hostess was very nice and friendly.

MA29M1g8zRmZ0kNdNZlcRA.text: went on a tuesday, not too busy.  i had the sea bass, others had the porterhouse.  service was good, seabass was excellent.  portions are quite large so i would stay away from appetizers.  overall good southwestern food.  nice bar and outside lounge area.

hIQ6oYcEH65L4CUsm5csyw.text: Thank you, Richardson's for delivering, once again, an exceptional dining experience. We stumbled onto your great New Mexican (yes! there is a difference) cuisine back in the 90s when we lived in the area.  We were thrilled when you reopened.  We have friends visiting us from FL and they are definite "foodies."   There was only one place that was a "must" place to eat while they were here.  Jason, our server, was fantastic and fun. His suggestions were outstanding. Another terrific Carne Adovada and the servings are so large we all have lunch tomorrow.  We drive from Anthem and it is SO WORTH IT! I don't say that about too many restaurants.   Thanks, Jason. It's staff like you that keep us coming back. You are awesome.

EzzP2gM96o5A4a_q5ZRdRQ.text: This place is definitely worth a try. My family and I came here for a nice hearty brunch and we were not disappointed.   All the dishes we tried were so flavorful. I tried the enchiladas: tried one cheese and one green chile pork. The green chile pork was my favorite. My husband had the carne adovada benedict. I will definitely order that next time. The meat was so tender and had a great smokiness to the red chile. The only downside to the meal was that all over our eggs were over cooked. I didn't send the eggs back but my father did and they were happy to give him eggs cooked to his liking. Overall, we were happy with our experience at Richardson's.  Also, just a heads up, they have valet. I'm not sure if they always have valet but they had it when we went.

843jdyqjh0n1_6HKbaRaBg.text: Oh Richardson's, how I love thee. Once again you blow my mind and taste buds.   This has been my favorite restaurant in Phoenix for years. I remember the first time I visited the the original restaurant and my frequent visits to the one of the three variations, always amazing. I love the little touches,  the gcp- green Chile potato, the way your dinner comes with a flour tortilla buried below sweet and spicy sauces and is just the right stuff to sop up every last ounce of flavor. The fresh tomatillo salsa and of course the green chiles found throughout. Tonight was once again fantastic and as I've never commented, I felt this time it was right.   We sat at the bar,  service was quick. Drinks delicious. Ordered tomatillo toast, roasted garlic and the taos combo- tonight the adovado quesadilla, bacon wrapped shrimp and new mexico sausages. Superb. Flavors are so on. Not just your typical southwestern restaurant by any stretch. I've never been to New Mexico and I can't comment on authenticity to their cuisine, but I can say the originality, combination, flavor burst, portion size are to die for. My friend was blown away. To quote..."i wanted a quesadilla, but this is the best meal I've had in ages", and yes it was. This place has been cooking for 20 some years, maybe more and still crushing it, for good reason: the food is unbelievable and the experience legit, not playbook. Take that sam fox.  Keep on being awesome Richardson. Still my favorite restaurant in Phoenix by far.

aqebVOyxnamfwka_NBvmpw.text: Extremely disappointed in Richardson's and the Rokery. We stopped in today for lunch and asked for a table. There were at least 4 open tables, the larger tables, but still they were open. The bartender and then the hostess were only willing to seat us at the bar since we were a party of two. We were looking for a sit down lunch in which we planned to eat and enjoy several drinks.  We walked out after realizing the staff had no desire to accommodate us or concern for losing a customer. We decided to go down to the Rokery to see if the attitude was different there. It was complete empty yet all the tables said reserved.  We asked the bartender if we could sit at a table. He had to excuse himself to go upstairs to ask permission. That was enough for us. There are too many good places to eat in Phoenix.  Oh by the way, until today we were loyal regulars to all three Richardson's restaurants.

bGF66HJaaZCzn0Ggd00UxA.text: I love Richardson's. Incredible food, great service. One of the best places to eat in Phoenix

K-q7tBau2d4-oGaq55ekjw.text: Life changing, absolutely!  Finally made it out to Richardson's after hearing nothing but good things about this restaurant. Right as we walked up you could smell the amazingness, is that a word??? Who cares... because the aroma had nothing on the the way the food danced off my tongue. Such a cute dim room, perfect for a date night, and I have to say that I was very impressed the the music selection. I mean who doesn't want to hear great tunes while enjoying a meal. Anyway let's get down to the meal.  We ordered the New Mex con Queso, delicious! Great flavor not too spicy, fresh green chilies and spinach topped with Schreiner's Chorizo. The waiter asked if we had been there before and continued to tell us about their "Signature Dishes". I was already looking at the Pork Chop Chorizo when he sold me on the dish. For $27 you get a pretty decent size salad, fresh and crisp with jalopeno ranch. A side of Richardson's Famous Green Chili Potato, some mixed veggies and the glorious 14oz Pork Chop, double stacked stuffed with chorizo. This sits on top a large tortilla with beans, now you don't want to discard the base, you want it to soak up all the juices from the meat. I made sure to eat each bite of the chop with the beans and tortilla. Holy cow, was it marvelous. It arrives to the table in all it's glory on a silver platter, literally... my mouth dropped. I was not expecting anything of that size, and let me tell you about the icing on the cake or the chop for that matter...Mango Chutney. That definitely gave it the over the top, out of this world, better tan sex flavor...OMG heavenly!  Now, I do consider myself somewhat of foodie for sure...but I have to say, I have not had anything that amazing in a long time. I was expecting to have some great grub but I did not think I was going to come home still salivating over my dinner. Thank god I have more then half left over for lunch. This is for sure my new favorite place, can't wait to come back again. All in all the atmosphere, great wait staff, and quality of food, I give this gem 2 thumbs up! Richardson's I will see you soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo Pork Chop
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side view

BgTZK6ouXanRlwHHSR1AaA.text: We have been in Phoenix for 23 years. We moved here from Tucson and haven't found a great Mexican restaurant until now.   Food is fresh and beautiful  Tana was a very attentive waitress. She is great

Uw4PHfEh3tzpN3Q3CAuA9w.text: Richardson's is New Mexican Cuisine and is similar to Mexican and Tex Mex but is slightly different. The Big Things here are the Potato stuffed green chile and the do you want Red or Green Chile Sauce question.  I tried the Santa Fe Chicken. It came out on a very large ornate silver platter. I have to say everything on my plate was delicious! The chicken was pecan grilled and was very moist and flavorful. It was topped with sauteed mushrooms and Jalapeno hollandaise sauce and served over tasty garlic toast. It was delicious as it was but I though it was shy with the jalapeno. I had my choice of side and went with the house specialty Potato stuffed Green Chile. It had some heat to it but not too much and was delicious. Also on my plate was a very large salad that was mostly cheese. For me it was WHEY too much cheese but the salad was fresh and lightly dressed with a very thin white dressing.  My husband tried the New Mexican Enchiladas. He had a trio of pork, chicken and beef Christmas Style with Red and Green Chile Sauce also filling the plate was rice and beans. He said everything was seasoned nice and everything tasted different and his plate was also very generous with LOTS OF CHEESE.  Based on this one exsperience the food seems solid but you'll need to cheddar a few pounds if you eat all the cheese.  You Cheddar believe it.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New Mexican Enchiladas
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Santa Fe Chicken

wS3tqLAH1K-S5f_Lh8gq7w.text: See my review of Dick's Hideaway for more details on this company's self righteous attitude.   So, I was planning a birthday dinner party. If you've ever been to Richardson's patio and sat at the big table outside on a beautiful AZ evening or day, you know why I thought it would be nice to have the party there.   Well, I called 40days ahead of time to try and reserve the space. They will not speak with you about it on the phone and instruct you to email them with your request. So, I did. 25 days later, I'd not heard back from them so I called. I was told to email again. I did. Then 10days before my event,  I emailed again stating that I was very dissappointed that they hadn't replied and that I guess I'll find another venue. So I did. After all, if you're expecting to get a party of 15 at a nice table on a Saturday night during high season, you'd better plan ahead!   Literally, LITERALLY, the day before on Friday afternoon, they called me to see if I still wanted the table. LOL! Really!!?? As if I would have thought for one minute that that would come through and I'd be able to tell 15 guests on Friday night, where to be on Saturday night!   Clueless. Entitled. They have lost ALL perspective.

CWQJdyRPqEMcklFx79VbJw.text: Loved this restaurant!!! Food was excellent! They have a nice outdoor patio. Would come back if im ever in town again. The Adovada benedict was soooooo good.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is a must try!! Adovada Benedict

u6tU8D_D8-9wOEugbGdjsw.text: My family and I have been coming to Richardsons for over 15 years at least once a month. My Dad recently experienced some health issues and needs a wheel chair. We called to make a reservation for an ADA table and was told they couldn't make the reservation less than four people. Two weeks earlier, we called and got the reservation. The man of the phone was rude, unwilling to help us at all. I even told him of our patronage and previous reservation. He basically hung up on me. We will never go to this establishment ever again. You just lost a 15 year costumer.

foIx8Diu1hNk-DiA9BzWGg.text: My friend and I went in for brunch because it was recommended by a few friends and...wow! We both loved it! 5.00 mimosas and bloody Mary's?! So good.  Nothing about Richardsons was lacking. The service was great, the prices are fair for the quality of food and the atmosphere is awesome! Love the copper and dim lighting.  Sunday brunch at Richardsons is my new go-to.  Also, the outside bar is a nice touch and the bartenders are always easy going and creative enough to make you speciality drinks. -I only say this because I am allergic to syrups, but they always seem to substitute the syrups without sacrificing the flavor so I am able to enjoy it!   Definitely get patio seating and ask for Max or Adam !!!! - best service from those two.

XslxR-wMevei1bfsOPOuJA.text: My husband and I enjoyed Richardson's for years and were devastated when the original location burned down. Until recently, we hadn't had an opportunity to visit the new location that's in the same building as Rokerji, but some friends came to visit and we decided to take them. I have to say that we were delighted to see that the decor was exactly as it was in the original restaurant! The service was as fantastic as it's always been, and the food is unparalleled.
