Everything is prepared perfectly. I highly recommend the pinenut encrusted sea bass!

2d7ZaB9VdeHmIxHl95LRtA.text: The chile rellenos are delicious! I ordered the pork and smoked turkey. I wish the smoked turkey had been pulled apart more but this is a minimal issue. The green chile was the perfect sauce too.

34A76Ai-ulYvoT1kqkTMNA.text: Wonderful what a treat , just found it on yelp after we flew in and boy were we blown away . My husband had the pork it was so well seasoned with out sauces , wow thank goodness he shared , my daughter and I both ordered the chicken which was wrapped around spinach and cheese also very good , we could not eat everything such big portions you might want to share . We were staying at a hotel without a refrigerator so we couldn't take left overs . This is the place I will send people to and come back to every time I am in town

e8vLwc0IXnXvI08sso194Q.text: I am such a huge fan of southwestern food and this place does the trick. Be careful that the food can be pretty spicy as a whole. The ambience is very chill and dark, like a lodge.   My fave dishes are the bacon wrapped shrimp, scallops, and the roasted garlic plate. That garlic plate does me in with the sauces and soft elephant garlic to spread on bread. Wow! I just wish they didn't put a tortillas on the bottom of every plate. The prices can be a little high but the dishes are delicious.   Parking is valet and happy hour is so-so.

aYdYs8puMa3-FfMMOp6nfQ.text: This is high end Mexican food. The ambience is so wonderful as well as the service and food. It is very cozy so great for a date.

zHlZIqHkqBgXQe4zYHC3Qg.text: We had such a poor experience with this place last night.  Things started off poorly when there was clear conflict between the hostess and the server, Susanne.  After several attemps our party of three was finally sat. Our waitress gave us a couple of snide responses on menu questions   "what's in your Mexican style ceviche?"  "Its just ceviche."  That's not helpful.  Turns out it is fish and shrimp with tomatoes, onion and jalapenos.    I explained my food allergy and she claimed the tacos were safe to eat after going off to check.  She did say they sometimes garnish with peppers but that it could be left off.  I ordered tacos and reminded her off my allergy.  I took one bite, swallowed a pepper and immediately reacted.  I was very sick the rest of the night and into this morning.  I had to run to the bathroom to avoid throwing up at the table.  The worst part is that the manager (i think his name was Frank) lied and said he had seen the ticket with the no peppers written on it! He later admitted to lying because it was not written on the ticket.  We had to force them to comp the meal we never ate (one appetizer and 1 order of tacos and 3 drinks that were never drunk).    This level of service is ridiculous!  I clearly explained my food allergy and asked about ingredients in order to enjoy a business dinner out of town.  The experience at this place and their handling of it was appalling.

jbKCFH57ny-N4r-LWaIUWg.text: Was just there for a company Christmas party and let me tell you, awful service. I never got my salad prior to my dinner, fucking salad never came. Never got a chips refill, service staff was awkward and not interested in working. Had a way different experience last time we were there in a big group. The food quality was also lame. Subpar. Mixed drinks were also on the verge of being pure ice and water. Wont ever ever go there again. Cant believe that a big group received such poor and awful service.

B3wk3EKAD1a3iA7MGI2e1w.text: The Carne adovada never fails in its deliciousness.  Richardsons is a definite "go to" place when we are in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

R3JSQn68Ax-P1Q-5SL-EFA.text: After reading reviews on Richardson's, I wasn't sure what to expect. I grew up on New Mexican fare and it is not an easy cuisine to perfect. I was also a little reluctant toward the menu as their vegetarian options seemed few and far between.   We visited the restaurant with another couple who are avid carnivores. We were pleasantly surprised to find something on the menu for everyone. My husband and I split the chili rellenos and cheese enchiladas. The beans are vegetarian but the rice is not so in lieu of it, we were able to get a green chili potato (ridiculously tasty). The food was delightfully packed with heat -- the kind of heat that's cured by a bowl of ice cream or more of what caused the burn in the first place. It IS spicy so be sure to heed the warning on their menu. I dabbed my forehead with a napkin more than once.   To me, there's something about a server who knows her stuff. Our server was fantastic. We wanted for nothing during our entire experience and she knew exactly what was safe for us to eat as vegetarians.   I don't agree with others who think this place is overpriced. Our party of four had the same number of entrees, a bottle of wine, and two cocktails for $120. And yes, they only have valet parking. Welcome to any good restaurant in Phoenix. Can't wait to visit again and get my sweat on!

SCWDclzjPT4aVoLZYEojXw.text: Great atmosphere, margaritas and New Mexican food .... and free valet!   But tip your valet guy, of course ha!

sHsvHXGg3u9Lw0wMGvUp2A.text: The ambiance to this place was nice, and can be perfect for a date spot. :)   I met up with a friend of mine. The hostess that lead me to my table, seem like she didn't like her job at all. I didn't get a grin or smile,nothing.  I ordered the vegetarian New Mexico enchiladas.  OHHH MYYYY GOOOODNESSSSSSS. Deliciousness to my mouth. :)))))))) the rice, beans to the enchiladas was perfect!!!! I almost killed that dish. And you know what else was perfect??  My  pomegranate  margarita. Yes.. very friendly drink :D   I'll definitely return again.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pomegranate magarita and my New Mexico enchiladas.  Yummmmmmm :)

WxKOyvcmRohaUQsQIqclTw.text: Been here about a hundred times. The wine is always good, better than most other restaurants. The food is also quite awesome. Unfortunately they keep taking the items I like off of the happy hour menu and raising the prices. Still a great place to eat late night.

1OoeQwkD7HNQLAsUpq5NPg.text: Awesome food, awesome service and an even more awesome patio!(three awesome's).   It's going to be 108 today but you wouldn't know it on the patio, Mattie took awesome care of us (and everyone else at the bar) and breakfast enchiladas and Mimosas can make anyone happy!  Skip the chains, skip the "new" places and go to one of the best brunch places in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

E7gqdo2dz3zjyGvzGk1FIg.text: Went here with family for dinner last night as we had heard so much about this place. But I guess it was not a wise decision since we don't eat pork/beef and usually love to try the shrimp/ fish dishes so a word of caution for someone who is a pescatarian/ vegetarian.   We ordered phx donkey, prickly pear margarita and old fashioned to start with. The drinks were ok but nothing special about them ... so you won't miss much.   Ambience is nice however we were totally let down by the food itself, seriously not a single shrimp option in the menu. We started with an appetizer of pan seared salmon and it was too dry and totally over cooked. I guess we just ordered the wrong dish. We were planning to have the Mahi Mahi with mango salsa but after trying the salmon weren't sure if they made fish well. So we had a combination platter with chicken tamale instead. The beans and rice were nice but the tamale even though they had generous amount of meat were far from flavorful.   May be their pork dishes are good but if you don't eat pork/ beef not sure if there are enough options as the fish isn't cooked right. We had to leave and have a dessert later as this was a total let down, I would have expected little more attention to detail esp at three figure price tag. Their specials for the day were in 35-50 price range. We didn't bother as we weren't sure if they would be worth a try after the start we had here.

tBblN68iMp_Z4Z3BVlKJ6Q.text: Fantastic first visit!  Brooke was an amazing server!  Southwestern enchiladas were terrific as were the homemade guacamole and chips!

5M1eY7bCi0WOogaR48yFBQ.text: I came in prepped by the raves of a family member: authentic Mexican food, fine cuisine, etc.  The prices were ridiculously high, the guac and $17 posole merely ok. My salad was delicious, but mostly thanks to a healthy heap of sour cream.   Excellent service on a slow night, I'll say that.

UWkIJxAYbix38aWB0llo2Q.text: This is the best place in the valley for cuisine that is from New Mexico. The portions are Enormous but totally bomb. I love how little the restaurant is with its character and dark feel. It is very unique and has its own vibe. I want to come back for brunch because the menu looks glorious. Highly recommend if you are hungry and want some authentic food.

eUf2DNm6r0b-pnkON7tbKQ.text: We decided to do an appetizer dinner. Well the food here was incredible! Pork Belly Trio was so good in a delicious BBQ Sauce Calamari was crispy and delicious with a sweet chili sauce. Chipotle ribs fall off the bone delicious New Mexico Sausage was awesome!  I'll definitely be back here on my next trip to Phoenix. If you are ever in Phoenix this is a must go place

Y-fXrJcFHxRBCOOphQjNgg.text: It pains me to write this review because I've been an enthusiastic, raving fan of Richardson's for something close to 25 years now. It is hands down, IMO, the best brunch spot in Phoenix (as long as you enjoy a bit of heat/spice). It used to be on my top three places for lunch & dinner as well & over the years I'd say I probably eat at Richardson's 4-6 times per month.   Here's the rub. (1) I don't think I've seen Dick (owner) on site for over ten years. I'm sure he worked it hard over the years and I'm sure he deserves to do whatever he's doing with his time--but its not the same place without him; (2) as a dinner option, the pricing has gotten way out of control over the last few years. Decent (used to be great) quality steak entrees that used to be $28-$34 are now priced over $50 (which places it in competition with Mastros & other top steak places). Richardson's (as well as The Rokerij--both within the same building) doesn't hold up at that price point. Their awesome Sea bass entree is now around $55 or $60 (again, its great...but this isn't Ocean Club).   Richardson's used to be a fantastic, comfortable neighborhood spot with great food & drinks that was terrific, whether dining alone at the bar or at a table with a group. Now, it's become a place I'll only go on at company expense. Makes me sad. For the record, the problems I've mentioned are clearly reflected in the volume of customers. Five years ago, the place was jamming every night of the week. Now, its easy to get a table or place at the bar pretty much anytime. I suppose all good things must end at some point--but this one hurts.

IuzNOgc3wYRyhzjXQeQwkQ.text: This is a touch of class infused with New Mexican style cuisine. Steeped deep with Hatch Green Chilies and New Mexican/Southwestern flair, these dishes are well conceived and incredible. The flavors abound and melt in your mouth.  The dining areas are upscale even though the dress code is not. The outside bar at the Rokerij is a treat and lends easy access to either dining location. There are a wide array of draft beers on tap, as well as a fairly extensive wine list that is sure to please any palate.  Twyla and I had the New Mexican Enchiladas that were well prepared and delicious. These gems showcase just enough heat to keep you alert but not so much that your ordering milk with dinner. The dress is casual and the ambiance is intimate. This is great date place to sit, chat, enjoy vino and find out what a weirdo you met on Mingle; kidding! However, whether a special occasion, chilling with the crew or a night out with that certain someone, Richardson's and the RokeriJ will fit the bill nicely. Check out their menus on line...  #Vino2 #Vino2ultimate #Vinosquared #IrishcatV2  #jimsboisset

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

29e2SmL3cdYKIGJrPLmeLA.text: Friends took us here for dinner and I was looking forward to it as we walked in.  The atmosphere was very nice, that real comfortable feeling as you walk through with fireplaces, stonework and old wood work, romantic.  Unfortunately there are two reasons I give it such a low rating.  My wife and I go out with other couples all the time and we eat out 3-4 times per week, and I was shocked when the server said he cannot do a split check it was policy.  I understand for larger groups or a few singles together, but there only 4 of us, 2 couples so 2 checks, and I've never been anywhere ever that would not do this for two couples. He said there was no way he could do this it is not allowed.  Then after ordering a grilled shrimp appetizer, for $24, and it came out burned.  For these prices that plate should never have left the kitchen or the food runner should have noticed, so we had to send it back but it took so long to get the server back and our friends finished their appetizer so we just told them to cancel it.  The entree was good and no complaints for that.  For a very expensive place I was disappointed in the service and burned food.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chop
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped grilled shrimp that were burned and had to send back
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Downstairs bar

wAf0JvwR_hGT4ZagF0HelQ.text: This is NOT a review about the restaurant!!!  This is an internet complaint about one of the servers, Jr.  He's incredibly rude!  He wasn't personable one bit and came off as snappy.  He was demeaning every time he spoke.  This is our absolute FAVORITE place to eat and I can't believe that my experience didn't meet my expectations ONLY because of this server.   Obviously I will continue to return because the food is amazing, but I hope I won't be seeing such rude employees at the best restaurant in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_J7jg1fB7DLB3sznoxmUIw.text: I was visiting Scottsdale on business and one of my colleagues suggested this place. We came here for dinner and the food was very good although a bit pricier in comparison to the portion size. A glass of wine can cost $15 and above.  We ordered the skewers for appz which were really very good - the flavours and char on the meat and veggies! My entree was the top sirloin which was great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nP7reZbMcJLUXn3dgN5R5Q.text: I overall had a good experience at Richardson's but it wasn't 100%. First, you must make a reservation. We had to sit at the very end of the bar and barley had a waiter. We ordered the steak quesadilla to start and it truly was the best thing I could have asked for. 2 months later and I still crave it. Why am I not rushing back to get it? It's 22.00 for not even a full quesadilla.

ccLzX9xB5mCiY82T2b9HgA.text: You can't get much better then this. Now this is not only Mexican'ish food but more Southwest or New Mexican style food. We started off with the Bacon Wrapped Gulf Shrimp. Then we had the stuffed Chili Relleno Platter and the Carne Adovada. This food was a ten stars. (yes, I know you can only give five stars). The service was great, and a great atmosphere to boot. Very, very busy and I can see why. When in Phoenix this will be a regular go to restaurant.

XPlLUlDiV7tq2wrdJch9vw.text: My husband and I are from California. Every time we come to Phoenix/Scottsdale area, our first stop is Richardson's or Dick's Hideaway. Both places have the best southwestern food ever! We've historically ordered their signature dish, carne adovada (smoked pork --smoked in pecan wood w/ red chili sauce)--which is awesome.  We went for brunch on Sunday and ordered the green chili potatoes and the Richardson's Combo: eggs Benedict with jalapeno hollandaise sauce, asparagus and two chicken green enchiladas. It was heaven. The Hollandaise sauce is stellar and the green chili potato which they are also known for was amazing. We sat at the bar and the service and food here never disappoints.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Richardson&#39;s combo...yum
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Richardson&#39;s..home of the green chili potato
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green chili potato

fCNak5a5KdUtIDqexeiWOg.text: If you are the person that doesn't like a noisy place then Richardson's isn't for you. And if you're craving for a Mexican or Italian food, this is definately not a good place to go to.  We ordered their signature Mexican food and we we're disappointed because the taste was not appetizing at all. It was too salty and a the meat was a bit chewy.  I'm not sure if we would come back in this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

W0yDDJ99AWRF_NwWkWmC9Q.text: Visited while on vacation, direct from airport.  Had a fair wait, with limited waiting area in the sun.  However... Food was Worth the wait, & service was good.  Seemed to focus on the repeat customers during our visit but was ok. If you like flavor, this is a great place.  I'll visit again.

71nBnIyzL7mb21yFnIzLFQ.text: The food is delicious. The drinks are awesome Party of 5 for a birthday but our waitress couldn't do separate checks? What restaurant makes you pay for other people's choices?  She would only split 5 ways.   Not happy.

6cR5QS8BpOznWWwZzvwuHw.text: I'm amazed that I haven't posted a review, after years upon years of patronage to both this new and old location. I always describe as upscale New Mexican with large portions.  Green or red? I love green, but sometimes I go for both.  My favorites: + smoked turkey enchiladas + Green Chile stew + breakfast tacos + can you say specials? Fresh fish specials served daily + GCP: Green Chile Potato + Pasta Heidi (Green Chile pasta linguine) + stuffed Anaheim peppers   Location: side by side to Rokerij- I check our both for whom has the better seating. Pro tip: you can usually order the same menu at both.  Decor: who doesn't love the custom hammered copper bars?  Weekends: if you have a group, make a reservation or your wait will be long.  Only thing I have ever disliked on their menu is the House salad: which I avoid.

DUnxbMrHvuCsq4GQHOzg3w.text: This is an old standard that we will never get tired of. Service is always top notch and the food is amazing!! My husband proposed to me at the original Richardson's so we love that they recreated a replica (complete with the copper) where we can celebrate our anniversary.

DMEJ6nSlZHgW_OkQVS3c7Q.text: This isn't your cheap Mexican food joint around the corner, but it's also not your haute Spanish fusion fine dining. What you get is a relaxed and unpretentious environment, large portions and good food.  Had dinner here with my wife and some friends. It's a good sized space inside, though there can be a wait during peak times. But they have a nice covered patio bar area where you can wait and grab a drink. The portions are huge. My wife and I shared the Carne Adovada and Chimayo Chicken, and probably had a full serving left over to take home. The Carne Adovada has a little kick to it with the red chili sauce, but the smoked pork is succulent and delicious. My wife thought the Chimayo Chicken was a bit too heavy for her liking, but I thought it was delicious. I'm looking forward to the leftovers :-)

vM8yUePRm1BJTqimI47FOw.text: I was in town for a conference and tried this place after reading the reviews.    We were greeted by the hostess quickly and waited at the bar for our table.  The bartender was attentive and served us a couple of drinks.  The ambiance is actually quite nice and cozy as folks have mentioned.  Our wait time to be seated was also about 40 minutes, so i would recommend coming when less busy or for happy hour and grabbing a seat at the bar.    The waitress seemed rather rushed and not attentive, as we had to ask for water.  Additionally, it was odd that the waitress did not even go over any of the daily specials noted on the chalkboards.  We ordered a fish taco special noted on the chalkboard and a relleno platter as well.  Both dishes were served rather late, after about 20 minutes of waiting.  The place was not really packed by the time we were seated.  The main courses were fair, but nothing really to write home about.  I was definitely expecting more.  We did try the flan, which was quite good.  The overall rating would have been three starts if our service was improved and the waitress took time to be more attentive and explain the menu items.

0-LiKzJ9EmYyd__NXLaWTQ.text: Still a five - without a doubt!!  We went here with another couple who are good friends.  They had never been to Richardson's before and so we were a little uneasy about whether they would like it as much as we do.  We arrived at 5:20 without reservations because for some reason I thought they didn't take reservations for under eight which they indeed do.  They take reservations for 4 and over.  Anyway, they seated us immediately but explained that our table had been reserved for 6:45 and would that work for us.  Yes, indeedy!!  Nabbed a great corner cozy booth!  One of the best in the house!!  As soon as we sat down we were served big glasses of ice water with lemon and asked if we wanted chips and salsa.  We had never ordered them before and they were really good.  They came warm, with a very flavorful guacamole, a salsa which tasted really great but was a little too warm for me and a couple other dips which I didn't try because I thought they'd be warmer than the salsa.   We ordered drinks - one Reisling, two house Margaritas and one Rob Roy on the Rocks.  Everyone was pleased with their libations!  Onto our dinner orders!   Two of us ordered the grilled shrimp pasta which was amazing!  I can't begin to guess how many calories were in that dish but it was so worth every bite and we both brought some home.  Our companions ordered two of their chicken items and were very pleased!    Our waiter was wonderful!  He was knowledgeable about the menu and spent time with us describing the various dishes.    They also have specials every night written on a chalkboard.  Lots of great sounding stuff, but oh my, that shrimp pasta was - ooh la la!  Will I be back?  Without a doubt if my chapter three in life lasts awhile longer!

pBnojsIdn4KJ8e1pcYnc1Q.text: Excellent food. The chili relleno and eggs were outstanding. My girl had the avodoba Benedict and that was very good as well. 6 people are couple of drinks and the tab was 150 so not bad. We will be back

juYCzdtLCpse-1RODDJsBA.text: Our group of four had dinner at Richardson's tonight and we are still waiting to have feeling return in our mouths. The guacamole was hot and this was before we added salsa, and our dinners consisting of enchiladas and chicken rellenos were inedible. The chiles overwhelmed all taste. We heard people at an adjacent table complaining about the over-spiced food, too. We think the chef may have gotten carried away with chiles.  That was all so disappointing since we had friends from out-of-town who we had told they were in for something special. We were right but also so wrong.

CCExSK7LAalEt4tvWeo_nA.text: I have reviewed Richardson's before, but I wanted to give a quick update on Happy Hour. We came from seeing a play at Phoenix Theatre and wanted to grab a quick bite. I had always heard about the happy hour, but never caught it before.   Turns out that we were very lucky! During happy hour the small plates are $5, glasses of wine at $5, and draft beers at $5. This makes the place fairly reasonable. As for the food, we had Green Chili Sliders (outstanding), Carne Adovada Sliders (outstanding), Chicken Skewers (darn good), and Tostadas (crunchy and tasty). There are maybe 4 or 5 more things you can choose from.   The only hitch is you have to sit at the bar or in the cove (a closed in patio area). Small price to pay.  N*Joy...

wafJ3Foy4zX8p_x1Xr9RdA.text: Fantastic. Had a table of 12 on the patio and it was a beautiful experience. Food was delicious and fresh. Very authentic. Service was perfect. Could not have been better. The ambience of this place including the Rookery was all we could have hoped for a casual yet elegant evening. A must go-to place when in Phoenix. It is a special place.

DJGD-w8ikLYgSf23Gmru0w.text: Their brunch is positively out of this world! And not nearly as expensive as I would have expected - definitely competitive with other brunch places in town. Hands down the best french toast I have ever had in my life - and I'm a snob when it comes to french toast!!

9tsg6txmd8qA4n6gw_2cXA.text: I have been eating at Richardson's since the early 90's and I have to say I've never had a bad meal.  Sometimes the servers can demonstrate a bit of an attitude but the overall experience is generally very good.

Gb6EaaIJC2OQlCgRj46oNA.text: I first went to Richardson's 15 years ago when in Phoenix on business, and after that first fantastic meal, went there multiple times over the next few years.   Fast forward to this past Saturday night when I took my family there. I'd heard mixed reviews but wanted to see for myself if they could still pull off the kind of meal I remembered. I was not disappointed!  I had the sea bass in an orange salsa that was prepared perfectly, along with their famous green chili potato. The other three in my party had fish - the fish trio, the salmon and the swordfish. All were cooked to perfection.  Add an appetizer of chips with fresh guacamole, pico, and two green sauces, one to set your hair on fire and you have the total package. Finally topped it off with the house made flan - absolutely delicious.   Richardson's definitely passed the test of time. I'll definitely be going back.

WBwWNmRorv3_RED_yGHjog.text: First time here and everything has a flavor profile that is very New Mexican authentic. The appetizer, the roasted garlic plate was a leap of faith for me as it sounded like nothing I would normally order but I was feeling a bit on the adventurous side. When it arrived I was not only surprised, my taste buds were blown away. I highly recommend the plate when you have about 4 of your friends or family to assist in taking that plate on. Now on to my main course, I opted for one of the specials of the night, a bone in prime with new Mexican Chile sauce and a cheese graded over it. Plus a sweet potatoes puree, twice baked in a poblano pepper along with a roasted vegetable medley that was equally agreeable. In a word "delicious" now on to the sweets and closer of the meal. Our choice was the flourless chocolate cake and a creme brule, both were fantastic and truly they both were standouts but we combined the two for a couple of spoonfuls and wow. Service was exceptional and the ice tea, yes just iced tea was also fresh brewed and all around I recommend eating here at least once in your life.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bone in prime rib

qrwQhdosQHU_tvJsqu6HBA.text: We were here years ago (actually Dicks Hideway) and loved the tamales so dropped in when we drove by. We had our kid with us and didn't think that would be an issue, but felt the cold shoulder when we walked in. We felt unwelcome, and the hostess seemed to have an attitude. No one smiled, once. At all. When we were taken to the table, the hostess just stared at the server and we stood there uncomfortably in silence for an oddly long period of time. We weren't offered the specials and had to ask about tamales, which were a special.  We were talking about how we felt like our presence was an inconvenience and I think someone overheard, because then the waitress started being nicer. The food wasn't as good as we remembered and the experience was miserable and we won't be coming back.

PF6fK_IKisT-9NzC2W-4MQ.text: Wait was a bit but so worth it! Sat in the patio is was a nice night and the dim lighting made everything so relaxing.  I ordered the Chimayo chicken it was spicy but wonderful I couldn't stop eating it! My husband ordered the pork chop chorizo only expecting one pork chop but the plate came with two! He was pleasantly surprised. For the first time ever he took home leftovers!

AnTZsAg3XCzc_SFXCqi4Lw.text: The food is nothing short of spectacular! Must try the carne adovada! Go hungry. Portions are enormous. Adam is a wonderful bartender and always takes good care of us when we come in.

-Ro06laWepiTKk8FYp2mwg.text: This was my first time here and I couldn't say enough great stuff!  The reputation of Richardson's had my expectations set high and I was not let down! I thought that $15 was a bit expensive for a scallop appetizer but once it hit the table I was very happy, each scallop was plump and cooked perfectly. With rice, beans and four different sauces to pick from it was perfect to split.  We had two entrees, the Garlic Shrimp and the New Mexico Surf and Turf. Both meals were hot when the waiter brought them out and were cooked perfectly. I couldn't have asked for anything more, just an awesome meal!

leLYy914IHEVE6AEYWEx4Q.text: Went to richardsons recently for the first time after hearing a lot about it from a friend. The environment was awesome and the staff are super friendly. Our server was Brooke, and she was very friendly and knowledgable about the wine and food. She also took the time to explain the menu to me because it was my first time, and it was much appreciated since she was so busy. Food was out of this world! All together a wonderful experience and I am definitely coming back in the near future!

iTmPtpz6K7NQZoSlM4dcXg.text: Food-great, service-a joke  The food and atmosphere at richardsons is FANTASTIC! I ordered the chimayo chicken and was very pleasantly surprised and the scallops as an appetizer were amazing. That's where the positive experience ended.... We had a reservation at 7:00pm and were greeted very pleasantly, however, just after receiving our bill while having conversation and unfinished cocktails, we were approached at 8:25pm asking us to leave as they had another group. But don't worry, we were offered sopapillas upon our next visit.

nBLYDUYZoqLXFj1iIZbzcA.text: Bleh. If you're like me and searching for new Mexican style green chili outside of Colorado and New Mexico don't come here. Staff is really friendly and the place is pretty cool but the food tastes nothing like New Mexico style. The green chili smothered is actually just shredded green chili there's no pork or stew so sorry none of that. Bummed.

KmILDzF8iORino71pR1YSQ.text: The bartender was going off on the ladies next to us who returned a dish because it had no turkey in it.  When returned to the kitchen the 3 Mexican  guys in the kitchen were totally talking BS about the customers. In Spanish.  Unprofessional and bad. This place is seriously lacking management and the staff all seemed miserable.

d0SAypKsfL-vtq69QGSP6g.text: My all time favorite. Absolute best steak and eggs Benedict in town. Service is always great. The wait is sometimes a little longer than I would like but that goes to show that people are willing to wait.   Great margaritas.

g8WteEq9_cpevAz0CvZdgg.text: One of the worst restaurants I've eaten at. Chicken must have been saved from the previous week. Like eating a rubber shoe. 2 meals out of 4 were awful.   The manager had no interest in following up on the poorly cooked dishes and showed little care at all for our concerns apart from indignintly removing it from our bill. Classless

7kdfOf2koy1HaSHIe-Jgog.text: Perfect every time! From the $5 Mimosas/Bloody Marys to the  Huevos Ranchero! Definitely try the garlic plate it's delicious. Today I went for the fish trio. Mahi, Swordfish and scallops and washed it down with a Greyhound that's made with fresh grapefruit juice.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UMVgXvrDsLtR7VZtZDSZFw.text: The food is great. We've  been eating here for 20 some years. The music could be louder, I don't talk politics when I go out for dinner, nor do I want to hear anyone else's views.

IHg1hyJf_ClwISDZkatmIQ.text: Came in for a drink for happy hour but we weren't greeted or even acknowledged, although the restaurant and bar were  basically empty. We've had dinner here before and received equally subpar service. Will not make this mistake again.

oPzic9Cj9cTN0RR2xsEmLw.text: Came here for dinner with a large group. Everything was so delicious, I can't even choose. The appetizers were filling, so I barely was able to dig into the entree. I ordered the New Mexico Enchiladas. They were fabulous!!! I would come here again, for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New Mexico Enchiladas.

bl2w_cQDf0FEmJlQksA8hg.text: This is such a shame. My boyfriend and I came here last Valentine's Day, to walk into the restaurant and find out that they lost our reservation that was made weeks in advanced, and called the day before to confirm our reservation. Then we get there and they lost our reservation, we had to wait 45 minutes to be seated. THEN! We had a bunch of family in town so we figured to come back because their food is really really delicious . We brought my 92 year old grandma and 9 other family members. We walk in and they LOST OUR RESERVATION again? For the 2nd time!!!!! I mean this is just he most annoying thing ever! My grandma is in her walker so this was like the worst thing to happen at a restaurant. The food is incredible which is why this is just so unfortunate. I hate writing bad reviews but this just is soooo not right.

xKQxbO9NUQ9i5uN_zjgVXg.text: Way too slow of  service.    I don't care for this place too much.  I wouldn't go back because of how long the wait was. They weren't that busy either. Food was nothing a spectacular

b50HiUWvMcuHDaQ_DY7A3Q.text: We like the food here because they always have a special seafood and meat menu. We did a trio fish with special request for grilled asparagus and cauliflower. The cauliflower did not look pretty but was really good, had a nice charred flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trio Fish: Salmkn, Sword &amp; Mahi

qHm0NyaaBeuOdAijxqyRgg.text: My family went to Richardson's for dinner and it was the WORST dining experience any of us has EVER HAD.   I cannot believe that any good reviews of this restaurant are real. To start, the food was terrible. All the plates came out separately and my moms almost 15 minutes after everyone else's. Her meal had been over cooked for so long the food was burnt and stuck to the plate. The kitchen staff and our waiter had obviously forgotten about it. Our waiter had also forgotten to ring in appetizers on 2 separate occasions... the 2nd time the item never did make it to the table. When we told the waiter about my moms dinner he rolled his eyes and said "it's supposed to be hot" and then walked off while we were still talking to him. Next thing I know another staff member walks up and just starts clearing off everyone else's plate from the table without asking if anyone else was done...which we weren't. Then our waiter shows up again with the bill. DUDE... WHAT?   5 minutes later another guy comes up and asks: NOW are you done? I said no I wasn't and he responded --Well, I wasn't talking to YOU!! Needless to say everyone was beyond rude and has no business being in the customer service industry.   We all agreed that the staff is on drugs. I am not joking around when I say that. Their behavior and mannerisms were not normal. Oh and we all got the shits from the little food that we did eat. Having the runs while being hungry is the worst.

0VD0YxZslboasaZuJ_e2_Q.text: Pretty good new Mexican cuisine. Their portion size is hefty and the patio is a must-experience. On the flip side, food can be a bit pricey and they didn't have the desserts they listed. Recommend adovada

OSi2D1mP58tXV1eNQBvCNA.text: This is typically our favorite restaurant to eat at on special occasions. Came for our 18th anniversary and left very disappointed. They've taken away their Green Chile Stew and only offer it for brunch. They charged us for Arnold Palmer refills...it's tea and lemonade not alcohol. Waitress didn't seem too knowledgeable about menu. There was an off duty employee or very known customer at the bar who along with the bartender and one of the waitresses dropped many "F" bombs. Hubby says "everyone messes up at least once". How do you fix that? I used to rave about coming here. After that experience I'm almost embarrassed to do so now.

ZGfTiflFkfKKYMgbCY-sLQ.text: Fantastic New Mexico cuisine and ambiance. Especially lived the frint room' which is actually outdoors.

8A2utploFgT8SQChsZo7uA.text: Richardson's brunch always offers great tasting food with a Southwestern Flair. The portions are large, and The Taste is deep. Very good Southwestern flavored food. The service is always well done and the environment Lively.

q0csrD8wfCtMDK0uEHqeog.text: Had my bday party at Richardson patio and had a good time the only thing was it took them a while to provide us with our drinks, we didn't like was that the waitress tried to still our cash he made it seem that we had missed paid. And it took us more than an hour just to figure out everybody bill. I had a party of 15 they couldn't split the tags.

jfVDpOcXk0acKj1zZpP5vw.text: Typically someplace we'd come for fantastic Mexican-infused munchies & drinks. The wait staff and bar tenders were always professional and attentive, and the food was fresh and had rich flavors, as well as a chill energy. The downstairs bar was like a groovy cave, dimly lit and a din with chatter and music. Tonight was different: the wait staff fell far short of expectations, as did the food. The salad drenched in dressing, the fish -- fishy, and the pasta way short of al dente. Maybe it was a fluke, but it felt more like commercial TexMex in ambiance, disinterested service, and in a dull, super salty, and unhealthy cuisine. I hope management gets itself centered and focuses on doing things the right way. Too expensive to be disappointing.

GFMZBCyRkuwQY_9wOIZFxg.text: Stopped in once again after a short hiatus and found the service to still be less than adequate. One feels like they're a bother asking for someone to take an order or get a refill because they're just so busy with preparations and waiting on tables. I don't believe it is the help's fault ...they all appear to do their best. But there is a genuine lack of any small talk or anyone asking you "how did you enjoy your meal?, etc." I believe it must be the management that schedules too few employees. At any rate, the food still rocks and the pours are generous. Happy hour prices are competitive with an array of excellent menu choices. Pork & dirty rice, the chili rellenos w/ red or green sauce is amazing, but very spicy at times (especially if you order the red sauce). Their chicken, shrimp and beef skewers are amazing. Basically, you can't go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Mexican Platter at Richardsons ...hot goodness!

Is8oF9VJJFSCqeXjM1pBUw.text: Took friends here for lunch ... It had been a while since my last visit and wanted to try it again.  So glad I did!  I ordered the New Mexican Platter ... Everything was perfect as I expected.  The right amount of heat, spice, and temperature.  Too often foods are over or under spiced, or too salty, too cool.  I love it when they get it spot on.  Dining companions had the relleno platter and the Santa Fe chicken.  Everyone was pleased with their meals.    I did order the GCP (Green Chile Potato) .. It was good, but didn't blow my socks off as I had expected.  Don't get me wrong - I just won't order it as an additional side item.    Overall - kudos on a great meal and great service!

NeY7qWa55cH7a-nMgNxr1g.text: Food was amazing. I had the tenderloin Benedict with jalapeno hollandaise sauce and my wife had the breakfast burrito. Huge portions and great service. Glad we found this place while we are here on vacation. I definitely recommend stopping here.

EtZyAmTZXjHaVZE2m5p2RQ.text: Appetizer arrived with rock hard bread.  I figured if I drenched the bread in the hot liquid from the appetizer it would soften up.  No dice.  It was still like a rock.  We told the server.  She said and I quote,  " They must've used bread from yesterday."  She brought fresh bread that was toasted even more than the original bread we got and it was significantly softer.  So yeah,  they served us day old bread.  I didn't want a comp so I asked for a discount.  They gave me a $2.00 discount.   If you're gonna charge $18 for an appetizer,  serve fresh bread!!  Also,  there are mosquitoes flying around.  My girlfriend got bitten several times.  I've been to Richardson's and Dick's Hideaway quite often for many years.  I think my first visit to Richardson's was in the early 90s.  Today was certainly a disappointment.  Server was nice,  but seemed irritated that we complained.  Oh well,  this is OUR Saturday lunch, and we're sick and tired of this happening to us.

4FXmcNZIk1ilAlfI5uO6qw.text: ROCKSTAR! A wonderful place w/ great food and menu- really good, they actually prepare food unlike the majority of Phoenix Restaurants!

Q5E8CglAxX7DdcTRYwJX0Q.text: I loved the decor.  Missed happy hour but had a marvelous drink called the Hemingway.  Food was expensive, good but not exceptional.  They smoke their own pork.  I put my clothes outside when I got home because they reeked!

v4abD0MwEyLHjzxwSjodlQ.text: Richardson's = best sea bass ever!  Short ribs were also amazing.  Everything was great; can't wait to go back.

XRqqy_UY7G7qnIjJMMq3AA.text: I really liked the ambiance here. I went here for a business dinner and it was a nice, relaxed atmosphere. I'm always happy to find a spot that serves good mole, and this fits the bill. My boss was also raving about their Moscow mules. Nice work, Richardson's.

RHXwEC-Gzy6mfzn50hEOOw.text: My absolute favorite. Hands down! The food is AMAZING and consistent. Very important because I want to know that I every time I go I will have an amazing meal. That's how it is at Richardsons! Always perfect. The ambiance is chill, it's the perfect place to settle in and catch up with friends. Drinks are delicious. I always leave happy. Love it!

HYpKvO8oot9xr4cWRqK6uA.text: Very disappointed. $39 Lamb chops had no flavor, $39 Sea Bass was sugary and gross, vegetable were way overcooked and soggy. Service was slow and bad. I don't understand why this place is so busy, I will never go back.

ueFmb7xS-mms3-eviq5CQQ.text: Waited 1 hour for my Eggs Benedict jalapeno plate. We even told the bartender (our server) that we needed to catch a flight in the next hour and he didn't say anything to the cooks to hurry our meals. After getting or food, my English muffin was burnt to a crisp. It tasted so gross I had to skip eating the English muffin altogether. The potatoes were also undercooked. The plate alone was 14$ and I felt very jipped that I paid that much for a sub par meal that took 1 hour to make. The valet did not give us or ticket so we ended up having to ask for the keys and walked to the car ourselves. For the price and slow service, I Definitely do not recommend.

BYJ3w6hU2Dm8lP5rxblOBQ.text: Great owner and staff. Waiter was wonderful took the time to explain 'the numerous' specials. He knocked it out of the  park and recommended the Carne Adovada (one of their classics). Smoked pork simmered in green chile.  It was delicious, the best Mexican I have had in a very long time. Oh, and they have great drinks too. I will be back!

a9bCjFQLuXf0dnryezxZxQ.text: After years of being Richardson's customers we have sworn not to return. The good flavors are diminished, the service is average at best and the music was loud and appropriate for a nightclub, or running a marathon but not for a candlelit dinner. If you are arriving from the north it is very difficult to make a safe left turn into the only entrance allowed by the valet.  We had arrived with big appetites knowing the food to be hearty. We were force fed an unappealing dose of wrestling on one of the distracting TV screens - definitely an ambience and appetite killer. We asked the waitress to turn the music down, she said she'd see. It didn't happen. Eventually we called for a manager. Mario was pleasant and changed the playlist. Apparently the owner dictates the music, which makes me think he's trying to win a new young crowd and neglect his stodgy older clients like me, a forty something. The waitress was not knowledgeable about the menu. There were two hostesses, one in training, and the trainer on her phone texting all evening. The halibut was dry. The Chimayo Chicken is no longer the standout dish it used to be. The signature jalapeno potato was bland, not even spicy this time. The lamb tacos arrived ten minutes after all the other main courses were delivered, with no apology. They had to be sent back, they were way too dry to be enjoyed. Lamb needs to be seriously over cooked to be so dry. The waitress took the dish back. She did not return with a counter offer from the chef, the manager did not appear to enquire about it. The lamb was included on the check. We paid and left and they have lost two families who have been long time customers.

jzAkA1T-w8RbwpGByg3VCA.text: Amazing food and our server was radical!   She suggested a delicious red wine :  Catena, "Vista Flores", Argentina, Mablec, '12 AND informed us that on certain nights select wine bottles are half off! We felt like winners before even getting our appetizer.  The apps written on the board all sounded grand but we are suckers for the super spicy jalapeno poppers so we stick with them. Both of us loved our entrees and truly I bet I'd be happy eating anything on the menu here. Everything has been so delicious here and at Dicks Hideaway. We favored the ambience here though, and now we have two fabulous places to pick from, depending on our presently desired ambience.  We are coming back soon! Thanks for being so awesome!

BnymD1YyZ5qpJoxk71cXww.text: This is my brothers favorite restaurant in Phoenix and he and his GF took me and my husband here for Easter Brunch when we were visiting. Who knew the food scene in Phoenix was so hip and classy? They have really great food and the decor is super. Punched copper bar, adobe like ambiance, with a fire pit and outdoor seating that looks really cozy. New Mexican cuisine is one of my favorites so it already had me at hello. The menu is really classic mexican-ish with a tweek of gourmet. Such as Huevos Rancheros with Crab or what have you. We had blood orange juice, yum-, a Garlic Plate app. Was out of this world with roasted elephant garlic bulbs and several kind of cheeses melted over red and green fire roasted chile salsa and onions and little crustinis to use like a bruchetta I am guessing, which was clever. My Chile Relleno was really great, everything cooked perfect. Hubby got chile verde and eggs (forgive me I dont know the exact name of the dishes) he loved it. My brother and his girlfried said they havent had anything they didnt love. Its one of those places that makes you wanna stay a while...you can tell the owner really takes pride. I hope you go check this out when visiting Phoenix because its really worth the trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Garlic Plate
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chile Rellenos Breakfast

21q-fZEuAlM-i0j_sewYnA.text: Have you heard of New Mexican food? Let's be clear, I'm not talking about Mexican (at least that's what the locals in the area want you to believe)... my take? Mexican, New Mexican, who cares? IT'S SO GOOD!  Margaritas are strong and tasty. Portions are large and delicious. If you get a combo you're in for a mix of meat/poultry/fish (your choice), beans, rice, cheese, diced tomatoes... the works. The cheese brings it all together and presto - you've got yourself one hell of a New Mexican meal =)  Three salsas served to start, one has a great kick. I can't promise you'll be able to really distinguish between Mexican and New Mexican, but I can promise you'll enjoy your meal.

i9eQu9aQDaEkqdInrJs2tQ.text: Portions were huge!  We ate it all though.  That must have meant the food was tasty.  My wife and I shared one dish, The New Mexican Platter.  We also enjoyed the prickly pear margarita.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XyT6O6d1i63y5XXsuvKhjg.text: To add to what many other Yelpers said: you really can't tell what is Richardson's and what is Rokerij; the free valet is very convenient, especially considering there is basically no lot; it is extremely dark inside, so don't plan on enjoying the appearance of your food; and MAKE A RESERVATION if you want to eat in Richardson's.  That being said, we had very good service - not super attentive, but I much prefer when servers don't spend a lot of time hovering.  All our meals were correct and everything was prompt but not rushed.  We went on a Tuesday, which happens to be half price bottles of wine night, so that was a great surprise.  I ordered the Posole to start.  It was VERY spicy but delicious.  We also had the chips and guacomole, with the 3 different salsas, and that was wonderful to start.  My husband ordered the enchilada platter and his father ordered the New Mexico platter.  They both loved their food, although it was alsy very spicy (the particular green chiles in their sauce were very spicy at least).    My mother-in-law had the skewers and it was fine.  I had the Pasta Heidi: green chili pasta with chicken and a chipotle cream sauce.  I literally could have died right then and been satisfied.  It was SO.  GOOD.  We literally can't wait to go back just so we can have the Pasta Heidi again.  My mouth is watering.  YUM.    I would also recommend checking out the basement bar, just to have a drink.  Have your server or a hostess show you how to get down there.  It's pretty cool, and a nice place to spend some time while you wait for your table.

4BF0agXfc20iNh3086hN3g.text: The place is nice, the waiters take their time, service is way too slow. I decided to come here after seeing good reviews and was disappointed to find out the food was not that great. I got the enchiladas and both with red and green sauce. The rice tasted funny but the beans were good. I don't think this place is as good as its hyped to be.

QTtIeEc--R6KxPhsfqZINA.text: We sat at the bar since it was an early dinner. We ordered off the happy hour menu - pork sliders, queso and chips and ribs.  The sliders turned out to be the worst of the bunch.  The pulled pork was a bit dry and though the bun was nice, the whole thing was bland without some kind of sauce maybe.  The queso was probably one of the best I've ever had.  The ribs fell off the bone and the seasoning was pretty tasty despite the appearance of the dish.  The wine I had was very good, the margarita my friend had was super tangy but he enjoyed it.  All in all, I'd like to explore the menu further and maybe venture to the basement.  :)

7ArXqTF8vXJDErpwVEytvA.text: My boyfrined and I went here on Monday night and loved it! He had a pizza and I had a wonderful chicken dish (the name escapes me right now) stuffed with spinach and a wonderful roasted onion sauce, it also came with amazing mashed sweet poatoes and veggies.  I have a gluten allergy and our server Nick was very helpful in finding out what I could and couldn't eat. He was super nice and patient with us-we kept having to ask for more time to order because everything looked so good haha!  This resturant is very romantic, the service is good and I would definitely go back!

1SUSTMGTwnVgrwnojGuzCQ.text: Wow. Do not dine here. Please let me list the reasons why...  Made a reservation three weeks in advance for a seven top reso for a bunch of Chicago 20 something's in town to go out and have a great night in Phoenix.  Our server was non existent throughout our entire dinner... Our plan was to dine... Translation, spend money! No one was served more than one cocktail. When asked what to order, we were answered with; everything is good. We relied on one girl who has been here before to walk us through the menu. Food came out staggered, and when the food arrived, we asked the food runner (who was clearly the rude host with short spiked boy hair) which entree had meat and which had cheese... (We had a vegetarian in the group) she responded with, "I don't know, this is not my job" Okay, really?! As we are all completely done with this place, and parched because our waters hadn't been refilled on the 90 degree patio. I thought that I should just let the manager know about how much money they lost out on, and more importantly how neglectful his sever was. His response; I wish you would have told me earlier so that I could have fixed it. (Mind you, our entrees were still on the table) No, I'm sorry, no, let me send you dessert. No, apology or care for my complaint in anyway.... Talk about one, the server. Two, the host/food runner. Three, the MANAGER... Dropping the ball! Needless to say, we will never be back. We have now wrote this review, so hopefully other people don't go here. And lastly, to whom ever reads this internally. Find a manager who values the customer... And get a training program in place for all your other staff members who interact with the people who pay your bills.

IrUqa0noGhFQHr-kdKXeZQ.text: This restaurant was recommended to us by the concierge at the hotel we were staying at. Overall, I'd say the food was excellent, and I particularly liked the different salsas and other sauces they had. I put away a plate of tamales like there was no tomorrow! They made an off-menu burrito for dinner for one of us, and a very nice quesadilla for one of my children. All the dishes had a nice smoky, somewhat spicy taste, although I think they overdid it warning us about how spicy this were. Maybe they should come up with a scale to measure spicyness, like most other restaurants do.   Anyway, I liked the dark, cave-like interior and cozy booth seating - very nicely designed, and made for a nice atmosphere for dinner. Alas, the service was slow and indifferent, and I had the same gripe about tiny beers that are so expensive. We ordered a second round, which came in clearly much larger glasses, which made it feel even more like we were cheated on the first round. Also, the sodas my kids ordered were from syrup, and not mixed properly.   Overall, very nice atmosphere and food.

wjVuXr8mrRc4ni7orwpglg.text: This was a great place for dinner. Plenty of choices on the menu, from salads to pizzas to pastas to classic Mexican-style plates. I went with something called Chimayo chicken, which had sun-dried tomatoes, poblano, spinach, and asiago, along with some delicious veggies on the side, and a green chile potato, which was awesome.  There were quite a few things on the menu that looked good, so I'm sure I'll be back.  Oh, and I almost forgot - I ordered the sopapillas for dessert - best sopapillas I've ever had. Cooked perfectly, just the right amount of crispiness, drizzled with sweet honey. This would be enough of a reason to come back.

mOfynkzScoliqqsbkn_Bew.text: Wonderful eggs Benedict with jalapeno hollandaise, with green chicken enchiladas! Susana out server was very attentive and enthusiastic the entire time, such a great southwest brunch location in Phoenix.

WP_GFiNPb4f4TI0axYYqSw.text: AH-MAZING!  Absolutely love this place.  Try the turkey enchiladas - so good!

H0tdT7QgHBtkJusA50mFqg.text: No happy hour on valentines day - really, the sign at the door says happy hour everyday!  The food and service is great, Managment not so much- boo

4ytloGbBh1LaJKBZmhMDdA.text: Finally made it into this great restaurant after hearing good things about it. The food was all good for all four in our party but the prices seamed too high and the service was a little inattentive. I plan to give it another try. I'll also dress a little nicer to blend with all the clientele that frequent the establishment.

wA8_FX-TyeUVnmNyIptPFQ.text: We finally visited the new restaurant 3 1/2 years after the Richardson's fire. It is quite amazing how similar the new Richardson's looks and feels like the former landmark restaurant. Their service is great. We ordered a pizza and salad. I should have known better to order a pizza from a New Mexico style restaurant... roasted tomato sauce with New Mexico sausage and mozzarella. It brought back memories of conversations with my Papa debating whether Prego or Ragu was the better canned tomato sauce.

5sCRDFVx3y_LojNqScVBkg.text: As a long time (15+ years) patron, it's hard to write this. I'm not sure what's happened, but Richardson's is not what it used to be. After several not-great-not-terrible dinners, this last one was unfortunately worthy of review. From a server who pushed us 3x in the first 10 minutes to order when we'd already ordered appetizers and were enjoying wine and conversation, to tilapia swimming in a soupy, tasteless "sauce", to salads that arrived AFTER the main course, to an unopened bottle of wine left at the table with a broken cork, this was a sad and disappointing experience. The server eventually apologized for the wine, but not before pushing the broken, crumbly cork into the wine, capping it with the cork from the first bottle and offering it to us to take home. Almost $300 for a party of 4 to have this kind of experience? Unfortunately, we probably won't return unless we hear from many, many people that things have improved. Sniff.

SRwQNokz6Qt-IEh_wzJwQQ.text: Awesome food, atmosphere, and drinks.  We ate in the downstairs bar and loved it.  I had the New Mexican Platter.  You should try it soon.

XUQ44eWmBKRoRX3GeUViBA.text: Had heard great things about Richardson's New Mexican food and finally went.  Definitely did not live up to the hype! Tasteless, watered-down margueritas (both regular and prickly pear), rude and inattentive service, waiter strongly suggested both couples split food, then only brought one tortilla for each entree and no extra plate, waiter acted very annoyed when we asked for more toast to go with our Roasted Garlic appetizer. Entree was sooo hot it was inedible. Never asked if we needed anything or how the food was.  Very disappointing, will not return.

8IyMGfk4Jz8ZY3PAwChrfQ.text: Review for Dick's Hideaway:  This place is called many things from Rokerij(y), Richardsons, and Dick's Hideaway. We went and grabbed breakfast and it was ok but pretty pricey for what we got. I was not a fan of the filet mignon breakfast or the way they do the beans on the tortillas but it was an ok experience. The next time we decided to try it for an early dinner but then decided to sit at the bar since happy hour is 5$ for appetizers(small plates). This is where the place really shines. The onion rings are the best I have had, The filet mignon skewers were excellent. The bacon wrapped shrimp were good but nothing to write about, but the prime ribsliders were top notch. We left with a small bill after a few drinks and some good food and vowed to go with friends again soon.  Go at happy hour and sample some small plates.

WDGAEh5l77RXKwMMxWTYZg.text: My husband and I go here almost every date night. So... The service isn't exceptional and it's almost always busy but you can't beat the vibe. It's cozy and unique. The food is good. It's a matter of personal preference and we do love it, our friends love it (especially when we're down in the basement sitting by the fire enjoying a bottle of wine and socializing). The Rokerij and Richardsons (same owners, sit side by side) are worth visiting. Oh, and another unique spot that's owned by the same is Dick's Hideaway... My husband loves this place.

_DJpMCaWZHEjf6DO4F_P6g.text: As a native of new mexico i appreciate the attempt at authentic cuisine. As with any restaurant, the green chile is going to vary. Sometimes hot, sometimes mild. But, good flavor. They lose a star because the bar tender brought me the wrong beer twice. Then charged me $7 a piece, during happy hour. After a whirlwind of criticism he finally took one off. But, great wine list during happy hour.

YHWcmt6s-2LCtxIqAZ-PJQ.text: Amazing food! I'm from New Mexico originally and they have the best carne adovada I've ever had! Great brunch too.

xuNFM4lf9uxuHmWC0O5c6w.text: Had family in town and wanted to take them to one of my favorite places in The Valley. I should have gone with my gut and not taken the 9:15 reservation but they really wanted to eat here. We were seated at about 9:30 and they were definitely not ready for us. We received water right away and then were assured by the manager that we would be well taken care of. We didn't see our waitress for 15 minutes after that. She was good and very nice considering she was our bartender for an hour and a half while we were waiting for our table drinking. We wanted a pizza and they said they weren't serving them anymore?  Ordered our apps. and they were good. Ordered our dinners and the Caesar salads came out without dressing. Ouch. Dinners were OK. Just not as good as every time else I have been there. Oh well. Maybe it was too late in the evening.

5Ss4fPvgKaygxKybi1k7Ig.text: Went to Richardson's again tonight as it's one of my favorite restaurants for the past 10 years. Horrible experience tonight as we made a reservation late for 6 p.m. and they said all they had was on their patio. I specifically asked if they had misters and they said YES. So off we went and when we were seated the misters weren't on, so we asked for them to be turned on. They did, but they they kept turning them off. When we continued to ask why they were off they said others where complaining they were dripping on them. The only other patrons were ones at the bar waiting for their inside tables. We had 6 people and our bill was almost $400. At the end the waitress asked how everything was and we asked for our check so we could leave as we were all VERY hot (misters were off for the last 30 minutes of our meal). She apologized and told us it was a "liability" to have the misters on and that someone had reserved the "pit" on the patin and paid $500 as a deposit and they didn't want the misters on. As we walked out of the restaurant and left a 15% tip instead of our normal 25% (she lost $30) we saw NO ONE else eating in the "pit" area, only 4 or 5 people standing around and the floor was completely dry. Very disappointed that we were told outside would have misters, which the few times they were on made a BIG difference and that the few bar patrons were more important than our table of six, with drinks, apps, $35 entrees. We will definitely rethink heading back to Richardson's after this experience no matter how good the food is.........since we had to take 50% of the food home as it was too uncomfortable to eat.

6AZJV6HJOX7QVge1xqtrlA.text: Tried this place one more time.  Sat outside in the bar area....much better!  The service was awesome and the food was fantastic.  We ordered several apps that we all very good and orders the stuff pork chops again...this dish is a must if you go there.  The margaritas were also really good.  I will go back again, but will definitely sit outside.

B_pf2c8KtgrxPUolLyYaZA.text: Terrible experience at Richardson's!     Uneducated, lazy, INEXPERIENCED people working here.   If you're going to charge families $80 - $100 to eat at your restaurant hire competent staff.

OCxjELZ4dZmKkRKVGC3D7Q.text: I have eaten at Richardson's many times and have always loved it, but this past weekend has made me rethink whether I will ever return.  Out of town company were very excited to dine there as I had raved about it.  Well, the waitress, Diane, made our evening miserable.  We sat for quite some time waiting for her to come.  We had questions about the menu, specials in particular, and she sulked off to bring us a chalk board as we couldn't see all of the ones on the walls.  She then left the table and didn't come back for a long time.  Once she did, she  stood at the tableside, chewing gum and jutting out one hip.  We were clearly boring her.  Questions asked of her were not audible in their response.  Never have is felt so embarrassed as my out of town company were very shocked and very disappointed.  Perhaps I could expect this treatment at Hooter's, but the total indifference was very very difficult.  If you get Diane, you might consider moving to another table and if she is chewing gum, it might be the same piece as she chomped on it the entire evening.  Very sad, indeed.

A0L7Y19rLFoa09HRZLi_jg.text: I think after tonight, this will be the last time I go to Richardson's. My husband likes the place, but I find it overpriced for the quality of food. However, I thought it would be nice to take him there tonight for his birthday. First, you can't make a reservation unless you have a party of four and as I discovered, there are no tables for two people. So when we got to the restaurant, there were no tables available and the bar was full, so we were offered a side bar area or outside sitting at a coffee table type area. Less than stellar choices for a birthday dinner. Finally, we got a couple seats at the bar. I ordered the Grouper with caper lemon butter sauce. Imagine my surprise when I received my dish and there were no capers. Everytime that I have had a caper sauce it has had capers in it. When I asked about it, they looked at me like I was crazy. Plus, all the sauce was absorbed by the tortilla on the plate. So I basically I paid $27 bucks for a dry Grouper with asparagus. My husband kind of liked his dish, but he was not overwhelmed. Yeah, the last time we will go there.

tDNJX0t9LB_VecAF2hXSpw.text: The atmosphere in this establishment is amazing. Love the cozy, romantic, dark feeling of the restaurant and the patio. Our plan on this chilly night was to sit on the patio and order from either Richardsons or Rokery, as we had several months prior. Apparently that is no longer an option, so we decided to go to Richardsons. When we entered, we inquired about happy hour, which is only at the bar, so we chose to sit at a booth, instead, and skip happy hour. We ordered a round of margaritas and our entrees. The food was good, but, for some reason, was not kind to my stomach later. The service was so-so. I agree the waitstaff acts like they are way too busy to be bothered with doing their job. Our waitress was standoff-ish and absent. We had to ask one of the other workers for drinks and extras, like napkins, etc. The place was not busy, so I am not sure what happened to our server. We may return for a romantic cocktail or to bring guests for a drink, but that will be the extent of our return.

lppkBvA2OK0suxmmvu6Ffg.text: My husband, having lived in Phoenix for 40 years, has been a huge Richardson's fan. After the fire, we were both waiting for news of its reopening.  While driving  south on 16th street, I darn near gave myself whiplash when I saw a lovely building that said "Richardson's".  I texted my husband and 3 hours later, we walked in for dinner. The place was packed,and I had no idea what "Rokery" was.....Richardson's sister restaurant next door. This is where it gets confusing. While we were checking out the drop-dead gorgeous candlelit entry-patio, we were led to a table at Rokery .....not understanding why, not understanding the two-sided menu, etc. On the plus side, the booths are huge,  but I am not a fan of the open-kitchen concept because of the noise. Our booth was 8 feet from the bar and kitchen and conversing was impossible, and we there for a special occasion. It turns out that they serve both menus in either restaurant, with Rokery having an impressive fish-steak menu - which we will definitely return for. The daily specials - posted on a blackboard/wall was a small novel of offerings. We started with the Pomagranet margarita, which was very weak on the tequila. We ordered two of the Mexican entrees, which were very authentic and spicy. The only problem with my husband's plate was that it had been placed under a broiler and  the red chili sauce  had coagulated into a blackened, burnt- tasting flavor. Surprisingly, he didn't finish half of it......very unusual. My selection of the Mexican Platter was excellent, but could be delivered to the table at a temperature that is less than molten lava. It must have taken 15 minutes before it cooled enough to eat it. At any rate, the new location is beautiful, although when they welcome you, they need to tour and explain the two neighboring restaurants and the fact that you can order from both sides of the menu. I would love to give them the additional  stars the next time we visit.

GteCrf3xu7MXvwVA2PKgLw.text: Great food.  The red and green chillie sauces had a good amount of "heat".  Will definitely go back my next trip to Phoenix

kNSDXhccbcRaQUMmXBdqqg.text: This is what I have been missing from my life. If you like New Mexican...I mean authentic New Mexican cuisine then you certainly need to add Richardson's to the top of the list. It checks all the boxes; low light, a bunch of people crammed into a small area (I'm think about you El Patio in Albuquerque), massive portions of food, blue corn tortillas, amazing red and green sauce, and the list goes on. Sitting at the bar gives a direct line of sight to the kitchen, and a happening kitchen it is - open grill that is wood fried was the best part in my opinion. There is a nice outside patio, too. Lots of small wood fired fireplaces, and typical New Mexican adobe walls really gives this place an authentic and convivial feel. Plates come from the kitchen piping hot with very generous portion size; and to be honest the price you pay for the experience really is a good deal. If you have been to New Mexico then you know this place deserves nothing less than 5 stars. Bravo!

Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchiladas

S0QtxuGBENd4jX5eGXUanQ.text: This space was great and the staff were super nice. It got crowded for brunch too. We had a reservation for 7 and Annie (the hostess) was super sweet and prompt.  We ordered many dishes including the enchiladas, burrito and eggs Benedict. Everyone was happy with their meal and I wish I would have had room For sopapillas. The flavors were great! I would have to say they used to much cheese and they don't have a vegetarian green Chile option for my burrito. I like green Chile and think they should have some diced or made without meat.  After living in New Mexico for 13 years, I would recommend this place as a good option for Phoenix.

qxG8lXYA6zMzCgUAqqDUDQ.text: Server Luis was outstanding in his knowledge of the menu. Very quaint. Had Appetizers  consisting of New Mexican sausages, Brie toast with filet and bacon wrapped stuffed jalapenos. Osso Bucco  Pasta Heidi and fish trio entree's were all outstanding. Highly recommend!!

XZTd0MdDf3pE03rnBxUlug.text: This place was highly recommended and did not disappoint.  Rick, our bartender, knew the menu to a tee!  He made us feel welcomed and served a yummy margarita.  I got the signature Carne Adovada, my dinner mate the Roasted Pork Mole.  Both came out as huge portions of piping hot deliciousness.  This one dish will easily be four meals.  Can't wait to wrap up the leftovers for a breakfast burrito.

DZodsC1hI6aleKd6MNhedw.text: Wellllll this place has totally taken my heart with their roasted garlic plate and $6 margaritas!  The roasted garlic plate was enough for 2 and we still had left overs. I also got the enchiladas and although they didn't leave me speechless like the garlic plate did. The margaritas were also a good size for their HH price. I got mine frozen with a delicious sugar rim.   Go check out Richarson's!  xx Paola R.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

C22uMv19ibKPf-kQzPqxxA.text: Richardsons is our favorite spot in Phoenix for Sunday brunch. The quality of food is always the same, service is top notch and you get so much food there is always enough to take home for left overs. Oh, did I mention $6 Mimosas and Bloody Mary's.   I think we have tried almost everything on the menu. My favorite happens to be the breakfast tacos which are listed on the board. 4 tacos with eggs mixed with your choice of meat or veggies, hash browns and beans on the side. If you are going to be a first timer here, be forewarned, the red and green sauce can have a little heat to them.  Valet parking is complimentary and please, just tip the valets. They are fast and take good care of your cars.  Give them a try, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchiladas and eggs

xfjxHrtmZl5HJLeO3F9FoQ.text: Good food. Good drinks. Good service. Not great for groups as there are no split checks unless you feel like doing the splitting yourself. Additionally, thought it would be a fun brunch spot but it's not great for groups with kiddos because there isn't a high chair in the place.

pdxDJ0Zk9s9JdMVb_W960w.text: Top of the list in places to go, excellent atmosphere and the food is fantastic. Carne Adovado is the best, kind of stuff you have a craving for! The service is fantastic and the manager really took care of us so we really appreciate it.

dIdzv7B4umqu6awrGjh_Hg.text: The food here is pretty good- The chili Relleno in particular. They have a large menu and offer a good selection of drinks as well.   They have one major problem here, the flies! If you sit outside, it is almost unbearable due to the abundant amount of flies. I have come for happy hour a few time and they only do happy hour at the bar outside, so you are forced to sit in a swarm of flies.   The service here is also not very good and the servers are pretty inattentive.   I probably will pass next time I am invited to eat here, as I do not like flies all around me at anytime, in particular when I eat!   I went to another resturant in Phoenix that introduced a type of bee that does not sting people but it eats flies! Richardson's should look into this.

gC5Mq7frD6r-FOCemngxYQ.text: I asked a friend who used to live in the area what is the one place I have to go and try to experience something totally on like I can get back home, and he referred me here. He also highly recommended a dish which was the green chile stew.  OMG! Absolutely phenomenal experience so unlike anything I have tried before. More than just Southwestern cuisine, this spot offers prime steaks and seafood as well as a great selection of New Mexico style offerings. While I was tempted to try the tacos tenderloin or New Mexican surf & turf, I sTuck with the original plan and had the stew which is an off menu hidden gem.  This was absolutely not something that had been sitting around in a warmer all day. It must've taken 15 or 20 minutes to come out, and it's hard to get excited about stew, but this was the most incredibly flavorful stew I've ever had. There was not only depth of flair, but also heat from the various peppers they use that was just wonderful and not overbearing. I can't wait to go back and try some other dishes at this wonderful place.

4yrR38kedkX1vno4MScHbQ.text: The carne adovada is a tortilla with shredded pork in an adobe chili sauce that is spicy and very good, we put a poached egg on top and ordered sour cream on the side very good. Our bartender extraordinaire, Kevin, made us an amazing bloody Mary which had asparagus, celery, olives, lime, & lemon practically a dinner in  of itself! You really must try this!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You must try this Carne Adovada! It soo good!

Ki2UECMEf7ydHOAvKKmzfw.text: Very tasty food and great ambience!  One of my wife's and i's favorite places to eat.  We like the lunch menu better, although it's a great place to eat at for either lunch or dinner.  My personal favorite is rellenos and eggs with hash browns. I prefer cheese rellenos and these are stuffed full of tasty cheese and crisply battered. I get it "Christmas style" meaning with both green and red sauces. The red sauce is dark and flavorful and the green is bright and spicy. I love the pinto beans and tasty tortilla that is fresh soft and warm.  My wife likes the red chile pecan smoked pork, which has such a depth of flavor and a great mix of heat and smokiness.  The Wood fired pizzas are great, and like everything else, the portions are fantastic.   Only thing that keeps it out of the 5 is sometimes the service is slow as they seem understaffed. I really do like quiet places and this is wonderful for that, but I could use just a little more coverage.

WJdH2XzVK3o4JFG4SwKSjw.text: Just had dinner last week at Richardsons and got lucky to get a table because we didnt have reservations.  The food was excellent but the service was phenomenal!  The only question I asked was for extra pillows (no problem).  Sam was great server and surprisingly, I loved the pinto beans served underneath the sausage appetizer and my stuffed chorizo pork chop.  If you want a quiet space to catch up with friends or get to know a special someone, this place is a good option.

US4E0S5gAL_HGJLBCynuoQ.text: This place is amazing. Fantastic food. The patio is beautiful and service was great. Green chili is super-spicy, so you've been warned. It is delicious but boy oh boy it is HOT! Wonderful time... highly recommend!

UK2B4VMp8yN-C5-eSeb0aw.text: Good. But extremely over priced for Mexican cuisine..  probably wouldn't go vs k. Cute place though

ou5HpGGL4zgeDwPtEF1A8w.text: One of our favorite spots, not just for Mexican food, but anything.  Queso is the best in town, fish dishes are good, try the Pasta Heidi.  Food can be a little spicey, ask the server to have the kitchen tone it down.  A little noisy, hard to have a conversation, but you can sit outside when it's cooler.  Great place, but a little hard to find.  They need a bigger sign, you can drive right by it.

OBkWwFk-fsS3MgjCjgs5Yw.text: Upon walking into Richardson's, I instantly fell in love with its unique environment. A very fun and cute restaurant that perfectly paralleled Arizona's desert culture.   We stopped in around 9:30PM for dinner and found out that there was happy hour until close. I decided to indulge in the vast list of sliders. I opted for the steak and brie while my friend the salmon. Both versions were absolutely delicious. The steak and brie was a bit on the pricier side, at around $18, and the salmon was around the $12-15 range. The sliders were hefty, and although both plates left us full, I found the salmon to be slightly more bang for your buck, especially being that they were filled with huge chunks of salmon.
