Overall a solid restaurant to enjoy food with friends and family. Would definitely stop in again if I ever found myself in the North Phoenix area!

G2xn5NqBp8UTGCVMitUo8A.text: I thought that part of the job description for hostess meant a friendly hello. I get that you are busy but a dirty look and not even a hello doesn't seem fitting. Especially on Father's Day! We were seated at a narrow area at the bar. With our two kids. All the while looking at two empty tables the whole time we were there. But as per the hostess the only spot they had was the bar seating. Kind of a bummer overall! I am giving three stars because our server was super sweet and the food was great as always!

AdVZ9s8wpHEzeT5aZvXqnw.text: This is one of my favorites always good.  I usually rate based on food, service and environment and to get a 5 star review you must be amazing.    Enjoy.

SLHU6Gols0Mnb7_ZvafMmg.text: I had the carne adovada and it was delicious. I ate the leftovers for breakfast. Wish they were located where I lived

cn8ePjWF8fNrCvd3HyBSUw.text: Make sure you come hungry, the portions are very large. Also make sure you can handle spice, as the chile packs a punch, much like you would find in New Mexico. The only drawback was that the service was a little slow. Still, it's authentic New Mexico-style food, and it's delicious too.

ibYs7NeQ6s8TLTc81M-QyQ.text: From out of town and was looking for some authentic southwest food. This placed delivered in their food, ambiance and friendly service. All food items my wife and i had were excellent. Highly recommended even if you have to drive for 30 minutes (unless you plan to over serve yourself).

weKv5Q8Ri0cXDSjJcOLkEQ.text: Richardson's is amazing New Mexican food. Michelle, our waitress was very informative and friendly!  The portions are huge and delicious.  We went for brunch and the menu is full of breakfast items as well as other seafood items. Great mimosas too!

M5lKJsRdDjKPEhq2dGLpxw.text: Far fancier in style and atmosphere than I had expected from the menu or the, quite reasonable, prices.  There's a valet and everything, and it gets insanely crowded.  At 5 pm I was told there was only one table for 3 before 9 pm, and they don't take reservations for groups that small.  Fortunately we got served, and the food was entirely decent, but nothing to rave for.  I had a tamale plate, the main course of which was larger and less brick-like than most of the tamales I've actually had in New Mexico.

op3FLgdYpszU_dfm90H_8Q.text: So this has been my favorite place for years, but last week we had a group of friends meet there. The food did not come up evenly, it felt like the servers were not on the ball. Started with 4 trips to bring silverware to the group, and not enough glasses. I got my meal after everyone else had finished their meals. Told him to just cancel my meal, but he said it was on its way and I ordered it. I thought it would have been dropped off the bill, but it was not even reduced in price. I feel like customer service need retrained. The food tasted great as always, but not enough bread to go with the Garlic plate, they brought more, but meals had been delivered.. I have been taking family and friends to Richardson's over 20 years, but now I will have to rethink my GO-TO place.

e6MiyChBKfKO72uXqa6mhg.text: The flavor and amount of food is unparalleled to any Mexican food place out there. I guess that's it... it's not just Mexican, it's NEW Mexican cuisine; It's wonderful! Great atmosphere and they have drink and appetizer specials after 9pm. I've visited about 5 to 7 times ( mostly dinner, a few late nights, and once for brunch) and each time, the food is outstanding. Some dishes are spicy. It can be pricey but it's so worth it, plus the portions are huge. You will not be disappointed,  there's a reason people drive from all over the valley to come here. Now, EAT!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deliciousness all around

P0938gMaG0n7v-sfXZz9Vw.text: I love New Mexican and southwest food. Richardsons took me back to downtown Santa Fe. The atmosphere is perfect - adobe booths and tables. The salsas served were spicy, and yummy!  I had the New Mexican enchiladas with chicken, veggie, and shrimp. I had to try both sauces, so Christmas it was!  This food is authentic, and we enjoyed every bite. The service was superb as well!  A must while in Phoenix!!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New Mexican enchiladas
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili potato

EQFrLqNVTWV1wvhN6EXm4w.text: This place has a great atmosphere but the food fell flat.  We would have loved to have some actual flavor but someone forgot to add that

h4zKVZVCFbh7jJg37JfwMg.text: I love this place and in return they love my money! It is a little on the high end folk's but worth every dime, everytime! The fish is wonderful. Actually, now thinking about it I must have eaten here 5-6 times and have only ordered the fish. This time I enjoyed the sampler with 3 different types of fish prepared 3 different ways. The mashed potato stuffed pepper is a must as well. Suggest dining inside though. The patio is great for a drink while waiting for a table. We decided to eat outside and unfortunately had to quickly retreat inside plates in hand due to the flies.

p20X8uzxcxHGswmJ1hnSNw.text: If you haven't been....it's a MUST!!  Unless you hate the freshest, highest quality ingredient or Southwest inspired menu, I promise YOU WILL LOVE it!  Everything from the food, bars (one inside one outside), the most friendly, knowledgeable and down to earth staff.....thus place has it.  They own Rokerij next door which is connected by the coolest outdoor patio and Rokerij has an awesome underground bar......dark, mysterious and fun.  Forgot to check in when I was there last week but I'd give the same review as Richardson's.

iuA79lC42J7h6bCXRqDAFg.text: Although expectation is the leading cause of disappointment, I'm here to set some expectations. As far as I'm concerned the individuals who rated this place "average" are some average joe's themselves. The ribs appetizer from this place was so tender and seasoned it was as if the me and the animal had shared a previous bond. This is the only place I've been to that the guacamole could be an actual dish in and of itself. The Chimayo Chicken(add Jalepeno hallandaise, you're welcome) was my entree of choice, and as you can tell from everything I've previously written it was knock your socks off and wash them for you; good. If they served the five stars I gave them, I would slap some jalapeno hollandaise on there and call it a meal.  Everything had just the right amount of spice to leave even the saltiest of critique's satisfied.

wWx2OttebMLKMRsXoK5o8A.text: Hi guy's just a BIG SHOUT OUT to all you guy's at Richardson's , Rokerij  and Dick's down the street all of you mix up lot's of great eat's  and drinks a Special shout out for the bartenders they ROCK  ,,,I recommend all of them ;  )

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Just a Big SHOUT OUT to all you guy&#39;s  Richardson&#39;s  , Rokerij  and down the street at Dick&#39;s you all mix up great eat&#39;s .. ;  )

7L1XmV5eEcAk82FXGrOHtQ.text: My favorite place for a hearty breakfast and memories of home (Though I've lived a lot of places, I claim New Mexico). There is NOTHING like good chile and it's near impossible to find after crossing the NM state line. The adovada and the shrimp enchiladas here meet the challenge!  ...So do the huevos rancheros.   Heck!   You really can't go wrong! (And,  YAY for $5 mimosas!)  And for dinner, my favorite is the pork tenderloin, moist and sweet, basted with a green and red chili jelly and the "famous" GCP (a chile stuffed with cheesy mashed potatoes and baked).  As much as I like the hip Dick's Hideaway location, I'm grateful for a greater shot at a table and the "new" Richardson's location just a smidge up the street.

7GNxUrla6307jzUgxn88hA.text: Came here to find out if this place knows how to make authentic New Mexican food. I grew up eating Carne adovoda and green chile stew. I was feeling home sick and this place definitely hit the spot. The stew was wonderful and the Carne adovoda was pretty good. Turns out they know what they are doing when it comes to New Mexican food. Some of the items on the menu are New Mexican food with a twist, I can't wait to find out how everything else tastes.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pYbbH1Zr5ys8p4nsn0UCBg.text: Came here for lunch at the end of a conference last week with three other conference attendees and enjoyed a wonderful and unique Southwestern style lunch.  I ordered the Carne Adovada with Eggs; a huge plate with 3 eggs (mine over easy - is their any other way?), a huge chunk of smoked pork simmered in red chili, potatoes (or you can have hash browns), beans all served over a tortilla. The eggs were cooked perfectly, the pork was fall apart fork tender smothered in a rich red chili that added great depth of flavor without overpowering the meat. The potatoes were large cut and good. A real delicious meal that went great with the house margarita.  My other friends each ordered something different, and they all looked really good, especially the Relleno Platter, which I was thinking about ordering before I decided on the Carne Adovada. In fact, there were many things on the menu that I would have liked to try - so much to try but only one lunch/day.  I really enjoyed this place and will seek it out again if I'm in the area.

4FcHvmEutPn2FLHzBAT82g.text: Not only is the food, drink and atmosphere AMAZING, the service is ABOVE & BEYOND!  Josie made a special day even more special!!!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND and say hi to Josie for us!

cSkmxQFwBaSD98M4xTNvRg.text: Lots of good breakfast places in the greater Phoenix area.  I finally got to Richardson's to try theirs, and I'm sorry I didn't make it sooner.  Now I want to work through their entire brunch menu.  I had the Adovada Benedict.  Outstanding, and something I'd never find back home.  It's not really a trip to the Phoenix area if you don't stop for at least one meal here.

K9Uno7BkuxkWNAdMrQXOWg.text: Outstanding, this place has it all.  Food, service and atmosphere...all great!  Chimayo chicken: terrific.  Wife reports Tomatillo Toast:  VERY good and our guest rated the New Mexico EnchiladasAs outstanding.  Bottom Line:  visit with confidence and enjoy!

GhVVM3DVaQj5OaW_V2tT3g.text: I love the food here and try to eat at one of the Richardson Places when I'm in town.  It's a little pricey. Tonight was unfortunately not as good as every other time. Service wasn't great, appetizer took a long time to come out of the kitchen but I must say it was worth the wait. I love the roasted garlic plate and so does everyone I recommend it to. Chicken was cold in my burro and by the time the server came around I was full from eating around it.  She did ask if we wanted something else but didn't want to wait.  I will definitely be back on my next trip and hope it's a 5 star experience.

Yk9AIIL44rj-Lb8RKuuFVg.text: I returned with a group but didn't tell them about my prior review.  Here's my second experience...better than last time but still a food timing issues.  The better part.  I ordered the egg breakfast.  Everything on the plate was great and there was so much I took left overs home which were good reheated later.  The star was the bacon.  The best bacon I've ever eaten in my life.  The valet parkers were speedy and organized.  It's an amazing place to people watch.  Here's the area they still struggle with - speed from food order to table. So the key is just enjoy another beverage and cherish the extra conversation time.

kF6F9BfeAJ7KdcFwBJKcBQ.text: We went to Richardson's for a date night. We were told they don't take reservations for parties less than 4 people. When we arrived, the wait was an hour. We chose to wait because we didn't want to sit at the bar, but after a while we were hungry so we gave in. We were constantly bumped into by anyone passing by behind us and I had some personal space issues with the drunk woman standing next to me. I enjoyed the prickly pear margarita and, with the exception of the crowded bar area, the ambiance was nice. The chorizo spinach dip and sriracha chicken skewers were great but our entrees were just okay. The food was overpriced for what it was.

HP10LVpoDpImcbRWFC2yGQ.text: Such a cool space! The outdoor patio is absolutely beautiful & would be the perfect spot for a group dinner. We sat inside for lunch & started with chips and guac. For my entree I ordered the special of the day, the blackened mahi spinach salad. Huge portion - essentially there was an entire piece of fish on top of a bed of spinach. Definitely couldn't eat the entire thing.  Their happy hour deals look amazing - I'm sure I'll be back!

GNVNav62zLIlhxGOpNlsHg.text: What a disaster! Our food was late, they lost our orders, they do not take separate checks. The food, when it finally came, was very good but the service was worse than any place I have ever ate in my life. This is 2.5 hrs of my life I will never recover.

QySXxaS1ea8sDhdu-rePdw.text: Zero stars.  - Terrible food, mostly canned or pre-processed garbage - Service was pitiful.  Staff was extremely rude and disrespectful to the customers - Atmosphere was depressing.  Dark, dingy, smelly, uncomfortable  My biggest gripe is with management.  They offer happy hour specials, but do not clearly tell you which sections of the restaurant apply to happy hour.  As such, we were overcharged for our meal, and they were not willing to discuss the misunderstanding.  Clyde, the "manager" is pathetic.  He has no authority or power to manage the restaurant.  I'm not sure why the owners would employ a manager who doesn't respect customers, but I can see why they have not given any decision-making authority to this hapless schmuck.  Under no circumstances should you go to Richardsons.  Best case scenario, you eat overpriced, low-end slop in a depressing setting.  Worst case scenario, they'll steal your money and give you food poisoning.

4oIxMlXrpYppfN_R90DBQA.text: Tell me why you dont have high-chairs! Had a reservation here this evening. My husband said three and a toddler. Showed up, my 17 month old started crawling on the table- had to leave, unfortunately. The menu looks phenomenal, the vibe was poppin for  a sunday night, so sad we had to miss out. Until next time- highchairs please!!

x8BCfe5hTBjt6eqEayq-_Q.text: What a wonderful evening to start out with happy hour and mike I or ( my guy ) excellent food from grilled shrimp to creme burlee fun friend, tequila ... Had a great time mike was on top of it at least we were one of few customers on the patio .

Q0brtLPr0CjDxQZL8SdC6w.text: Went to brunch today at the Rokeri and enjoyed it primarily for the service. We were relegated to the bar which I wasn't to happy about but turned out to be the highlight of our visit. We were seated across from chef Laura and were treated to her magical touch. There wasn't a empty seat in the room and when we asked whether a certain sauce was to spicy she stopped cooking and brought a sample. She was aided by the great server Alena and a overworked bartender who's name we didn't catch. Great job bartender! By the way, the food was excellent!

5JCCGSSMLz_xHuDhuMIntg.text: Really, really good food.  Went here for brunch, sat on the outdoor covered patio, and drank cheap mimosas!  I love the New Mexico style of food and great selection of seafood as well.  Good service.  Amazing place overall.

bm6sLKmpF184d1sNZFE_RA.text: Very pricey dinner menu, but I couldn't get a simple salad with a vinegarette dressing. Drinks are over priced without any flair. The carne plate, supposed to be their signature dish had much room for improvement. I had high expectations for my first time at this place, but was definitely disappointed!

oIE6WsmVCjCmSP_IL1dg2w.text: We go here at least once a week and take all our out of town guests when they are visiting! Green and red chiles are unique and flavorful...the smoked meats are always good. Adovada and New Mexican Platter are our go toos. Mimosas are 5 bucks. Specials are delicious. If you're looking for uniquely special food and ambiance this is a great place!

GpIVV1_8BUFKtpjkPZOpkA.text: Their 3 and a half star overall rating is quite generous, in my opinion. The ambiance...eh. The food...heed the warnings regarding portions! I have no problems with taking food home so it doesn't go to waste but, this was nowhere near good enough to even bother. Humongous and ridiculous are the first 2 words that pop into my head. SHARE! We had issues with seating and service but, I was waiting on the food to determine my final opinion. I'm not impressed with the flavor at all. My mom and I had Chimayo Chicken. Asiago is great in moderation. The Chimayo Chicken is not only stuffed with Asiago but, also served on a BED of Asiago! The medley vegetables are...just...a weird combination and not cooked enough. I like my steamed veggies cooked until there is just a bit of crunch. These were way undercooked. The "home of the green chile potato" dish was very bland. I definitely expected more since it's a signature dish. Besides being bland it didn't look or taste fresh. It seemed reheated to me. If it wasn't reheated keep that in mind for the taste you expect. Just overall terrible really. Will never go back.

1yQvOKnn_guHhFohihKrzQ.text: I would like to try Richardson's again. I went on a date here and we were going to order a couple things off the menu, but the manager said, "Let me take care of you- you're going to love this". We looked at each other (date and I) and were like, "Ok, I guess".  The manager sent out a garlic plate. It wasn't the worst thing for a date, since roasted garlic isn't stinky, but it was a cheesy heavy gross mess for me. I'm not into that kind of food at all and would have much preferred to choose something different. It was huge as well, we couldn't even finish it and didn't have any room to try any entrees on the menu.   So, well, next time I know better and will stick to my own palate preferences rather than be persuaded by  a stranger that thinks first date food should be the size and style of a fancy superbowl platter. The dish wasn't gross, but it was incredibly heavy for 2 people. i might order that as an app if I was with a party of 4 or larger.  Overall, the place is beautiful and it's a great date spot. Call ahead and make a reservation though. I hope one day I can go again and try something that I like better.

92aSXKwTn5WysWW5Uha9pQ.text: Absolutely amazing. I eat EVERY meal out. This is one of the best. I had the chilliean sea bass. The atmosphere  ( eat on the patio, I had it to myself Temps high 40s) is almost as good as the food. Service was very friendly and helpful. Thanks to Tana and Jen. Memorable afternoon

T3UobhQRerAEKjzK2Q0BCQ.text: Best restaurant ever!  Never had a bad dish and the staff is great. I've been coming here for over 20 years and it still remains one of my favorites. I recommend everything!

DpEH11EtQXu-k74m7td3OQ.text: Bad service.  Bad breakfast.  Eggs were runny.  Bacon was over cooked.  Server had pissy attitude.  They always pretend it is busier than it really is.  Going down hill.  Go to good egg for a great breakfast.

IwMURtgzKS6csxxQUBLHuA.text: Great New Mexican style food. I have a hard time not ordering the Carne Adovada every time. However, the pork tenderloin and beef tenderloin are great choices. The atmosphere is a winner. Very little light with flickering candles to create a warm enjoyable dining experience. They get it right

xMNq2jvH_8DIYLNvJX4_zQ.text: I am THRILLED that this place is in my new hood.  Came by here again yesterday and could eat my fat ass to death and not get bored.  So many choices and the flavors are simply wonderful.  The ambiance is nice too.  You have to check it out!  :)

p3-FPux2C7UirBzj5ZtLkg.text: Great food! Pork chop was a tad over cooked but flavors are amazing! Fish specials are the way to go. Lots of food, great service and atmosphere. I only wish I could cook with that much flavor.

8ojk-uqwe6mvDFNRZytpEg.text: Oh Richardson's...you never cease to impress  me. I was there tonight for my mother's birthday with my brother, sister in law, niece & nephew & surprisingly enough, it was pretty dead. This was the first time I've been to the new location (hadn't been to the previous location in at least a year) and even though some lady came in & said "OH it's so different but so similar"..(doesn't make a whole lot of sense)...it looks pretty much identical to the previous location...cozy seating & all..pretty sure there's extra seating on the side as well.   The hostess was nice & sat us as soon as our full party was there. We started off with the chips & guac which was pretty fantastic (spicy as well but I love a good kick to my food) & the pinot noir which is fabulous...best pinot I've had in a while.   We then proceed to split the blackened salmon with pineapple salsa (my mother & I) with the mixed veggies & potato stuffed green chile & two side salads....two side salads were definitely not required...they're huge as are the portions typically served at Richardson's. It was delicious.  I'm not sure where previous Yelpers have noted they only have one dessert as we had not only the flan but the sopapillas as well which were prepared perfectly...not too doughy, not too tough. Absolutely great end to the meal.   Overall, great experience. The server was extremely patient with us as we requested things frequently & was laid back while being attentive at the same time.   If ya haven't been, go. It's a great atmosphere for a date & I can't wait to go back once the weather's cooled off to enjoy the patio.

aKKKqZPmrDKt2bJOZyVvnw.text: We have been to this restaurant many times over the years and the food is usually pretty good, but not great. You also have to accept the inevitable explosive stomach pains the next day. It's spicy going in and just as spicy on the way out. From a hospitality standpoint, if I could give this place no stars for customer service and humility, I would.  They really make it apparent after a couple of times dining here that they think very highly of their menu, but in a bad, pretentious way. The wait staff are never overly warm and almost snoody. We thought this was just a fluke, but almost every time turned out to be the same experience. On our last experience, which was the straw that broke the camels back, our family officially swore off this place. Having out of town guests and being nearby to the restaurant, we wanted to let them experience this type of cuisine. We called in to check wait times and they told us come on in and that there was no wait. Upon getting there literally 5 minutes later and basically being obligated to park VIP, which in and of itself is totally ridiculous, the hostess asked if we had a reservation and then acted like I was crazy when I told her we were told to come right over. The restaurant wasn't even busy, but she told us it would be a 30-45 minute wait. We then requested a highchair, which they told us they do not have. Highchairs are not available inside or on the patio we were told, also known as "children are not welcome". Really?!? I mean, lets be real...there are a million other restaurants where I can choose to spend my money and introduce new people too. I will not be giving my service to a restaurant that does not take the effort to return it back to its customers.

T0ZvEwQRWDNyFxRR1wc-lw.text: Where do I start. Made a reservation for my wife's birthday and took my family. We told them we had 6 adults plus a baby. When we arrived a young man led us out to the patio and showed us to our seats. The atmosphere was nice but the table was so low it would have been hard to eat so we asked for another location. They had another outdoor table that was normal height and would work for our party.  They said they had a reservation for that already. Why not place the people that weren't there yet at the lower tables. They took us inside and sat us in a corner booth. The noise level was loud. We waited for the rest of my kids got there and we waited and waited for drinks. We then waited quite awhile for our food. Longer than is the normal time to expect. Even though we mentioned we had an infant they had no booster seats or high chairs.  Not even one. Our waiter said it has been mentioned before but no change. The booth sat in the corner and it was overly hot. As we were finishing our dinner and about to pay the air conditioner was turned on. So over all the service was mediocre. The food was hit and miss from dish to dish as some were good and some were not so. After paying the almost 300 dollar bill we oft and decided we wouldn't be back. Richardsons needs to listen more to their clientele on ways to make things better for all their customers. I DONT recommend this resturant for a lot of reasons.

NjePEWHfmd_ybWHN047gng.text: Always a huge fan of Richardsons/Dick's Hideaway. I went with the green chile meatloaf with eggs, $12. Very well done meatloaf with just the right amount of heat, awesome with over easy eggs! I also put back a few bloody Mary's with a beer back, nice touch! Overall, a great meal.

ga4Fr28QyMlmEA35ZMDXfQ.text: I agree with everyone on here who said the food is great but management sucks.  We went in with a gift card we got for our wedding with the person who gave it to us and other friends.  It had never been used and should have had $60 on it--the server came back and said it only had $18 when we were paying the bill.  My husband wanted to handle it discretely because we were with a group, so he paid the server and spoke with the "manager" (stupid--he should never have paid until this was resolved).    The guy who bought it pulled up his bank statement on his phone to show he paid $60 and we had never been in there--so there was definitely a "mistake" made by the employee who sold it.  The manager did not know what to do and said he would talk to their computer guy when he came in later--it's been 5 DAYS now and no resolution, not even a phone call from the manager to let us know he's on it.  We have had  to call several different managers who all play dumb. I'm sorry, but this is theft--selling an $18 gift card for $60--and poor management for not handling it seriously. Too bad because we had a great brunch but I don't trust the honesty or the competency of people there. DO NOT EVER BUY a gift card from this restaurant.  Update: Filed a complaint against this company with BBB and Attorney General's office.

vV82vJIzB2cal5Ry7tHsrA.text: Went to Richardson's for the first time the other day after hearing about the place for a long time.  I thought the food was good but not great.  The atmosphere as nice but a bit dark for my tastes (to each his own).  Overall I guess I was expecting a bit more than this place delivered.  I had the enchilada plate and as i said it was good but did not stand out compared to other new Mexican enchiladas.  I liked the salsa a lot but the chips were pretty oily. I would go again if someone I know wants to go there - but it it is not high up on my list for a repeat visit - -  overall, the food did not overwhelm me and for Mexican/New Mexican the price was a bit high.  Not a hater of of the place but not a lover either.

Pc1OkFzIjbq98Ja6-7pK8A.text: Food was excellent, service was great, first time here and I will definitely be back! Sat at the bar and the gal that took care of us did an excellent job! She left before we were done and the new girl was pretty good too but the first girl was awesome!

QJB4wJ3F4W4KWCYK78b5KQ.text: Came here on a Sunday for lunch and was seated inside in the bar area. My husband sat down and the cushion he was sitting on was soaking wet. His pants then became wet and when we told the waiter she just said sorry and took the whole cushion/pillows off. We had a sleeping baby in the car seat carrier and the waitress was pretty loud which woke her up. I know it wasn't really her fault really but that made me a little annoyed since I had to hold the baby the entire time now instead of enjoying my meal. It took a little for the food to get there and refills weren't very often. Had to ask her twice for another sprite. The food itself was okay. We came during brunch so maybe if we come during lunch or dinner and try out the menu things might change but the brunch/breakfast wasn't worth it for me. But my husband and brother liked what they ordered.

-13uC8QSTh1079akWL4KgA.text: I come here every time I'm in PHX.  Great wine superb food awesome atmosphere.  Service usually excellent except during crunch times.  Definitely get a reservation or expect to wait!  Osso bucco is phenominal!!!

a4m1PWEwn-C0NXZoLiIpeQ.text: This place is absolutely terrible. If your waitress's name is Misty I suggest you ask to be reseated. She's rude, demeaning, and VERY inexperienced. It'll take you 30 minutes just to grab her attention to place your order.  The food was nothing to die for, and you have to ask for refills. I really wish our experience was better as the reviews below suggest its a decent place, but we will not be back. For the money you spend here you can get a great meal with EXCELLENT service down the road. Usually if the food was not to par but service was good we return for a second try- as every kitchen has an off day. But Misty sealed the deal for us. Management needs to rethink that one.

wG-9nuwNMVDqdJyzYcROvA.text: STAY AWAY - The food has an amazing flavor and the restaurants offers a unique atmosphere.  However, the restaurant is located in a terrible spot along the main road.  The parking situation is so limited with poor entry signage in fine print.  It can get one feeling very agitated and frustrated.  The valet staff was blasting cars out of the driveway and I would not want them parking my vehicle.  I can park my own vehicle but, there is not much place to park.  Once we got thru the obstacle course and made it into the compound things went more sour.  The hostess seemed excited to quote 45 minute wait at Richardson's and sent us over to check at Rokerij with a longer wait of an hour. Imagine that, all on a Tuesday night. It wasn't even a weekend. I know it says something for the food.  Although, it isn't that large of a place.   In any case, we all just left and went somewhere else.  As a result, I found a great taco shop with great service.  This isn't the first time I've been to Richardson's where I encountered this type of situation but, this is the first time I decided I should write about it.  I was not real pleased with the way the hostess and staff interacted.  Richardson's staff seem to think it is a privilege for me to eat at the establishment and give my business.  In any case, I left dissatisfied and very hungry.  Lets just say I would not go out of my way to recommed this place.  I would recommend Richardson's if you can make reservations and walk there or if you don't mind waiting an hour and half to be seated for dinner.  Perhaps some people are more lucky with better service.  If you are visiting there anyway, maybe try going early.  As I mentioned, the food is amazing but, the service experience might not be so great.  You might even get bad table service from a snotty server like I did on a previous visit a few months back. I gave Richardson's several months before I decided to return back and now this. Now, I'm really not in a hurry to return.  Well they probably won't miss the business anyway.  Did anyone else notice it took some other yelp reviewer people up to 11 years to return?  I wonder why?   If you read this and decide to visit anyway,  maybe you'll have better luck than I have.  If not,  don't say I did not warn you. Good Luck!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Richardson&#39;s

HqiIwx3QYEKOdVhhSux88A.text: So we came here after finding out Rokerij doesn't serve the new Mexican food anymore. My Lil Sis was in town and the rellenos were a must ! My Mom, both Sisters and I came on our girls day after the art museum and shopping. It was the perfect way to end the day ! Our food was amazing !!!!!! The enchiladas and rellenos were out of the world !!! All I wanted in life at that moment ! I also tried the carne adovada and cordon bleu, they were very good also. We had the skewers thinking that were like the rokerij version, but they weren't, still good though. We finished with the flan and sopapillas. The flan was really good. I am not crazy about flan, but I really enjoyed theirs. The sopapillas were good, not authentic, but still very good. I appreciated the density even though it isn't how I have always known them to be.

nPQ0s66bXq4apAE5SOjPxw.text: Not the best experience for at this chain of restaurants. It was our first time back to Richardson's new building and we were there for lunch. It looks just the same on the inside, complete with the horrible step up as you head left after entering the restaurant. C'mon guys, you couldn't have put in a ramp? Two people tripped on that step as we were having our brunch. We were at the first table as you walk in to the left, right next the the fireplace. Unfortunately, I don't think they had the thing set up right because we were blown with ash at one point.   We got the eggs benedict jalapeno to share because the plates are usually so large. It was plenty of food, but not stellar. The english muffin was cut so the bottom was so thin that it got soggy and flimsy with the jalapeno hollandaise. The meat was supposed to be pork loin, but we were served a big piece of thin ham. Yes, I understand pork and ham are the same animal, but what we got was not pork loin. It was a much cheaper version. For $15 I was not happy. I was happy we didn't each order a dish and get completely ripped off.   The service was not great but I chalked it up to our waitress not having a good day. She came by after we waited nearly 10 minutes to get our drink order and we tried to put in our food order, but she walked away as we trying to say "and then...". She also refilled my coffee without asking if I'd like more (my personal pet peeve). I just hate it when the automatically pour in more coffee when my cup isn't even half empty. I have the sugar/cream proportion perfectly set to my taste and you just threw it off because you swooped in and didn't ask. Grrr. She did this twice. I had food in my mouth the second time and don't like to throw up a hand (I think it's rude). Grrrrrrr.   Last oddity was the fact that the charge shows up as "burningembers". I couldn't figure it out for a few minutes before it finally hit me. You know, because they keep burning down their restaurants. Bet their insurance is a doosey.

7jvM8zCES5V4dPW6eZyZUw.text: I was really looking forward to eating at Richardsons but was unfortunately let down. My wife and I ordered 3 dishes and only one was worth eating.  The ceviche comes in a bowl of salsa with little fish. The garlic plate was okay but nothing to write home about.  Our final dish was the carne adobada. I loved this dish but it was a little too spicy for my wife.  The service was great however our first round of drinks tasted watered down and at $13 per drink, I would like it to taste like it contained alcohol.

4e63u5kybmLCrIbvucLOCw.text: The food is excellent. We have been coming here for years and have never had a bad meal. The seafood is great!

MvIzOwEHKVAUws-xkkzW8A.text: Their carne adovada, prickly pear margaritas, and patio are what dreams are are of. We always enjoy having a girls night or date night here, especially during cool weather, so we can sit on the patio. It is pricey, but I've never had better carne adovada anywhere!

Q5xa10izFJqlDZFO4K3jYw.text: My friend invited me for lunch with friends since I know my New Mexican food and  amazingly, I haven't been here yet after a decade in the valley. I judge every New Mexican restaurant by their carne adovada, the signature dish of northern New Mexico besides the green chile cheeseburger and sopapilla.  Sitting outsude is a choice to be weighted heavily given the weather. Nice for evenings but not for lunch in the summer unless you're under the misters. You might THINK you'll be OK in the shade... We ate outside on the patio for Sunday lunch.  Anyway service was nice but somewhat inefficient. The beertaps were 10 feet away but our server went inside, I guess to add the order as well as have it filled. It took a while to bring back the incorrect beer. Anchor Steam and Lagunitas IPA are the saving graces for beer. Anchor Steam was served at first in a Hoegaarten 330ml glass.  This is UNDER 12 ounces for $5.75.  UNACCEPTABLE. Don't accept the "premium beer" line, get a big boy glass. My next one I asked for a big boy glass. I tried my friend's bloody mary and it tasted totally righteous - this isn't a mellow V-8 tomato soup pillow! Garnishes vary, you might get a mushroom, you might get a celery stick...  Our appetizer was served without silverware or napkins. Asked for silverware from manager.  My main was carne adovada with eggs. The plate had an excellent eye appeal and was served extremely hot. You'll need to be prepared for this as all hot plates are served ON A HOT METAL PLATE. BEWARE. You're warned by me as well as the server.  So how was the carne adovada? Not technically accurate or traditional. The meat was smoked (they have a smoker and a woodpile out back), and this is not usually done in New Mexico - the pork is usually marinated overnight before being slow cooked for several hours and the fat rendered out. Here at Richardson's not all the fat was rendered out and this made for some sort of funk in one bite, and the smoke flavor was to the point of ashtray on another few bites. Mean and in between though was a nice smoky style to the carne adovada but it seemed overpowering.  Good CA has a depth of flavor in the red chile sauce with the other ingredients.   It also came with beans and the flavor was great and out of the ordinary. The potatoes were plain and so were the scrambled eggs (eggs are made to order, you don't HAVE to get scrambled.)  I guess we have to sit inside for decent and accurate service, but I'll give another dish a chance.

fOjVfbnHVmxv4TxN3D4urA.text: I had lunch here one afternoon when it was surprisingly not crowded. I am giving four stars for an always cozy atmosphere and a nice patio.  I had the enchiladas which had a nice kick, especially the pork. But the quality if the food in relation to the price is what gets me. Everything is good but not great enough to warrant the prices. And the service is almost always lacking.  This particular time, we seemed to be the victim of our server going on break and their being a breakdown in communication or coordination. In any case, we had to  wait a while before our drinks were refilled and my salad was forgotten. Our server was nice and apologetic so no worries. Not always the case as some servers make it clear that they are way above looking after the likes of us.  So overall, not a bad place, the prices, quality and atttiude serve as enough of a deterrent to patronize again in the future.

xbnlMTQd1nYo1EL7crPyIw.text: This place is the most amazing ambience and food I have had in a long time! I loved it! They have Rye!!! As in Whiskey!   Very cool vibe and the food was so good. I even tried to come home and copy their Roasted Green Chili Baked potato... I didn't do it justice, so I will need to go back and have it again.   The place is small, and the parking non-existent, but they have complimentary valet and that helps. Get there early or make sure to make reservations.   LOVED THIS PLACE! Loved everything about it!

xyLs-afiT9bpbsaXtBg0PQ.text: The blackened swordfish was absolutely fantastic!  Great service and attention from the professional staff. I'd definitely come back!

Jvegh4t0HBCD8bkn6UPb6Q.text: The food is good and there's a lot of it. The atmosphere is great, but is a little dark.

PHOs7aMTIxePEi7U8K8KUA.text: I just had l lunch here. The enchiladas were excellent! The red chile is hotter than the green chile and both were very good. I finished off with the sopapillas. The outdoor patio has a fireplace for temperate desert evenings. I ate at the beautiful brass bar. I definitely recommend this place.

xrpy6AZz52SpHGPWLCE2IQ.text: Loved this place so much, I wanted to stay for hours. Felt just like home. It's a very cozy restaurant, yet fancy and I love that. The waiter was very friendly. The food thou, it's delicious! Can't remember what I ordered but I'm pretty sure I will be ordering the same when I go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Can&#39;t remember what it was but it was yummy!
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very cozy
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very romantic, all the tables have this

mR3AneXE8QnhVha75_pydA.text: This place is amazing. Great food, beautiful patio, AMAZING service. My roommate and I stopped in for breakfast a couple weeks ago. We got a few Mimosas and the Carne Adovada Eggs Benedict. In addition to the delicious food, our server Chris was so accommodating and fun.   Would recommend to anyone in PHX. Will be going for dinner in the near future!

mWs5vuCEt-Cj96V-W2PQKg.text: Unfortunately, this is my first negative review of a restaurant. New to the Phoenix area, my husband and I went to Richardson's yesterday evening, per our hotel concierge's recommendation.  We ordered drinks, appetizers, and two main courses. I tried the Carne Asada Pizza, and after the first bite, I could barely take another. It was UNBELIEVABLY spicy (the meat was fine, but the pizza sauce was not). It completely ruined the flavor and taste of the pizza - and the over-seasoning of the sauce made it completely inedible. I'm even tolerant towards spicy food and enjoy most meals 'with a kick', but this entree had a BOOT of ruined spicy flavor - and I'm now convinced there was a mistake in the kitchen with over-seasoning/peppering the plate, which I understand can happen on occasion. I tried a few more bites, hoping I had just gotten a flick of habanero pepper, but each subsequent bite was just as bad, TOO hot. My husband could tell I was struggling (ie eyes watering, guzzling water, lips on fire), so I offered a bite to him, to see if my judgement was skewed, and after he tasted, he said 'no, you're right! It's like 'burn a hole in your stomach spicy'!'  And this is when our experience turned for the worse. I've never had to tell a server that I can't eat a plate because it's too spicy, but I respectfully pulled ours aside, and informed her of the situation. I thought she'd be more understanding and would offer to send the dish back and simply have it re-cooked, with less spice. But all she offered me, was a quick, 'I'm sorry.... can I bring you some sour cream?' She explained that the sauce was made like that and never offered to fix the dish (or inform the cook) - but merely asked if I wanted to order something else. After I told her, 'no, I don't need sour cream (which would not have fixed the dish regardless) nor did I want to order (and wait) for another entree,' she took my completely uneaten plate, and the WORST part, brought the check, fully charging us for the pizza (which hadn't been touched, minus the few small, trial bites). It wasn't worth arguing about, but we were most disappointed with the service and the handling of the situation (the server/restaurant could have simply comped the pizza, right?!). While the ambiance of Richardson's (and all other food we tried) was great, we wish they could have better handled the situation of a seriously bad plate. For this, we will never return or recommend this restaurant to anyone.

bfJREAv7fbN6RcWluA1TNQ.text: Lovely dinner.  The staff is cordial, the ambiance is warm, the smell coming out of the exhaust fans outside is heavenly.  I came on a night when I wasn't feeling well and still forced myself to eat.  Wasn't a fan of the bar element as I'm more into intimate, quiet dining, but would still gladly come back.  Good New Mexican isn't that easy to find outside of NM.

0k0AjudW2zaoJznbn1vWtg.text: Eggs Benedict Jalapeno is one of the top 5 breakfasts in town. Today the weather is awesome so the patio is perfect.

r7uaHoVE0yZyIvXHj_NiPA.text: This is a great new mexican restaurant for Arizona. I am from New Mexico so I am pretty particular. We had good service and both the green and red chile was good but I really loved the flavor of the green. We will be going back.

AsST49z-vdf4FTceO71J-g.text: Great atmosphere. We had a corner booth. Not too crowded for a Thursday night. Low lighting. Large portions, so maybe order to share. We started w the cheese dip which was yummy. I had the tortilla crusted fish with broccolini and the famous potato. While the potato was just okay, the rest of the meal was delicious. Free valet parking. I'd visit again.

2HR_SWWn4E_yz4QYLtqPyw.text: SHORT VERSION:  MAJOR disappointment tonight.    Just paid $52 for 2 Pasta Heidi's (online menu says $22 each but they are now $24 each) from "Richardson's" when the EXACT SAME ITEM at "Rokerij" is $18.  Received horrendous service from Richardson's tonight.  FULL VERSION:  First off, it really kills me to write this.  My husband and I loved this place and met here often for dinner after work.  It's been a gem for us but I'm not sure we will go back after tonight.  My husband ordered 2 Pasta Heidi's to go tonight for our dinner tonight.  Nothing else.  No sides, no drinks, nada.   It's pretty far out of our way for a to-go order (from our house) but we were craving this delicious dish from Richardson's/Rokerij big time so we were more than willing to make the trek.  However, when my husband was about to sign for the bill, he noticed something felt off.  It was much more expensive than we normally pay.  He asked if the prices went up and the gal mentioned she wasn't sure, but that maybe it was because we had called the Richardson's phone number and not the Rokerij number. He then went to the Rokerij side and checked out their menu.   Mind you, as many people who eat here know, there is a lot of carry over between the two.  In essence you can order many of the same items from one vs the other.  Heck, they even use the same font and menu layout!  Sure enough, he was right.  There was a $6 price difference for the exact same item.  He asked about it and a male server said they had just had this conversation with management last week because it doesn't make any sense and people have mentioned it.   My husband then walked back over to the Richardson's side and asked to speak to someone about it since it must just be a mistake.  Our meal was literally $12 more at Richardson's for no real reason.    After explaining the issue with the lady he was directed to (wish we had gotten her name) all she said "I don't know anything about that" and that "it is what it is" with a very condescending tone.  She neglected to offer any assistance to explore or amend the issue and smugly shrugged at him like he was crazy.  For the record, if this were a mere couple dollar difference we wouldn't have bothered, but $12 is a pretty big difference.  At the end of the day our experience was a seasoned patron's nightmare and it breaks my heart to share this story.  If you absolutely must have the Pasta Heidi, save yourself some frustration and money by ordering it at Rokerij.  Please see my photos for proof.  Both are menu screen caps from their website.   Both documents are dated 6.30.14, which indicates this is an issue they've probably known about for a while and haven't bothered to correct.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. As of 9/13/14 &#34;Rokerij&#34; charges $18 for the same Pasta Heidi as &#34;Richardson&#39;s&#34;.  However, Richardson&#39;s makes you pay $24.  Wtf?!
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. As of 9/13/14 &#34;Richardson&#39;s&#34; now charges $24 for the same Pasta Heidi as &#34;Rokerij&#34;.  Rokerij charges $18.

fCBXUV_zY_G-ePXueEaVMA.text: Having dined here approximately 5 years ago and having enjoyed our meals I wanted to revisit the restaurant.   First, is the mandatory (complementary) valet parking. I am perfectly capable of parking my own car, thank you, without the need to use a valet service.   Second, chips and salsa:  Sorry, Chevy's is just as good but the habanero salsa is wonderfully freakin hot!  Third, my wife's seafood combo was wonderful. My tamales were just so-so with too stringy pork inside. I've had as good or better eating tamales at my farmers market. Rice was dry and crusty in places. The pinto beans were just plain bland.   I'll revisit on my next trip, or maybe not.

m7gWt7R4YSSSfqqnqBw2fA.text: Yes! I don't know why I have waited so long to leave this place a 5 star review... The food is to die for. The food here is always in big portions but is the best food I have tasted, you can order anything on the menu and be satisfied. My favorites are the benedicts. They have delicious bloody mary's and never leave you with your glass empty. They are open on almost every holiday serving the valley. I recommend this place to all of my friends.

RZuq14dxYOSbDlEF6WQphw.text: Went in on a Sunday night, great looking place and the service was on point. It was a little slow and the bartender chatted with us pretty much the entire time. What was suppose to be dinner and drinks, turned into an all nighter. The food was great, I had the enchilada plate and it was just packed with flavor. I haven't been I awhile but I may return soon and try something else, considering I live in the area there are just so many options that I still want to try around me.

hVQ-2PQQ6p_bTQ8JLzNyzQ.text: My wife and I are from New Mexico and were thrilled with the find. Richardson is one of our favorite places. Because of the food we had our wedding reception there last Saturday. Everyone raved about the food.... Well, except two young people who thought the food was spicey. Their server was on top of it and got them both something to satisfy their taste buds The wait staff and management were fantastic.   The reason I gave a 4 instead of a 5? Because of the poor follow through/communication. I worked with one  office staff for scheduling. The first impression was great but her follow thruogh was minimal to non existent at times. Finally, after 2 weeks of no communication (3 weeks til the wedding) I complained! To everyone who would listen. I even posted on Yelp. The next day I got a call and a text.  After all is said and done...I am grateful all worked out in the end. Regardless of all the bumpy couple of weeks. Richardson is the bomb and worth your patronage!

0ibWt0lqN8AWtjiXbnGqIQ.text: After not having been to Richardson's before they relocated I was less than impressed.  I remembered well the prickly pear margarita that was so good and when I tried it again all i could taste was sweet...no tequila. The service was severely lacking.  We ordered appetizer and had to ask twice as to where they were..  They also refused to put us on separate checks which most restaurants will do. The busboy was actually more helpful than the waitress.  This was actually wasted money as far as I was concerned..The only saving grace were the chili relleno's were pretty good.

LYeSgbXh2_kfBkb-O7-V2A.text: Great atmosphere, friendly service, but the food was just okay for me-- some dishes were definitely better than others. I ordered the sriracha chicken and my bf ordered the porckhop. I didnt think the chicken was very good at all, i much preferred his pork chop-- the flavors and texture had way more depth. On the bright side, drinks were strong and the waitress came around a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo porkchop $27
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chimayo chicken $24

Q-OkJbk0m4TXjRkJoQp7Dw.text: Have lived in the valley for three years and this is hands down my favorite restaurant.  Have never had a bad meal here.  My two favorites are the Carne Adovada and the New Mexican Platter.  The New Mexican Platter is not for the faint of heart and should be attempted only on an open stomach.    Great atmosphere, great vibe, can't recommend highly enough.

Tb18GFEqf7mkvrDfJHTugA.text: I hear this is the most authentic New Mexico food in town.   In any event it is really really good. Food is fantastic and the clientele are loyal because you will see the same faces. Excellent place especially over the long haul.

YWyK9ymXRk1KLhcEHyUnJw.text: LOVE IT LOVE IT!! Every entree is delicious but the Sea Bass is the best outstanding and I order it every time we go to Richardsons. We love to take friends there to introduce them to the quality of food and comfortable environment. It's on the top of our list of Best Restaurants in the Valley!

cRFOEhCW0mmn-lOzbwe_QA.text: Richardson's is a True classic in the Valley! It has been here forever! I have been dining here since I was a young girl (...it is one of my dad's favorites) and have ALWAYS loved their delicious house salad! Last night, I told my boyfriend that I hadn't been in years and wanted to check it out again on our date night! Not much has changed, it is still the same dark and cozy atmosphere! And yup, the salad was just as delicious! This time I ordered it with beef tenderloin and the meat was marinated and cooked to perfection! We also split the queso dip with chorizo as an appetizer and it was fantastic. The house margarita was not the best marg that i've ever had but it did the trick. You should also know that it IS a little pricey. I was actually pretty shocked by some of the entree prices but if you stick with the basic meals (enchiladas, burgers, etc.), you can order a plate under $25. I'm sure we'll be back with family again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super poor quality photo --sorry! It was very dark and I had to use a flash. This is the Richardson&#39;s salad with beef tenderloin.
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious queso dip with chorizo!

dVyWu-Qqdt89I5B_VljjeQ.text: The food is great but the margaritas are the bomb.  I had the mole and it was rich and just the right spice.    Our waiter was a hoot, asking a lot of questions and super helpful on ordering.  Even giving us a hard time because we ordered the same thing and we should have ordered different items and share.  It was a good time.  Did I mention how great the margaritas were?

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Did I mention, get a margarita for gods sake.

_JsZQfRZtROmmpE3iw4TMw.text: We found this spot on chance. What an amazing spot! Atmosphere, service, and food were all excellent.   Walking in was a great experience feeling like you stepped into dim lit romantic spot. The menu is varied but the items we had were incredible, very flavorful and attention to detail.   I highly recommend this place.

hzobPJwoZ7TjnoX-naVKng.text: I don't understand why this place was recommended to us. The only thing that was decent was the guac and I'm sure that is because it's pretty hard to mess up something as delicious as an avocado, unless you add too much salt. We were a big party (like 20 of us) so we all tried each other's food. I was not impressed with even one dish. I am used to super authentic Mexican food so that could be why, but either way, I was super unimpressed and won't be returning.

PUyq8LACuamIeOU5y-uPRg.text: Hard to beat this atmosphere and New Mexican cuisines!  I went to Richardson's for the first time for a business lunch meeting. Upon entry, I was surprised to see a unique setup and design of the restaurant. It's not very often that you enter a restaurant and get curious to look around. I plan to return just to visit the different areas.   My client and I ordered a guacamole appetizer to snack on and I went with the New Mexico Enchiladas for my entree (choice of three: vegetable, green chile pork, chicken, grilled shrimp, beef, cheese, or smoked turkey, served with rice & beans, with choice of red or green chile). Let me tell you, the enchiladas were incredible! I like to eat and believe that I can put down some food...no joke, I had two full meals worth of food from the one entree. Their portions of food are very generous! Reason for the 4-stars was my business client did not receive the side salad that was ordered.  I look forward to returning for another outing to enjoy more delicious drinks, food and explore the property more!

ZyB9CYjJMVawNHB-dkoueQ.text: I can't believe I've never written a review of Richardson's.  How many times have I been in here?  Like, a million?  A billion?  A quadrillion?  Ok so it must be a smaller number, but enough to have gained a few lbs from their always delicious and always ample grub.     This also happens to be my (now) 19 y/o daughter's favorite restaurant in Phoenix and this is probably the 3rd year in a row we've had a birthday meal here.  This time since it was a workday, the girls came up and met me for lunch, which gave us the opportunity to enjoy items off the brunch menu (served till 4pm daily!).  We started with the (chorizo) Con Queso, which was amazeballs.      I had the Carne Adovada Benedict, which was one of the best bennies I've ever had, with pork that was super tender and flavorful soaked in their jalapeno hollandaise and, True to form, totally massive.  Two others had varying enchilada dishes, which they raved about, and another had the Huevos Rancheros, which she raved about as well.    Oldest daughter had a Prickly Pear Margarita which made her eyes go wide with enjoyment when she first tasted.  Winning!    Finally, our server brought our 19 y/o a trio of birthday mini-desserts - a cheesecake-in-a-pot (consistency of a pot de creme with the flavor of a cheesecake), a dense flourless chocolate cake and a creme brulee.  The brulee was her favorite.    We had good service and a good time!  Thanks again Richardson's!

TzCgIMvTbQ0vNrK4L5E70A.text: Great restaurant with a super bar downstairs, feels like a speakeasy.  Great spot right in front of the fireplace.  Service was outstanding and great happy hour specials. I ordered an appetizer with elephant garlic that was outstanding.  Had home made chips for GF.

nO2v7ju9Ef-vHp1P0CqfiA.text: We love Richardson's for brunch delicious New Mexico  cuisine and a great atmosphere cozy booths and friendly servers and bartenders. My wife had the breakfast burrito served with house potatoes and charro beans she ordered it veggie style and I had the Richardson's combo which comes with an eggs Benedict with a jalapeno hollandaise 2 chicken enchiladas topped  with red chili and green chili sauce and grilled asparagus both were wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bill
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Richardson&#39;s combo

WrRpRK2ygTg3ZGl2zX6V8Q.text: This is one of the closest representations of NEW Mexican food in the valley. It fell short in a couple areas.   1. Chili bean serving was gigantic on the two entres we ordered (see pics) chili relleno and adovada and eggs.  2. The red chili decently came from New Mexico I would even venture to say Hatch. However, the flavor was missing some garlic   All that said with the price point I would expect a little better attention to detail.

KFXGnjjq2YbJZ1caVJ7pCA.text: We sat outside near the fireplace which was so nice and warm. Such a cool restaurant with inside and outside bar. Lots of seating outside with heating lamps. The food was absolutely fantastic which is no shock since it's owned by the same people as the Rokerij and Dicks Hideaway. We had a very relaxing brunch. I will definitely be back more often. I love their green chili sauce it's the best I have ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Can&#39;t go wrong with pancakes
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best breakfast burrito
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and green chili gravy

WBbAHDIOVjYqRPENGBi8tQ.text: This place never disappoints  We have been coming to the aside Door and also the Original Restaurent for many years up until it burned down  We are at the Side Door and food and service was excellent

7F9iRehW82URUcasdia6uQ.text: They say Richardson's is an institution, and I was looking for a place that was a little more upscale to take my friends to dinner as a special treat. I admit the venue is terrific and you can opt to sit in a cozy booth inside, or switch it up and sit on their covered patio (or is it a veranda/). We came on a Monday night and it was pretty relaxed - not so busy that I felt pressured. I wanted to have a relaxing dinner, so that suited me.  But food wise? I was not impressed. The best part of our meal was the fried asparagus - but, really, even a flip-flop dusted in panko crumbs and deep fried tastes good.  Two guesses as to what I ordered. Yup, that's right, the salmon. It came with their legendary green chile potato and brussel sprouts. The salmon featured a blueberry jalapeno salsa. We also ordered the pork mole and the chicken cordon bleu. The portions are huge. The mole plate would have fed the 3 of us and still created leftovers! My plate must have held a good 1/2 lb. of brussel sprouts. And I like brussel sprouts (that's in fact why I ordered them), but these were the kind my mom used to force us kids to eat back in the days before chefs figured out how to romantically roast slivers of sprouts so they're slightly charred, sweet and crisp. So...these big ole' babies got pushed to the side. As did the blueberry salsa which, on its face, seems amazing. But instead of adding a bit of heat to soften the blueberries and meld the flavors, or a bit of sugar to help bring out some of the juices, this salsa was just whole blueberries that kept sliding off the top of my salmon. Finally, what the heck is the cult fascination with this green chile potato concoction? I found it to be bland and not very interesting. Mashed potato (with maybe a bit of chile powder for color?) stuffed in a green chile - I'd rather have amazing mashed taters made with bits of hatch green chile with a really lovely gruyere or similar. Are you getting the impression that I didn't find the food that interesting, especially for the price point?  I know I'm in the minority. Everyone loves this place and in fairness, it does deserve to be on the list of Phoenix restaurants that have made an impact on the culinary scene. I think my next visit will be for happy hour. And you, fair-minded Yelper, should come and check it out yourself and make your own determination. Order those asparagus frites. And bring an appetite!

-TFA0k5c3TyvwOuwDeo7sg.text: French toast , eggs and hashbrowns! Yum! What an amazing breakfast! The portions here are big plan on splitting it with your bestie or a significant other!  The outdoor seating is phenomenal i love the bar and high tops for amazing and personal service and conversation with you wait staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

k91DjdouKYV7LlKZAZmI-g.text: Food was delicious. Ordered the sausage burrito with green chile, which packed a punch.  Portions are very generous and could get two meals out of it.

AhxU8niXpN1MZi70WJhNGw.text: Okay LISTEN. The Eggs Benedict is so good I could cry. The hollandaise sauce was super thick and they poached the eggs perfectly. I couldn't decide between the Benny and the Rellenos & Eggs, and our server Dyllan gave us awesome recommendations and substitutions to make sure I could try both. He was super kind, patient with all my questions, and has great energy. Thanks for the awesome service and food! :)

YboFVEJcAxEK5-sbuPLezw.text: I truly love the ambience, the decor, and the staff at Richardson's. So much so that my husband and I had our 35th wedding anniversary and vow renewal ceremony and celebration here with our beloved family and friends. It was the perfect location for our small group and everybody loved it! The New Mexico style menu is a little on the spicy side but oh so good! So many great items to choose from and you will not be disappointed! They also have an adjoining restaurant Rokerji and Dick's Hideaway for a speakeasy experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful patio dining area!

1bhOAvbHcWnpKrYkhKfVng.text: This place never disappoints. I love the food especially as it's on the spicy side. They have a large selection of southwestern style steak & seafood.   I ordered the Taos Tenderloin, which is 3 medallions, each with a different sauce. The meal comes with a salad. The main dish is served on a tortilla with beans and a green chile potato (GCP). The meat was so tender! One of the best places in town for spicy food that's not the usual Mexican style cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FZJcFc3S7C5DMFWlrjqzPg.text: We came here to celebrate a birthday party and was lucky enough to score a table outside. It's a small place and so if it gets crowded, it might be difficult to find seats. We were lucky enough to take advantage of happy hour deals. I had the prickly pear margarita which was somewhat strong. We also tried the quesadilla, queso and the burger. I recommend the quesadilla and queso. The Green Chile burger was ok and would not order it again. I really liked the atmosphere and vibe. Parking is valet so make sure you have a couple of $ bills for tip.

srIBf9Sf6tq5qtmq7qUesg.text: Delicious food and fantastic service! What more can you ask for on a date night... love this place!

s6EKuaGUrsCSiMsFb71pdA.text: Oh. My. GOD! Amazing, this place is just everything. It is a must for all Phoenicians and visitors alike. You can't find a place like it. Richardson's is Dick's Hideaway's cousin and they are both just absolutely fantastic. The atmosphere is romantic and intimate. The food and service is phenomenal. I can't recommend it enough.

l-uPpwAAuIUkYWBdGOGspw.text: I was traveling through for the day, met a local who suggested Richardson's. Went for lunch on a Friday, it was busy and we didn't have reservations so sat at the bar.  Atmosphere definitely gives you an authentic vide, staff was friendly, and service was quick. Food was great, I had the enchiladas with their green chili. Beware it's more spicy than typical so if you are weak when it comes to spice, order cautiously.   I'll definitely be back next time in town.

CusrTAnsX19S1biCZSV3WQ.text: Nice place. Our server was professional and friendly. The atmosphere is nice and fun. Portions are generous.I ordered sliders and they were a bit too spicy, so if you like hot food, I recommend it. Be aware of the cacti  in the decoration- they are real and the thorns hurt!

MDh7X3fWodEaEbM_dVLQIw.text: Took clients here for lunch.   If you like spicy southwestern food, this is the place for you.   One of my clients even ordered a side of habanero salsa cause it wasn't quite spicy enough.   Guess what??  That sauce could be considered a bit on the hot side!    Since we were celebrating an almost closing on their house, she had the mimosa, and he and I had the bloody mary.   I don't normally order bloody marys, but even that was a bit on the spicy side.   It was good, though.   If I was into bloody marys, that's what I'd get, at least, from here.   I like the spiciness of it.  I ordered my standard carne adovada, he had the corn enchiladas and she had the pork carnitas.   (Or was it the other way around??)  Still love the carne adovada.   It comes with rice and beans, and I added some of the habanero salsa as well.   They both stated they loved what they ordered albeit he said his enchiladas was a bit spicy.  I definitely would come here again.   It's my go to place for southwestern food in the desert.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. carne adovada
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. corn enchiladas
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. pork carnitas

Qb4XIDhApyH6oVhelFiu0w.text: OH, RICHARDSONS!!!  You broke my heart!  After 2 wonderful, memorable "home-run"  experiences in the past, I bring my family to share good times and brag on you...and YOU LET ME DOWN...BADLY!!    Before arriving in Phoenix this weekend,   I learned though that the old Richardsons burned down but another "sister" restaurant "Rokerij" was serving the Richardsons menu.  I thought that's cool!  I am sorry to say that this time, it was a MAJOR FUMBLE.  I don't think a restaurant has ever disappointed me like Richardsons or Rokerij (or whatever they call themselves".    I ordered one of their blackboard special entrees of the day:  Sea bass encrusted in pine-nuts.  The waitress told me I could have either mashed potatoe baked in a half of a jalapeno, or I could have plain mash potatoes.  I chose the plain mash potatoes since I cannot eat jalapeno.  My husband (who is trying to go vegan) ordered the calamari entree salad.    My son ordered the pastole soup and a BBQ chicken pizza.  Past 2 experiences at Richardsons:  we were always served chips and salsa when we sat down.   This time:  no chips and salsa.   So, we ordered some.  we didn't get it for 15 to 20 minutes.  (And they charged us.)  My son was served his Pastole soup at the same time as the pizza, not ahead of the pizza.  That was odd.  Then when he started eating the pizza, it was not the pizza he ordered.  It was a plain feta cheese pizza, not BBQ chicken.  My husband's salad tasted bitter...my husband said he thought the lettuce did not taste fresh.    As for MY entree, it was served about 10 minutes AFTER my family received their food.  AWKWARD!!  My son and husband didn't feel comfortable eating their dinner when I sat there with nothing (except chips).  When my entree finally arrived, it had the wrong potato...the one I didn't order...the one with the jalapeno green pepper...not the plain mashed potato.  Also, the pine-nut encrusted sea bass didn't look like it had any pine-nuts.  I wouldn't have ever guessed that there was a shred of pine nut associated with that fish.  So, I inquired and was told that just because it said it was encrusted with pine nuts doesn't mean that it would be covered with pine-nuts...it was supposed to be a "dusting".    It was clear by this time,. we were having major problems with our dining experience.  I thought, this can't be the same Richardsons I remembered from the past.    The waitress was "busy" and my husband went in search of the manager at the front of the restaurant.  He was in the middle of explaining the problem to the manager when the phone rang...the manager told my husband he had to take the call and my husband was just left standing there.   (Oh, really??  You interrupt a customer standing in front of you telling you about a service issue to take a phone call?)  My husband is a good sport and he waited and then continued to expalin the problem.    Some minutes later, the manager appeared at our table with the plain mashed potatoes.  As he served me the potatoes, he blurted out that "I wasn't really supposed to get a choice of potato in the first place, since I was ordering off the Richardsons menu".  (Recall the waitress gave me the option...I didn't ask for the option.  I didn't know what menu I was ordering off of...how am I supposed to know?) Is the manager actually telling  the customer that she shouldn't have gotten what they offered.  (OH REALLY??)  My husband explained then that the waitress had offered it.  Reply:  "She wasn't supposed to."  (OH, DEAR! WHAT'S A CUSTOMER SUPPOSED TO DO!)    So, in summary:  most of what COULD  have gone wrong at Richardsons DID: 1)  Chips and salsa (I guess not offered to patrons complimentary anymore).   We requested them and were charged the $5...alright, I can pay for the chips.  It's just odd they don't offfer this anymore.  AND why did it take 20 minutes to get chips and salsa?? 2)  My husband's salad did not taste fresh.  Poor guy...he had his hands full trying to voice his concern to the manager about my meal and my son's and his wasn't right either! 3)  My son's pizza:  they served him the wrong one.  Shouldn't the waitress be checking the order for accuracy before serving it?? 4) My son's soup wasn't served before the pizza.  So he has pizza and soup served at the same time.  Maybe the waitress could have asked if he wanted the soup before or with the pizza.  We thought it would come before.  (ASSUME NOTHING AT THIS PLACE!) 5)  My mashed potato:  offered an option, served the option I didn't pick, then told by the manager that i shouldn't have had the option in the first place.  (JEESH!)   By the way, the table next to us also had terrible service.  We overheard the waitress ask the patrons when they were asking for their check, "Did you ever get the beer you ordered?"  (DOESN'T SHE EVEN KNOW??)    As stated before, I have experienced much better at Richardsons previously.  They should be embarrassed!!!!

5MtC3uc-66Bss0_Yb8wAPA.text: Food is amazing. Staff is not. Been there two times and they got an order wrong on both visits. The wait staff were rigid and not accommodating to questions asked about the menu. They're not rude or terrible; just make you tilt your head and wonder what's up with the people in this place?

jfrm08YaUk9pmC6gb1r7pA.text: I took my Cousin to Richardson's a couple of weeks ago,  I knew he was coming to visit from the East Coast ... I had asked him what his favorite food was,  he said Southwest Mexican ...  I live in Scottsdale and don't travel to dine ... My friend is quite the foodie and on her recommendation I took my cousin to Richardson's ... It was worth the 30+ drive ... We sat at the gorgeous Bar ... Philip was our Bartender/Server,  what a great guy, the food was spot on ... I am Vegan, Philip made it happen with his great recommendations ... At the end of meal,  Philip gave us a tour of the downstairs bar  It is So awesome!!!  My cousin was so impressed  I hope to be back soon   Thank you Philip for making our night complete   Dawn and Rob

Qi-i7oLy9FoA9GFEWwJhzw.text: Brunch today with hubby and best friends--good food, glad I don't have to fly to ABQ just to get adovada,

ihgHTPoW7DIBLXVTm11JWw.text: Food was just okay.  Waiter was rude and arrogant.  Noise level extremely loud on a Tuesday!  Won't go back.

yodaFqwSpJgJ8HFokL4i6w.text: This place doesn't understand how to fix a bad situation.  Our friends got us a $50 gift card for Richardsons/Dicks/Rockerji for our wedding.  Two weeks later we went in for brunch at Richardsons, and were told there was only 18 dollars on it.  The manager said there was nothing they could do, but he'd look into it and get back with us. We heard nothing.  Two days later we called, and another manager said he knew nothing about this but would research it.  We heard nothing.  Again, we called and a third manager said it was the first time he heard of this and would look into it.  Finally someone called back and said they'd make it right - come on in and have dinner on them.   A day later someone calls and says the card was used a week after we got the card at Dick's Hideaway on a Monday (we have kids and haven't gone out on a Monday in years), but they'd still make it right.  We asked them if they had any video footage, because we didn't use the card, and would like to help them get to the bottom of this.  They never responded to this request, but said come in and we will make it right.   We decided to come in and take up their offer, only to be told the owner told the managers not to honor it.   A)it's concerning that they don't care that their gift cards are faulty or someone is stealing from them internally, and B) it's amazing that they decided not to make this right and fight us on this over $32.00.  UPDATE: After involving the BBB and the AG's office, they finally refunded the disputed amount.

qEnY_5ZbE-nIclEVVwqfsA.text: This place has some of the best and spiciest carne adovado! Their signature pasta dish (the first on the menu) Pasta Heidi is delicious as well. If you order the margarita, make sure to get it "skinny", the prickly pear is very good. The outside seating is beautiful.

ghNkDD4QcQ4WW6YtojHFZA.text: This place is awesome. Large menu with alot of variety, strong drinks and an interesting atmosphere. I usually prefer to sit downstairs next to the fireplace and have a few cocktails before checking out the menu. The service is eh, dont expect much on that angle but the food is great and the atmosphere is a close second.

Ppm5W7LbgT83gjhNyLC1tA.text: The food is very good and I liked the atmosphere.  If you go for happy hour be very careful where you sit and then still ask the server.  We had a group of people on Wednesday and sat at a patio table only to find our table did not get happy hour prices.  Had we sat to the right of us at the bar or to the left of us at a different table, we would have saved about 50% on our bill.  Even the manager would not override it.  They said that we sat at a private table, this table was sandwiched between the front entrance gate and the front door of the restaurant, nothing private about it.  The waitress never mentioned it or suggested that we sit at the other table.

PW9PjB_UYKI-JBWT4ukzXA.text: Richardson's came highly recommended by a friend, so we thought we would check it out while in town.  The venue was terrific, it has a great vibe.  The shrimp quesadilla and pork burrito were excellent, while the Santa Fe chicken was marginal.  Contrary to other posts, the service was good.

1md9-fGTj3q-Q5ays4qgqg.text: Great food, decent prices... the pizza here is really good. A very relaxed, quiet, romantic scene to take a date.

gj0WOs9R1QGfEcB5e-PptA.text: Went to dinner tonight at Richardsons. I felt nickled and dimed from the moment I arrived. Forced valet or park a block away. We requested bread with our spicy soup and were brought 2 tortillas that we were charged $2 bucks for. And the food although different wasn't worth $75 dollars for 2 people with no alcohol. I have no problem spending $300 for an amazing dinner but this food and restaurant was not worth the cost. Skip it and go to Abuleos. Just as good or better and a much better value.

zdZtHif28Za7vmiSU6L9hA.text: What can I say? Food is good and my server Susanna was excellent. However, this place is fit for the Dodge Viper crowd. Bahda boom bahda bing!!! Just can't stand the attitude from top to bottom. Who needs the attempt at East coast attitude in Phoenix. Too bad because the concept and food is good but the tude is a major turn off. Who needs the aggravation?

UAOjPe0Ldd57_RIlD0cIQg.text: I have frequented Rokerij for sometime, but this was my first time dining at Richardson's. DEFINITELY make a reservation (which we did) or you will be waiting a LONG time for a table.  The atmosphere is lovely, though a bit cramped. I think it would be nice to sit outside near the fire in the cooler months.  The food was good - not outstanding, but good. The seafood was fresh. Don't plan on dessert unless you like flan, since that is the only dessert on the menu. The wine and cocktails were pretty good as well.  What was awful was the service. Our waitress acted like serving our table was an inconvenience.
