And it wasn't just her - at one point, before we paid our bill and while we were still talking, someone came over to our table, took our wine glasses and our placemats. We all stopped talking and looked at him. It was obvious they wanted us to leave so they could turn the table. I'll stick with Rokerij from now on!

Tw1tOUnVP7-5r8i1Bh6RCw.text: Great food and portions. Parking can be rough, but tolerable. Service is always solid!

AbV_Zb2rbTbzxKEZQpa-yA.text: Food was pretty good, however DO NOT bring your kids to this restaurant.  They would do better to just put a sign on the front door telling you that small children are not welcome (I would have appreciated that much more)  No kids menu, and nothing really on the menu that you can work into a kids meal.  no booster seats, not even a straw for the beverage.  All and all, a very unwelcoming experience.  Might try it again when it's just the two of us.

Yz1s2EiiW9SF1cgD4lMLPA.text: I've been going here for 15 years and never once have I had a meal that was boring or disappointing! Love this place! Yum, yum, yum, yum is really all I can say!

vG8Xqsr2tjoIzwezG-vY3w.text: I think the 3 1/2 stars for this place is right on the mark.  The new Richardson's will always be compared to the old one, and it doesn't quite hit the mark (yet).  Perhaps it was because we were seated before the customary 2 coctail standing wait at the old place, but the new place didn't have the same vibe.   On the plus side, they offer a number of seafood dishes, and know how to properly cook fish.    It was relaxed and the service at the bar was good.  They also have a decent selection of $5 wines for happy hour.  I think once the place is getting more traffic the atmosphere will improve.

skqH7hd-gMswX8rRmXWdGA.text: Breakfast Nirvana.  One of the best places for New Mexican style breakfasts. If you like pork with your eggs this is the place. Carne Adovada Benedict a real treat. Great interior and friendly knowledgable staff.

AcOlXHKboTr-OUkgLifp-Q.text: Great atmosphere and green chile dishes! The best I have found outside of New Mexico and Colorado.

ujEC0w_1ZtxjNZgq1cU0aw.text: Ok I'm updating my review because this place is by far my favorite restaurant in this area. The servers and bartenders are so nice and attentive! I felt like I needed to give them a shout out for their awesome work and for always making mine and my husband's dining experience here amazing hence why we continue coming back. I should try different items but we always end up getting the same thing every time. This place is great for brunch, lunch and dinner. For brunch I always get the enchiladas and eggs. I usually get the beef and cheese enchiladas and it's served w eggs and hash browns. It's HUGE so plan on taking a lot of it home w you... or share it. Also, you can choose from the dinner menu for brunch if you want... And my go to for dinner is the New Mexico Enchiladas (yes I luv enchiladas!!). I usually pick 2 beef and 1 shrimp or 1 chicken. The shredded beef inside the enchiladas are the best! And it comes w rice n beans but I opt out the beans for extra rice. And I always get the red and green sauce combo!! How can I choose btwn the 2?? My husband always gets the garlic shrimp pasta minus the avocado (he has an allergy to avocado! I kno so sad!!). This comes w a tri-colored rotelle pasta in a garlic cream sauce w jumbo shrimp which I always steal a couple from him! It's absolutely delicious!! Overall, I highly recommend this place!! Oh and if you want to watch sports, sit in the outdoor patio in front of the bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic shrimp pasta!! Heaven!
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New Mexico enchiladas. 2 beef 1 chicken. No beans w extra rice! Yum!

oXx5c_N3JttJkqcphvGjwQ.text: Honestly would give 0 stars due to the customer service I received. Food is amazing and this was one of my FAVORITE places in the valley BUT I Dined there with a larger group (8) and I had received a gift, well it was hectic when leaving and I left it behind on accident. Called as soon as I noticed which was about 20 min later. They had told me they had it, i said great I'll pick it up tomorrow. Went the next day and was told they didn't have it. My fiance called and they pretty much laughed at him and said what do you want me to do check the cameras over a 50$ water bottle? It was just a hydro flask yes but I'm in the industry and the customer service and response we reviewed about it was appalling. Not even mad about losing the gift more mad about the response we received.

3G55nvTCKccvFLLuJq9nmg.text: This really should be a 5 star review, but I can no longer take clients to a restaurant where the wait staff looks down their nose at you. I felt the whole time like I had done or was doing something wrong.   The food was amazing and I'm willing to pay their $15 a plate charges, but this was the first time in a very long time I've left less than a 20% tip. If I were not with a client I would have handed it to the back of the house staff.   When the waitress (outdoors) barley keeps from rolling her eyes at you (because I was stupid enough to think I was allowed to box my own leftovers) something needs to change. Alert! you are in the hospitality industry. Please start acting hospitable. REMEMBER it is not what you say it is not what you do, it is how you make your customers feel.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Adovada Benedict

ipD4PRCk_HAlRVERYOl7hA.text: My wife and I went here for dinner while staying at the Four Seasons. Food was delicious and our waiter was such a nice guy. Very helpful in guiding us through the menu and making sure we tried the top Dishes. The tostadas, quesadilla, enchiladas, and pork abodabo were all awesome. Our eyes were bigger than our stomachs - but we got plenty to take home for leftovers.

a-9t13WopWQVq7QW2P_BLw.text: A New Mexican restaurant in AZ? This made me think of my best friend who lives in NM. =)  I came here with a friend last night for dinner since she's been dying to come here. I think everything deserves a four star. I ordered the Pasta Hedi which was amazingly delicious! It's a pasta that comes with chicken on top of a tortilla. The sauce was sooooo yummy. I'm really into pasta so I really loved it. It also comes with a house salad which I thought was really good and very good size portion. I had to split it with my friend. We washed everything down with margaritas. I ordered the Prickly Pear margarita which definitely satisfied me after a long day..You have to try it!   The service was also very good. Our server always came back to make sure everything was to our liking. I loved the ambiance of the restaurant as well. It's a great date spot.  The only reason it doesn't get a four star from me is because it's a bit pricey. Between the both of us with our entrees and drinks the bill came out to about $60. That and it's pretty far from me. I wish there was one on my side of town. But you get what you pay for!   I'll definitely be coming back for that pasta and margarita again! Plus their brunch menu also looks beyond yummy and something that I'd like to try out. =)

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prickly Pear and Pomegrante margaritas
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House salad
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta Heidi

cRNetJDHLRV-PmLaSEbTwg.text: So went to have a nice meal with my family. Grew up in Phoenix and came in from LA. Arrived at 5:50. Seated and waited. And waited. Had to flag down my waiter and said we've been here for 10 minutes. He said he was helping other tables and now he is here. He then told me we couldn't order the hamburger in the happy hour menu because it ended at its barely after 6. I left. Will never go back.

_GUhNFIFGUnIK9GlYv6Wxw.text: What an amazing dinner! Richardson's patio is beautiful. Protected from the elements, intimate and yet open and easy dining were tucked into quiet alcoves and booths. We ate at the bar serviced by an exceptional bartender.  The Hendrick's gin and tonic was cold and perfectly poured and the buttery Chardonnay by Landmark was an excellent suggestion. My husband had the Tortilla crusted halibut, and I selected the Pine nut crusted sea bass. The fish was a generous cut that was served at the perfect temperature - the sea bass was flaky and soft while the halibut was tender and firm. The sides were equally delicious with the right touch of Southwestern heat.   Perfect ambiance. Service was excellent and on point. The food innovative and delicious - a 5 star evening!

mm94A36eycpxZM9hltV-aw.text: Wow...do I ever love this place!  We stopped in Saturday for happy hour and dinner and it reminded us how much we missed this place.  Love that they offer $6 glasses of wine for happy hour at the tables as well as the bar - I enjoyed a lovely Silverado Sauvignon Blanc.  We shared the spinach queso, green chile pork tamale, chicken, beef, shrimp and sausage skewers over rice and pinto beans and the shrimp and scallop pasta with a side salad.  We definitely overdid it, but couldn't decide what NOT to have...tough problem, right?  After dinner we went to the cellar bar at the Rokerij...perfect way to end an evening on a hot summer day!

TpBSU_f5KZM9fiJtq8A11Q.text: I have been going to Richardson's for so many years. I can not believe that I have never reviewed this amazing restaurant! It's like an icon to the valley of the sun! Richardson's brings New Mexico to Arizona. Here you can find traditional New Mexican cuisine but also specialities like fish or great steaks with the spice that gives it southwestern flare and taste. I have never had a meal here that wasn't amazing and the service is always, ALWAYS consistent. I like to arrive early, put my name on the 'list' to wait for a table at Richardson's and have a drink 'down below' in the 'dungeon' of Rokerij.. the 'speak easy' feel of going underneath the main restaurant is always mysterious and fun to me. I love all of the copper top on the bars.. I kind of want that on my bar at home! Maybe I am just a little weird?! Okay. I get that! Down at Rokerij, you can pretty much find the same drinks and wines that you find at Richardson's. They have several sparkling wines and champagnes for me too! If its Fall or Spring, the patio of Richardson's is a great place to hang out and there is a fireplace that gives off a great ambient feeling. Drink specials and small plates on happy hour are a really great find! There are great tequilas, mezcals and that leads to what? Great margaritas! Last weekend, I was here with my daughter, who dub's this her 'very favorite restaurant' for southwestern food, when she is home from school on the east coast. This is her first stop and her last stop before heading back to school, always! The bar always makes her a refreshing Prickly Pear Lemonade that she requests when she is here. It's likely not special to her, but she thinks it is, and thats what matters. We always start with the Guacamole, housemade, of course and served with a trio of salsa and duo colored tortilla chips. We always love the New Mexico Con Queso too.. just the right amount of spice and chorizo and served in a hot skillet. This past weekend, I had the Surf and Turf; a nice sized filet mignon, two nice sized grilled prawns atop that, AND, (as if that is not enough!), Chorizo Enchiladas.. they are served open faced. The housemade beans come on the side. This is a huge meal, as most of the entrees here are! This plate is served on the classic pewter Rokerij/Richardson's plate that comes out HOT and will burn you if you don't mind it! I've had most of the entrees here, and again, I have NEVER been disappointed. My daughter had the New Mexico Enchiladas: three generous enchiladas of your choosing, ( she chose the green chile pork; grilled shrimp and the cheese), with green or red sauce and the green is usually the 'milder' of the two. We were so full we didn't want dessert, but the awesome waiter brought us flan anyway to share.. its almost like a caramel type cheesecake thats super creamy! We have had brunch here and again, nothing is even in the 'mediocre' category.. it falls into the 'amazing and FILLING' category! I highly recommend the Enchiladas and Eggs or the Huevos Rancheros and Eggs.. they will do the eggs any style; poached is my personal preference and they don't bat an eye! Oh! Weekend Brunch Mimosas! I like a Mimosa that is mainly Champagne and little OJ , #bckimberly, I swear I was given almost an entire bottle of champs and a small glass of OJ to add as I wished! The Bloody Mary is also worth the hair of your dog.. or your chinny, chin, chin left over from the night before. The staff here is on point.. Maybe one of the best in all of the valley.. attentive and not rushy. They will talk to you; leave the check when you need it to be left; OR let you linger and hang out and enjoy drinks or those mimosas! The history of this restaurant and all its endured makes it a place we continue to come back to over and over.. and now its the same for our daughter who talks about it while at school in DC. Tip: Richardson's does not take reservations unless there are more than 3 in your dinner party and the weekends and some, MANY week nights get busy! Parking is valet; bring cash to pay and tip! :-) Go to Richardson's hungry and ready for New Mexico spice.. this isn't your 'typical' Mexican food!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A dessert trio ... creme brûlée ; chocolate lava cake ; and a cheesecake ... truly split this !
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The specials board ..

UP21JO6ZU4WGgsidNj5Icg.text: This was always our go to for brunch, lunch or dinner. But now we live in California, so don't get to go as often as we'd like.  We'd always choose to sit outside, being Phoenix the weather is always great and to be honest I think it's just far to dark inside.  My favorite is the double Pork Chop Chorizo. It's massive and will satisfy any hunger. Although I must admit last week while there half of the meat was far too undercooked. Asked for it medium but it was raw and I like my meat on the rarer side. I would've said something but I was completely full with what I'd eaten. That's the only time I wasn't 100% happy with my meal there.  If they have it, which sometimes they don't for some reason get the Mango Habenero sauce it's wonderful. Spicy but just so tasteful.  Nice atmosphere, a bit on the pricer side but I'll keep going back and I'm fussy about where I eat. Always a full house so you know they're doing something right.

KIBRWTKKdh7QPjPg_44qdg.text: I've been to Richardson's a few times, and have yet to leave without having a great meal. It is definitely a Phoenix staple, and a great example that you don't have to sacrifice quality for quantity. The atmosphere is top notch, and the service is hard to beat.   Richardson's is definitely aware of their value, so don't be surprised with a bill a bit pricier than your neighborhood go-to. Don't fret it, as this will probably be your future pick for date night for every date night to come.  Personal favorite: Chicken New Mexico Enchiladas with red sauce. Chips and the habanero verde salsa to start.

3969VyxcdUs9EK1ChhQY_A.text: Richardson's along with its sister restaurants are staples in the neighborhood. Always great food with large portions. The service is always good. The servers seem to stay a long time so you see a lot of familiar faces which is nice. Another perk is they open early even during the week. As a early riser it's really nice to have a breakfast option other than IHOP.

cXeT6QJ6i10E0O5HHmIOaQ.text: Decided to take my wife to Richardsons  after I went there with friends two weeks ago. Didn`t disappoint. Food and service were excellent again. This is becoming one of my favorite places. I can see why it`s been around for 30 years it`s great.

uzByO8gDwnN_HsC5FaRDCA.text: I've been going here for 9 years solid. The most heartbreaking thing is seeimg how the management, staff, and cooks have been turned over so much lately. The service quality is nothing like it usedd to be. And the food quality is declining each time I return. The guys at the Hideaway are the only people keeping this place alive in my opinion. Damn, I hope the day never comes when I say this place sucks!

epGgf2HF9ndpYGEL1bfX4Q.text: We had our best meal during our recent Scottsdale visit at Richardson's. My wife had the fish trio and I had the New Mexican surf and turf. So much of such amazing food.

2huPQCSshG6rWF6iX2L0aA.text: Great service and fantastic food. I had the Carne Adovada and it was phenomenal. Great experience!

8RZ2baVeTgPFQ9bbl32zGw.text: Worst excuse for a newMexican restaurant in Phoenix Grizzly meat used during happy hour, very cheap way to service guests, expensive and can do much better going to Scottsdale's frank and Lupe.

GbYDc2atF--95ww0ij7rEA.text: My favorite place in the neighborhood!  Be chill when you come here.  You can get some food quick but the personality and character of this place is found by taking your time.  The food is amazing and cooked with heart over an open flame.  Get your sauces Christmas.  Always the Duck relleno.  The seabass never disappoints.  Stafg: Rick, Lauren, Robert, Will always be great for you.  Enjoy our neighborhood gem.  To all the no talent asshats posting poor reviews about our local favorite, go to taco $mell.   Its more in line with your writing skills and taste.

f1FzXKGr6mmGYQD-ilXboA.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants to visit when I'm craving some good and fresh tasting New Mexican specialties. The flavors are out of this world and it will make your mouth dance with joy.  Been to their other restaurants many times and always enjoy coming back. First got to experience this kind of treat at their older restaurant that mysteriously caught on fire. This place is a favorite of my boss and he usually pays. Nice!  Love the Chimayo Chicken and on other visits order one of the Fish Specials written on the board. The appetizers are delicious and you can easily get filled up on them quickly. Really enjoyed the Green Chili French Onion Soup on my last visit. It had the perfect amount of heat for me and made me break a sweat.  Service can be somewhat mediocre at times. Make sure to also bring a flashlight or have your smart phone app ready to go. It is ridiculously dark in there and can create a bit of a problem. You can always choose to eat outside at the bar or at one of the smaller tables.  This is not a cheap and inexpensive dining experience. Then again it is not super duper crazy expensive. They do have valet parking at certain times so don't be surprised.  Give them a shout out and get ready for some yummy flavors. You won't be disappointed. TOUCHDOWN IN MY MOUTH!  4.5 STARS

Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwest Jalapeno Sausages.
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Chili French Onion Soup.

Ex_4lCIgWRNy8UyxoEmP3Q.text: The location was nice...I had a hard time finding something I would like. And after I got home I got sick-food poisoning.

ZG6pvxZpuAbPokb1az_hpg.text: A charming, unexpected spot! You'll need reservations, on weekends especially.  An older supperclub feel in a small, warm environment. Booth/look feel reminds me of adobe-style. Love the outdoor space (when the flies aren't rampant - which they were on our first visit so we opted to sit inside).  Service was excellent on both visits. Happy hour was a great surprise on the weekends! Entree portions are plentiful - come with a salad, starch and another veggie (WOW!). A great value for the price. - Bacon wrapped shrimp appetizer was great - Salmon bites were good - Chorizo Porkchop was tasty with a nice medley of flavor combinations, but a little overcooked for my liking (I prefer medium since med. rare isn't an option. Definitely enough to split if ordering appetizers first. - Charred NY Steak topped with Crab and Hollandaise was delicious (Excellent the first time we ordered since it has a really deep, crusty char yet medium rare interior, the second visit we both ordered this and it was a tad overcooked and lacked the char so I was a little disappointed). - The GCP is a must try - a unique spin on the boring potato (it's worth the carbs!) - LOVE the veggie choices and ACORN SQUASH served with brown sugar and butter. YES PLEASE! Like mom used to make.  We enjoy this place and will be back again to try the Rokerij.

OMLj_pMph_sKMsPUj5xORQ.text: This place seems like a classic Arizona restaurant. It took me a pretty long time to try it and I'm surprised because we have been to the Rokerij next door more than a handful of times.   The margaritas were pretty delicious. The food was pretty darn good. We started with the chorizo queso, which I enjoyed a lot because it was more of a spinach and artichoke dip than a typical queso. The calamari was good but not memorable.   Main entrees that we ordered: NY strip steak with crab, garlic shrimp pasta, relleno platter and the pinenut crusted seabass. The NY strip with crab was probably the best - cooked perfectly and so flavorful. 2 of the 4 meals came with a side and the bartender recommended brussel sprouts. I normally like brussel sprouts so I tried it off my husband's plate. I thought they were kinda boring and my husband didn't enjoy them or our friend. The house salads were actually pretty good and plenty.   Next best - the seabass. This dish was also so flavorful and something I would probably order the next time if it's available. My pasta seemed bland compared the 3 other dishes. Honestly, it didn't even taste like there was much garlic in it - more like a light Alfredo pasta sauce. The jumbo shrimp were perfectly sized.  I couldn't give it 5 stars even though we enjoyed the food and drinks. Our service was pretty slow and we caught ourselves trying to make eye contact to get service at times. Sure it was a Saturday night, but it was not busy when we got there. We decided to grab drinks elsewhere after eating because it felt like it would have taken too long staying there. Overall a good first experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. NY strip steak with crab
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic shrimp pasta

tlkiPCZn95hpNcFieunzOg.text: I absolutely love Richardson's! In fact, I love all of their restaurants, but I seem to frequent Richardson's the most.   Bartender Reyna is an absolute delight. So friendly!    Richardson's is great for every meal! My favorite is probably brunch and late night though.   They have a killer happy hour at various times of the day.   Bacon wrapped jalapenos is a must!!  Enjoy!

YwSxPOBSpeWj4FAoxZPMEQ.text: I would give negative ratings if I could but the website reads that they are open until midnight on a Friday night and over a 5 minute period, standing in the lobby, at 10:13pm, 6 employees looked at us and not one employee acknowledged us.  Two of the six passed us by and said nothing.  I have no idea what your food tastes like but as a first time visitor, was looking forward to trying it.  Shame on you for ignoring me and now I am headed to Carlos O'Brien's to see if they give me the same type of garbage service I just received from you.  And I did share this with two soon to be visitors in the parking lot as we walked out. PS...it's 10:25 and I am sitting at Carlo's O Brien's and have a drink in my hand with Chips and Salsa.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GftG1SYPn60urmD-g_DGAw.text: Lunch team meeting at Richardson's Cuisine of New Mexico in North Phoenix. First time at this location. Place is next door to another Richardson's Restaurant called Rokerij. Six in our party. We opted for the patio alcove. Nice setting, dog friendly, easy parking in the back. Food was spectacular! Service was slow as warned by our friendly server. Not sure of the reason but servers were over extended. We opted for no appetizers due to slow service and decided to order. Loaned the server a pen so they could write the orders. The entrees  were served. One order was a redo as a burger was ordered with no veggies but it came with mushrooms.  I had the Chimayo Chicken. It was a tasty chicken breast stuffed with spinich sun dried tomato, poblano chili and assiago cheese served with an onion sauce. Dish had good heat. If you don't like spicy food don't order this dish.  Lunch included  brussel sprouts and a stuffed yam. Good thing apps were not ordered. Large portions, moderate prices but excellent food.  Some of us ordered coffee. No refill followup. Love the food and atmosphere here. Worth another trip. Very large menu so will be back and hope for better service or just plan for a very long lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chimayo Chicken

-naGLnz9-LIMmkbv_eJcLg.text: I do not give 5 stars often, however Muy Bueno!!! This is the first place we found that has a True Southwest vibe. The menu selections are excellent for dinner and brunch that are super reasonably priced.  The outdoor patio is also great and has an outdoor bar area. I ordered the Carne Adovada. It was excellent the best CA I have had in the AZ. Anything you order on the menu you will be taking some home. The portions are large! Did I mention the $6 Bloodys and Mimosas?? What a deal. This will be a regular stop for us!!

EYRGpRvcYDRY4naQGCR6Tg.text: Best queso I've ever had!! We came here for happy hour on a Tuesday after hiking Camelback for some drinks and apps. Seriously, the queso was amazing. The margs and calamari weren't really anything to write home about, but go for the queso.   Nice atmosphere and staff. They have an cool outdoor seating area in between the two restaurants.

sKxnMximf0C0bnUwpcf5HA.text: Service was awesome for lunch and so was the food. My dad ordered the Sandia chicken and I ordered the bacon wrapped stuffed jalapenos. My favorite thing on the menu is the Pasta Heidi. I normally order that when I come here. It is so amazing! The bacon wrapped shrimp are also amazing.

4_FFALkYQZfGrShg8l2ObQ.text: This is a great place to visit for a change of pace. The food is very good and the menu is different.  The service is also very good. Everyone was friendly and attentive.  But, it is crowded and noisy. Great if you are in a party mood.  Good place.

jJMTTaHtNSNF-hft6N5AAg.text: Food was great as usual. Service was phenomenal. The establishment was neat, clean and very accommodating. We love the entire atmosphere, can be pricey when you get apps, mucho drinks and dessert. Despite all that we love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Drink list at Cellar Bar

a9QrW7_udXKo_doheM-2tw.text: Richardson's is one of those classic Phoenix restaurants that every Phoenician must try. Most of my friends absolutely love this place hence why I eat here all the time. However, as a foodie, Richardson's isn't one of the restaurants that I would personally recommend. Maybe I'm just not a fan of the cuisine itself? Regardless, I always have a great time dining here.   The wonderful thing about their menu is there's definitely something for everybody - from mexican dishes to pastas and burgers. My go-to is their bacon wrapped jalapenos. You can't go wrong with the carne adovada. That slow roasted pork is tender and tasty. Their happy hour is great - their $6 bloody marys are addicting and their famous onion rings are a crowd pleaser.    I may not be the biggest fan of this place, and somehow I feel like i'm the only one who isn't!

GRXF4YjpVi5MiP3ks3HBfg.text: Awesome place!!! Service was excellent... a high five to Dyllan! Great recommendations on the menu!! Meatloaf ..WOW

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

47llylRb7OvPBCp5gTMAyw.text: I love the ambiance of this restaurant. It's called hideaway for a reason, with a nondescript entrance that leads to a darkened bar. The staff is friendly and helpful. Most seating is bar type seating but they have a room in their mezzanine and the room just off the bar area. Most meals come with a choice of red or green Chile sauce. I personally prefer the green as it tastes more fresh and vibrant, but it's definitely the spicier of the two options. The red chile sauce has a more smoky type flavor, which is still very good, but not my personal preference. They have a bunch of different specials and a nice happy hour menu. They also make strong drinks! My Cadillac margarita was awesome!!!! It's actually where my husband and I had our first date- I worked night shift at the hospital so we met up after work for brunch. There brunch menu is also awesome, and they serve brunch until 4pm, which is especially nice because I enjoy sleeping in until at least 11am and taking my time before leave the house on my rare weekend off!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Duck Relleno on the happy hour menu.
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jalepeno Eggs Benedict and Paloma

0O6YQTvy2JvTzEFMzYFtfQ.text: Was very surprised to find this hidden gem in an older neighborhood. The food was delicious with huge portions and quite a variety. They are the same owner as Rokerij next door and can't wait to try that one next.

c9djtt8nB1n5Wa_08UuQFQ.text: Usually very good over all. But today.... a Thursday.... slow day....  valet service for lunch? Really?  Came as a surprise as 10:30 am is always slow.  Said can I park it myself? No.... you can park on the street. Really..... no one is here? I relent and give up my keys. In the restaurant for 2 hours. Had to go get my own wine because no one even saw me come in. ( because it was empty) service was okay. Food fantastic.  I came out to get my valeted car. Tipped the guy and got it myself.... why? Uh... because no one was even parked.  Started my car. Dead battery. Valet left my lights on in the car. Swell.  Kid said I'll start it for you with jumper cables.  Sweet.... but said he'd gave to google how to do it.  No thanks. AAA it is.  But honestly..... it's 2 pm in the afternoon.  No one here.... and a valet? That's crap.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pQbaMWMlc5GcIIxmycOCUw.text: We recently attended a family birthday dinner here, and here's why Richardson's fell short for me.   While our waitress was very friendly and polite, because we were situated in the back, private room I thought service was extremely slow. It took a very long time to get drinks, service, and the check.   The drinks were fine, nothing special. I had a Moscow mule and a Paloma. The Moscow mule was like any other from any other restaurant, the Paloma was tasteless and I ended up only drinking half of it.   The appetizers were presented beautifully, however I thought they were odd and missed the mark. We shared the roasted garlic, sausage and beans and the bacon wrapped jalapenos. The jalapenos were the best dish of the evening, I thought the sausage and bean combination was odd, and the garlic was interesting - but the roasted veggies were large and an odd shape to manipulate to put on a piece of bread.   The house salad was good, fresh, crisp - dressed just right!   Here's where I thought everything went downhill...my steak!! I ordered the 8 oz tenderloin covered in king crab and smothered in jalapeno hollandaise sauce with broccolini and mashed potatoes. The tenderloin was so aggressively chared on the outside I took 3 bites of it and had to stop. The sauce was delicious and the crab was nice, but there was a large piece of shell in the lump on my plate. The mashed potatoes had a fluffy texture but no taste, but the broccolini was perfectly cooked. I was so disappointed with the meal as was my husband!   We shared the creme brulee and it was fine nothing special.   And that's how I felt about the meal, nothing special. It was a VERY expensive night for a family of 9 and my expectations were not met. Due to that I probably will not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7G923RxUcmjVZ9LS7CPLPA.text: The carne adovada is so delicious that it's difficult to venture past it to explore the menu.  That said, it's not always the magical ambrosia that it used to be, sort of hit or miss lately.  The chips and salsa are also excellent.  Only complaint is that the service isn't always super attentive and friendly.

UXufmT0CLxvsrmZsMxu-og.text: The food and service was AMAZING!! It is a small place so reservations are recommended. They will do reservations of 4+. After we got here the wait time turned to two hours. And it is soooo worth it. The servings are huge and the food is authentic. I'm really picky about my Mexican food. Dillan was our server and he was amazing. All of the staff seemed very happy and like they enjoy their job. Highly recommended and I will definitely be back. Don't let the prices scare you because the servings definitely make it worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Adovada and eggs

Ts3Httze594_Y6dVXT2iQA.text: Busy Friday night. Found a couple seats at the bar which was awesome since it was pretty busy and we didn't have reservations. Ordered a couple drinks after waiting for anyone to serve us, just in time too we were feeling a little left out. Ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp and it was delivered to us pretty burned, had to send them back.  Looked at other Yelp photos of this same dish and didn't even compare - charred black. Ordered the ribs, they were very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burned shrimp

wx_VffgqkCcDNPRihLjQsA.text: Classic southwestern traditional Mexican. Real rice and beans, adobo, mole and carne avado. I went for the Carne avado with some chips and guacamole.   The guacamole was fantastic!    All Very authentic and prepared with care.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DtkrfAKIYQT3QbwHMT_V0w.text: We have been going to Richardson's for years, even before the fire. We were looking forward to the reopening. Have been there several times since but last night's experience was horrible. Service was poor, wouldn't re-cork wine we bought, food marginal, seemed to be understaffed. Manager said they went through a "major house cleaning a month ago and new staff are not all trained."  So we wasted $80 for 2 people to train their staff?  Manager offered apology and suggested we come back in a couple of months.  FAT CHANCE!!

NQkqQkzB29QN67b-_vHN1w.text: My family and I have been patrons of Richardson's & the Rokerij for over 10 years. The service has always been so so, with condescending waiters, etc. but the food usually made up for the bad service. I mean we even returned several times after my sister found a rubber band in her pasta Heidi and still had to pay for the dish. However, our past few experiences have been sub-par. Service is worse than ever and the food does not make up for it anymore. It is either too spicy or severely overcooked and dry. It will be a while before we return!!

y4JRZFmp-oO5pZDPzxQ3JA.text: Happy Hour is AMAZING there - the calimari and roast beef sliders the best of the bunch.  I also enjoyed the fish, branzino, I think it was.  The siracha chicken sticks were not fully cooked, which was a bummer, because the sauce was good.  I could pass on the mashed potatoes, and side salad.  Also, it's valet parking only - so bring extra for the valet drivers.  I probably wouldn't go here for dinner, but would be there in a second for Happy Hour.  :)

H41Vhvpby2BNtjzKI01kMQ.text: Always awesome at Richardsons. One of my favorites. Love the stroganoff special. The Moscow Mules aren't bad either.

IbbKZwmtal8KJh3TYfBQ0w.text: Happy hour is amazing the chicken salad and flatbread top notch

9GG_TLclPDLDv3EikEHegg.text: We stumbled across thid place looking for a mexican place.... this is New Mexican! Carne adovada is as good as everyone is bragging about. Just the right amount of spicy and full of flavor. The pasta dish with shrimp was also a hit. Nice decor and ambiance. Very pleased with the service as well!

g274F6zZCOhCsLWb6s0E1w.text: This place is the go to place for me and my husband.  We go here for anniversaries.  We take out of towners here.  This is one of my favorite restaurants!!  I love this type of food.  I am from NM and the green chile's are right on!  The food here is down right amazing.

vWa9DVm4HSJO9RiRJBPG1g.text: Richardsons is one of my favorite places to eat! They serve New Mexican style food with a luxury twist which is exactly what I was searching for for the last 10 years in Phoenix. It is a bit pricy but in my opinion worth the cost! You have to get the New Mexico enchiladas plate! You will thank me!

ByqTCGbprwFP9VrfImgx0Q.text: Came here with 3 friends to celebrate a special occasion after many high recommendations from friends and family.  We were all terribly disappointed in the customer service and it ruined our experience completely.  First of all, the hostess was phenomenal and very helpful in assisting us.  We were seated in the middle patio after a short wait, and that's where the disappointment started.  We saw our waiter a total of 5 times, which involved waiting over a half hour to order food and then another half hour at the end to finally get our bill.  Our drinks were empty for 75% of our time there and we were never even offered the chance to order another.  Also, there was no apology when I commented on his long disappearances.  The whole thing would have been a little more understandable had the place been packed, but it was later in the evening and the restaurant was by no means full. We expected far better service at a restaurant with this reputation!

Rd6j50-wYCf8RL78p7-FDw.text: Nice to see that some things never change.  A friend and I decided to try Richardson's last night after a late meeting since they are open late. We started at Sierra Bonita Grille but they close at 9pm on Monday nights and actually referred us to Richardson's.  So we arrived at Richardson's at 9:30pm. Where the hell is the door into the place?!? There were 4 people at the bar. No sign whether we seat ourselves. Finally we got the bartender's attention and he told us to sit anywhere and that yes, the kitchen was open.  We sat in a booth. A busboy brought us water. And then we waited....and waited...and waited...and joked about them being soooo busy that no one could help us. Finally, a tall, jet-black haired waitress with a nose piercing that looked like a giant booger hanging in her nostril came to the table. She was a bitch with an attitude and acted extremely annoyed to have to wait on us or answer a single simple question about the appetizer. Again...a bitch. We almost walked at that point.  We ordered a draft beer, a glass of reisling, and their whole garlic appetizer that comes with toast points. And then we waited....waited....waited. We never saw the waitress again and the bartender stepped in and waited on us the rest of the night. The food and drinks arrived. All were good. Loved the appetizer.  The bill then came. $32 for a glass of cheap wine, a draft beer and an appetizer of a head of roasted garlic, some melted cheese and toast points. Good God. And, let me mention that the air was heavy HEAVY with smoke from the kitchen. We both walked out smelling so strongly of smoke that I showered when I got home to get the smell out of my hair.  So....congratulations Richardsons! Even with the change in location you have obviously worked hard to cement your reputation of having the biggest assholes for wait staff. That must take some doing and I applaud your consistency over the years.   We will never, ever step foot into Richardson's again. There are far too many better restaurants in Phoenix who actually give a shit that you are there. Can't wait to tell everyone I know, and I'm in public relations, to stay the hell away from this place.

1YJkEU3Oui1HhpcrPc7AYg.text: First visit and we really enjoyed our experience.   Cheese enchiladas were delicious- spicy and very flavorful.  Waiter was helpful and suggested which sauces the vegetarians would not want to order- he was knowledgeable about the menu and made us feel appreciated.  Cons: the entire lot is valet, and you don't have a choice to opt out, unless you park across the street in someone else's lot.  Also a bit too pricey to visit often, but a nice treat.

sbBxSRnm0ukMUFjzv4QaNw.text: This place always looks packed at night time, and someone in my party used to love the restaurant's food. Decided to go for a late lunch, & received mediocre service in an obviously slow time for the servers- we were one of maybe three parties in the whole restaurant. Our food came out after what seemed like a long wait for the amount of business they had at the time, & appeared to have been sitting under a hot lamp for longer than it should have.. The beans & rice were bone dry & crispy. The enchilada sauce was half dried up, with it's accompanying enchiladas stuck to the plate. Overall, the food was terrible, especially for the price! I've had really great tex mex before, and Richardson's flopped in comparison. And with barely there service, I would not recommend this restaurant for tex mex. You can definitely do MUCH better.

9jo7L_BYZpZQaNAH4Wxjyw.text: I did not think this place was all that.  The food wasn't bad by any means but I've had better in Santa Fe.  I think the fact that our waitress was distracted and oblivious for most of the meal really tainted my experience.  We were seated in the front patio and she rarely came by to check on us.  Since we were starving we ate our queso appetizer without any silverware or napkins, and we ended up never getting any till after our entrees arrived.  I had to hail down a waitress from a neighboring table to get some for us and she was visibly annoyed.  How else were we exactly supposed to eat?!  I hated my drink, having ordered the prickly pear margarita after being assured that it wasn't sweet, but it was.  Of course the waitress never came by to check on us, so I couldn't trade it in for something else, but a friend graciously switched with me.  My enchiladas were nice and the portion generous, but it was on the spicy side so beware.  The restaurant seemed charming enough and the food was good enough to save this from being a two star rating.

x3n7WLLTYLvHbIO3n7OGlg.text: Love the reverse happy hour...5 stars there  Yet, my first time for dinner trying to show a little bit of phoenix to an out of town guest was a disappointment. We walked in and no one greeted us, then we waiting 10 minutes and some seconds for a server. This is after 2 people came to the table to say our server would be with us soon. Drinks, chips and dip, even water would have been nice as we waited. THEN....we waited again after we got drinks to order our dinner.  But WOW, the food was great. Yes I'd go back. The food rocked!

zwQly0I_32A2oO2-C9eJYA.text: This was our first visit with some friends who were regulars.  Our friends go ocean fishing at least once a year so when they say that this is a good place to get fresh fish we listen!!  Our group had the halibut ($26) which was outstanding.  It had a pico de gallo salsa that I had on the side in case it was too spicy.  It had a mashed potato side served in a roasted whole green Anaheim pepper.  Excellent!!  The small salads with salmon, either 4 oz or 8 oz depending on the salad size was excellent.  The seafood trilogy was excellent as well.  They have large billboards with the specials of the day.  Our server was attentive without being intrusive.  It appears to be a "mom and pop" place which is our favorite.  They have a good selection of wines that are a little pricey but wine really does enhance the meal.  Our total tab was $125 for four of us with full entree's and a total of 5 wines ordered.

BAfgj34T48JYFoJAdMZOHA.text: One of our favorite places!!!  Love the cozy atmosphere & how they replicated the old place to a T!  We love to take friends there because we know with out a doubt they will Love it!  There is something for everybody, seafood to mexican, to pizza(which is wonderful)  they have a wonderful happy hour if you are lucky enough to get a seat around the bar :)  And don't miss the chance to have the roasted garlic platter, it is to die for!  (just make sure everyone with you eats it too ;)  Easy to make a reservation on yelp so what are you waiting for?  Go NOW!

kk3GM6GW_AurX3C1lx60_A.text: We returned here to celebrate my father in laws birthday. Service was great, we were there about 3 pm. Food was excellent. Carne Adovada was superb. Others had the Halibut and meatloaf and that was great also. We had a party of 8 and had a booth, room was adequate. Not a place for large parties unless you sit outside in the misters...

lQuO-3zn_NiEpJxwRb_S1w.text: OMG great service, great lighting/atmosphere, and great food. I can't wait for it to cool off so we can also hang out on the gorgeous patio between Richardson's and their subsidiary restaurant Rokerij.

P3xklsTV2jBRYcLlWNv8iw.text: I just want to preface this by saying I LOVE to go out to eat.  And I am not picky and NOT hard to please.  But last night's dinner was one of the top 3 worst dinning experiences of my life.  I don't think the night could of possibly gone worse.  We walked in and were completely ignored.  Servers acted like we were in the way (there was no where to go - didnt they just remodel?  Couldnt they fix that?). And the restaurant was practically empty.  Finally someone came up to us and asked to help us.  I told them we had a reservation and they started to walk us to a table.  The aisle is only one person wide and he walked us to a table full of people.  He said "oops, that was wrong, I guess we are going over there..." so we all had to turn around and shimmy down the aisle to the OTHER side of the restaurant.  We were sat in a booth for a few moments when we were approached by an employee who told us we couldnt sit there and the person who sat us "was just a busser."  Um, WTF?  So we are moved to a 1/2 booth/table.  Finally sat, a server immediately approaches us and asked if we would like something to drink or an appetizer.  Um, just sat down, super annoyed, can i get a minute to recover please?    And this server then proceeded to suck my will to live the rest of the night.  More on that later, though.  It is ridiculously dark in the restaurant.  Like, cannot see jack dark.  And the pillows in the booths kind of gross me out...like sleeping in a stranger's bed with dirty sheets.  And bottom line, the food isnt good enough to put up with price and the hassle of valet parking.  My mother in laws steak was well done when she ordered it medium.  My "stuffed" pork chop didnt appear to have anything in it.  But again, it was so dark I could of been eating a bear for all I know.  Back to the server.  She would take our order, not write it down and come back FIVE MINUTES LATER and double check with us what we ordered.  And her guess was wrong!  She did it with the drink order AND the food order.  So I guess it makes sense the steak was incorrectly cooked...  End of drinner, we just want to get the hell out...server takes the bill and credit card, brings it back with no receipt to sign.  And of course never comes back.  We had to hunt someone down and he brought us back the recipt to sign.  Sigh.  At the very end of the night, we then get stuck waiting in a line for the valet.  Some lady butted in front at the line.  Unfortunately for her, she got the brunt of my frustrations.  Poor gal was probably just as scarred by her shitty dinning experience.

7UllnmWBAXI7BFk9IT1TSA.text: I'm a long time fan of Richardson's and after finally visiting the new location I am head over heels again! I love that the new place looks just like the old place inside, except a bit bigger it seems. I love the food and the specials are amazing. I recently tried a green chile tilapia that was incredible! I have family in town soon and already know we are going to Richardson's for a meal.

RsLURgbMbI8bCh1SRvdG2Q.text: This place is awesome! The atmosphere is nice and the new Mexican food is amazing. I'm a big fan of the tenderloin Benedict. Nom.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta heidi
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmm tenderloin Benedict

7uJYelgFTKFNXLaMUJ5WDA.text: Incredible ambience and amazing food.  Very different than your average Mexican food spot.  Things are spicy since its New Mexican flavor so be prepared.  A hole on the wall spot that doesn't get as much attention that it deserves.

Fj5nlATHoQkL0B3RvRqr8g.text: Tonight we visited Richardsons for my sons birthday. Another great meal after many over several years at this wonderful restaurant. Jason was our server and took extra time to explain options on the menu that we had never considered. We started with chips, salsa and their homemade guacamole. Followed by crab empanadas  . All were delicious.  We enjoyed the Seabass special that was accompanied with vegetables and their delicious potato stuffed in a green chili. My husband enjoyed the Taos trio that included grilled shrimp, sausages, and a delicious quesadilla. My son had one of their specialties for which they are known for, pork arcavado. Delicious. We finish this fantastic meal with a delicious salon. Nothing compares to it and any other restaurant. This southwest restaurant and  is a must for people who enjoy food with a bite and Southwest flare. Thanks Jason to adding to a really spectacular dinner experience

Y2u_3EStjDJXp1Azo6b2aA.text: Small bathrooms  Small TVs  No food happy hour?!!

1VdTk9E1dJpKn4FdNuWQYw.text: Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix! Always have gracious servers and an amazing crowd. The best is the food, always consistent and always great tasting!!!

2Q_lXB6EfeigDtEIc2rTbg.text: Went to Richardson's this morning for brunch with friends.  Sat on the patio, that was nice.  We ordered the drink specials, $5 mimosas and $5 bloody Mary's. I enjoyed my Mimosa a great deal.  For brunch, I ordered the Crab Cakes Benedict that I thought was rich and delicious.  Would have loved a piece or two of fruit to help cut the richness but it's a minor complaint.  I would definitely order this again and return for Brunch.  My partner had the Adovado Benedict and that was also delicious.  The service was pleasant.  We will definitely be back.

-aDyMgl3uC4OjnLaFN7ZIw.text: I would give it zero starts if I could.  I would never eat in a restaurant that proudly states (in super small letters on their menu) that if you order it, you pay for it.  Really?  If they posted a sign in an obvious place that said that, I would have never walked in.  We had a group of 7, and an a waiter that seemed new and had no clue about the menu items.  We asked for something that wasn't spicy.  Four of the 7 of us sent back our cheese enchiladas, because they were inedible, and crazy spicy.  An arrogant guy, who called himself the manager, never came over to talk to us, until we went looking for him.  They refused to bring us something else without charging us again, he claimed he was standing by his small letters on the paper menu, and it was our problem.  Customer service at its absolute worst.  Everyone has an off night, but I would never return after that experience.

hZkIw0PUKh9Da3l5H8HeLQ.text: Hubs and I didn't have a reservation like we needed to get a good table. Our fault.  So we ended up at the bar, and we were lucky to get those seats; this place fills up fast.   The food is excellent quality authentic.  The ambiance is dark, with only candles for lighting, leather booths that looked really comfy. So make reservations and enjoy.

8islvXzgzikAgEpWkcXFaA.text: Food is alright. Service is garbage. You would expect a lot more from a place with the kind of prices they have. If anything, the food is what gave it the 2 stars...

daQRqg7vPnHNTW2Xxrmzpw.text: This place is good but it gets over-hyped.  Good Land o' Enchantment-style cuisine. Hot Hatch and Anaheim peppers make most of their menu items awesome.  Even the burger is decent.  But like going to an over-hyped movie this restaurant makes you leave feeling ripped off. I'll give it another try in the future.

RZ7Q6kHxYmKMsNJH_rPa9w.text: Definitely a must-try in Phoenix for New Mexican food with some unique twists.  The atmosphere is cool, but the staff can be hit-or-miss depending on who you get as your server or bartender.  Regardless, check it out for yourself for savory food and an authentic feel.

z5_x7jJic2TqzU05dx9vyQ.text: Went to Richardson's with 2 other couples to specifically get authentic New Mexico Mexican cuisine. Since one couple are natives of Santa Fe we knew what we were after. Hatch green chili and chimayo red chili sauce. The food delivered, highly recommend the Carne Adovada which was amazing.  If the service would have been good I easily would have rated the restaurant a 4 or 5. Slow service and the waitress acted like we were a major inconvenience. We arrived at 9pm which for us is not an untypical dining hour so I'm not giving them a pass based on the time. We get great service at many other local places at this time.

a3KR5-82C8aiF8PG55CO0A.text: One hour. That is how long we waited after ordering before we decided we would rather eat anywhere that wasn't here. A crushing, impressively underwhelming experience in lack of service.  We arrived and found:  Free valet parking? With a teensy parking lot, this works, thank you.   A good selection of indoor and outdoor seating? Also a plus.   Setting expectations and/or taking care of waiting customers? EPIC FAIL.  On a beautiful AZ autumn morning we came here (tho we entered Rockerij). We asked to be re-seated outside because inside of Rockerij is dark as a tomb and had loud conversation-intruding music. We were reseated by the fireplace and a waiter came over shortly to take our order. So far so good...or so we thought. 30 Mins after placing our order, I ask another waiter to check on the status of our food and he cleverly asks about what we ordered (exactly)...so we think it is being taken care of. 40 MINS after placing our order, I have still only had my coffee refilled once...and had to flag down another waiter to inquire about the status of our food again, because our actual waiter is nowhere to be found and the previous "drive-by" waiter never returned. A few mins beyond that, this guy actually comes back and indicates that our order is nearly ready and should only be a few minutes longer. Shortly thereafter OUR waiter stops by with comments of:   "I don't know why it's taking so long..." and "I put the ticket in right after I took your order..."  So...as a waiter...maybe it might be part of your job to check on the status of an order say...15mins after bringing it by the kitchen? Perchance? What do you think?  FIFTEEN (15 == few?) minutes later, we still had no food and I'd had quite enough. Out the door we went.  On a comical note: As we were outside (another 5 minute wait because the valet had our car either parked in Egypt somewhere or tandem?) our waiter came out to find us to let us know that our food was ready if we'd like to come back inside?  Oh R E A L L Y? The Clue-Delivery Train will be visiting you shortly. Facial cues you may want to look for in the future are: 1) the furrowed eyebrows 2) fuck-you facial expression and 3) curling fists  It seems that we are not alone in this. Courtney W.'s review (10/14/12) is representative of what we experienced.  I am dumbfounded how they have any good reviews. There must be a serious drought of sit down restaurants in this part of town, because this crap would never fly where I live. I cannot tell you how much I am looking forward to NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN.  P.S. They own 3 restaurants apparently: Richardson's, Rokerij, and Dick's Hideaway...all right in the same area (Rokerij and Richardson's being attached).   P.P.S. They all serve the same menu. It is NOT amazing. I have previously been to Dick's. Yes, it is good. No my socks did not come flying off.  P.P.P.S. ProTip: Drive down to Central Phoenix and go to Durant's, Portland's, Switch, or Fez. All of these places have exemplary service and food to match.

xwvoZzsNRwLGf3LxyXkVfg.text: I've been here many times after moving to the valley 2 years ago.  After having most of the dishes on the menu, I have to say that it's some of the best food that I have ever had. Any time that visitors are in town, this is where we go out to eat.  Love it, love it love it.

MreqjYbz8bQFA6jHwwwobQ.text: We went for a friend's birthday and were impressed with the food.  The service was average, but the ambience made up for it. It looks like it has an excellent happy hour.

V1N6q156PXw9WW562rMExg.text: Best Southwestern food in the Valley - Dick's Hideaway was part of Richardson's. They have the very best New Mexico style food especially the Carne Avodada breakfast dish. Service is always good and the atmosphere is great which is essential for fine dining. To bear this out; PF Changs opened a spin off Asian restaurant that was about 5,000 s.f. and almost never filled up. Because of this "cafeteria" atmosphere, even though the food was identical to PF Chang's it didn't taste as good and the experience was not there. Goes to show that PF Chang's and Oregano's have got it down. They have good food and are limited in seating so that they are always full and on a wait which really adds to the atmosphere.

1OzzXj4fG0TNJztV2LUvJA.text: Hotel California dining.  This restaurant is a unique gem with great food.

spLjhmgHdWs7vFoaFXLj6Q.text: Great food, beautiful atmosphere.  Must have the sopapillas, they are the best in the area.  Worth the drive from other parts of the valley.

iS09YdlZukE44DmYWfexoA.text: Great food but the service is hit and miss sometimes.  Warning: No high chairs, so if you bring kids come prepared.

vqzQuRE0A7AF7QWZ5DQ0NA.text: The best place in Arizona for Carne Adovada, Guacamole and Prickly Pear Margaritas. An especially fun place to bring out of town guests for a Southwest experience. Dark, cozy booths inside which require early arrival or reservations for parties of four or more. The outside bar also has great atmosphere for a more casual evening.

QlZexJELnL89YRNZEq5ReA.text: The food was good but OVERPRICED.  The setup was exactly like the old spot.  I thought the old location forced them into a cramped space but apparently,  they like it that way.  Service was good.  The $12 specialty margaritas DID NOT produce a buzz and I COULD NOT taste the tequila. Yes, I SAID IT, 12 DOLLARS!!  (Pint size with ice)  I guess if i order a $12 drink, I expect to taste some liquor in it and it should probably come in a giant margarita glass, like at Arriba's.  I think that the owners are cheap and trying to lure a snooty crowd that likes to show their friends how to properly waste some perfectly good money!!!  I had been to the old location several times.  Won't find me coming back to the new location though.  You've failed to retain an old customer.  Oh,  and the valet parking is just irritating. I walked out and there's my car, parked 20 feet away, and I gotta wait for the guy to get it for me?  All those blue cones are enough to piss ya off!!  What other place in Phoenix is like this?  I had a hard time finding my way out!!

eyR66W_838ss16mw1vGJHQ.text: Rude, sloppy, and lazy customer service. Specifically the incident that inspired me to give my rating today (believe me, if I could give 0 starts - I would)...I have been here several times and always ordered the same thing. Twice I was told the change I requested to my food was possible and I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. The third time I came as a paying customer to their restaurant, I was given a dirty look by my waiter, but my food was served to me as I had asked. Following this experience I attempted to try to dish as the restaurant originally prepares it and I was absolutely disgusted. Upon my final attempt to order the dish as I preferred, I was told they will no longer make the dish this way for me. In return, I will no longer be recommending this restaurant to people, and the 3 people who thought to possibly return here after I brought them, will also be informed of this disservice. I have now been informed by someone, likely an employee, that their food is also laden with semen.

e4W-3Ik1xNPITPe6mySpcA.text: I have wanted to write this review since our dinner at Richardson's.  Procrastination being the culprit.  I had read some iffy reviews of the new place, but we loved the old place too much not to give it a try.  Walking in to the restaurant was a bit of a shock.  I couldn't believe it was the exact same!!  That was a little weird, but in that the restaurant LOOKED the same, the food TASTED the same if not better!  Sea bass was perfect in every way! I had the chili rellenos which I love.  The sevice was wonderful! I believe his name was John.  I hope that is correct, because the reviews about service have been spotty at best, and he deserves a great review.  We will, definately, return to Richardson's, but not soon enough for me.  Glad to have it back!

1j8TXV0Dt0F0JJsOTaWajw.text: Great food!  Had one of the specials of the day... Pinenut crusted halibut which I had them smother with the green chili sauce...it was amazing!!!

cMvfyRmBATtlOiVLrElZ9Q.text: Seriously overrated! We have been to Richardson's once before and had a pleasant experience. This time around was completely different and have to say will not ever be back. A 2 hour 10 minute disaster! First server warned us of the 16 min garlic platter which was fine, we were excited to try it. Didn't realize she also waited to put our order in until after we ate it. With 11 people on the patio (4 kiddos) at 108 degrees with misters they turned off on us after sitting down for 10 mins...it's a no brainier to grab the manager for an explanation. Well, that didn't happen because the mgr left for the Dicks last Resort location??? It is Friday night, is it not??? So the kitchen lost our ticket was the explanation and when the mgr showed his face he decided to give us a 12% discount on our evening. Sorry, not good enough! Too many other great choices in the area to go back again. Blahhhh!!!! Server was sweet...not her fault...just inadequate management!

SwbOEp_eQ5JcnJDey16_nA.text: I have been a big fan of Richardson's since its old location and love it and its sister restaurants, Dick's and Rockerij.  The food is fantastic, creative and always hot which is something I really like.  Went there today for lunch and the food did not disappoint.  The service, however, was a different matter.  Our waitress was not pleasant and either completely overwhelmed or just incapable.  We would have had at least two additional rounds of drinks for the 5 of us but we had a tough time finding our waitress.  Even getting our water glasses refilled was tough.  We actually had to go find someone it was so bad.  We asked her for an additional silver setup which she brought but when we again asked for more water and if she could find our waitress so we could order more drinks, we got attitude and the its not my section look.  In addition to being non existent for most of the visit when she was around our waitress was really bit**y and showed no personality or interest in us being there.  We were there for almost two hours to get through lunch and while the food was good, its tough to enjoy when you can't even get a glass of water.  Lastly, we ordered red beers and rather than charging us the $3.50 beer price plus some amount for a little hot sauce we got billed for full on bloody Mary's.  Not a big deal but didn't really seem right.  We will ultimately go back but with their understaffed or just poorly trained service they missed out on an additional $70 in drinks from our table alone and probably one or two visits over the next month until we just can't stay away any longer.  Really hoping the next experience will be better.

cEhj7CqyKYsGdrBPjEPxlA.text: if you love new mexico hatch green chilis or just want a really delicious breakfast with quality ingredients, this is the place to go...the food is superb and worth every penny...and the atmosphere of the restaurant is awesome if you are someone like me who misses living in new mexico!!!    loretta in phx.

cxtf5LtHK9PyaN2uX0qYPw.text: All I hear about from Richardson's employees is what a dick Richardson is, and how they all hate working for him. I have to say, it shows. The service was horrendous, the brunch doesn't accomodate families. The menu is full of empty threats regarding plate sharing and a 20% gratuity on parties of 8 or more. The food looks tremendous, but I couldn't bring myself to order because my beer came to the table looking like someone had taken a swig from it, and we were waiting 15 minutes for a cup of coffee. The only people this place serves with respect and decency during Sunday morning brunch are martini ordering geriatrics and drunks from the night before. It has a great reputation, yet feels the need to ride the coattails of that as opposed to holding a quality/standard of service that should be commonplace in an area with strict competition. Do not bring your children. this place obviously prefers to serve adult clientele. My daughter is three, well behaved but we were still ignored.

9s53pTyRohJbPg07qnyvHQ.text: little confused on the outstanding reviews. went there over a year ago (got enchilada's) and our second time there today. i will say warm cozy atmosphere and no overhead harsh lighting was the absolute best and one of the reasons i wanted to go back. it stopped there. service was just ok. house margarita just okay and considering the cuisine it should be outstanding and trademark to the venue. food served on plates so hot (tamale's) that eating your meal is a job versus enjoyment because you have to let every bite cool on your fork before you actually consume it. my husband ordered brisket tacos and i had one of them. every bite was chock full of fat. after the third bite and swallowing it all i was ill and had to spit it out in my hand and put it on my plate. i was chewing on more fat than i cared for in every bite. i'm fully aware it can have some fat but this was beyond horrible.  and lastly, i ordered the tamale's and i can handle spicy food but this is ridiculous. the food is sooo spicy that it takes away from what could be totally wonderful and hearty flavors. again, it was our second time and i think this is the theme to all their dishes. very spicy and temperature hot beyond so beware. i don't know how a food critic would commend this. the spice in the enchilada and tamale dishes is so hot that you can't appreciate the natural flavors that are there to begin with.

OI2qm0HCeW9hgh-QCSXpZQ.text: This local restaurant is a gem. This is located down the street from the Hilton at Squaw Peak and probably the best restaurant in the area that is filled with a lot of chain type restaurants. I had heard about the Rokerij small plates menu from office workers and I thought I would give it a try. My girlfriend and I did not have any reservations, so we went downstairs in their bar area and ate the bar. You can order the Mew Mexican specialities or the Rokerij side of the menu. There was so much to choose from so we decided to eat off of the small plates menu. We chose the 3 small plates for $25. I was thinking the plates were going to be small and that we would not be filled. I appreciated that on the menu they told you how many "pieces" you were going to get of each item. The tenderloin on toast with triple cream brie was delicious. The amount of tenderloin was just right and the cream brie made it taste over the top. The scallops were cooked perfectly as well. Thoroughly enjoyed the taco sampler. Everything is fresh and the service was great. The couple next to us ordered off of the New Mexican cuisine side. The servings were ample and looked very tasty. I have heard the menu for brunch is equally fanstastic, can't wait to go back!

R7WGFqFw3Npk-A3sd31W7A.text: My review is of the service, not of the food. I live very close to there, and the service staff has never seemed like they care about their jobs. I'm glad I go for the flavor of the food, and not to be catered to, but it kind of ruins the atmosphere of a BEAUTIFUL restaurant if the servers don't care about their patrons.

67_ywyx3_BWXyHuu5wwimw.text: During a short trip to Phoenix, Richardson's got on the list of must go to restaurants. The reservation was made and the pictures of platings had been viewed several times over... Needless to say we were excited to go.   On first impression the place and atmosphere is extraordinary, the dim lighting made us all look really good and the waitress was one of those that didn't need to wright your order down. This is the reason that I didn't give less stars.   The food was not so good. I listened to a radio broadcast recently where Steve Wells (a famous food critic from the NYT) talked about how Instagram and the Internet had changed the way chefs think about presentation rather then actual flavor profiles. The dish I had was a perfect example of this. I ordered a steak - can't remember the name of the actual dish but I looked amazing. My mouth actually started salivating when food came mainly because I had saved myself all day for this moment. And then... I took a bite. Nothing tasted as good as it looked. The steak was chewy and l was simply dissatisfied.   If your thinking about visiting this restaurant I encourage you to go. I'm better for having gone once in my life then never having gone at all. It may be that southwestern cuisine doesn't move me, however, the visit and atmosphere is worth a peek.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ekc6OHi58dKsOphl8uJubw.text: Great Mexican food!  The blackened scallops (yes done mexicany) AWESOME!  Served with rice and beans in a skillet over a tortilla.  Heaven with a kick. Had the pumpkin cheesecake served in a tortilla shell.  This place is nice-great patio also.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pumpkin cheesecake
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackened scallops and a twice backed potato served in a pepper...who thinks of that?

pJXm96ga2SaKmXPUqapTag.text: Best brunch and always a stop for us when we're in Phoenix. Great New Mexico Chile, both red and green, though I prefer red. Jalapeno hollandaise is soooo good.

IHVgvqMF3KHGE-rrZ_y-sA.text: Place is bomb dot com Must visit when in Phoenix In my top five joints   Long before Yelp or the Travel Channel, my go to source for finding the best places to check out when travelling was a book called "Eat Your Way Across the USA."  I think this was only one of two places in Arizona that the book featured.  Went to Richardson's for the first time in probably the late 90's or early 2000's and have been hooked ever since.  It is among my absolute most favorite restaurants.  A couple years back, the original location was destroyed by fire.  This was my first time in the new location which is right around the corner from the original spot.  The interior looks almost exactly like the old location.  They now have mandatory valet, though, which I am not crazy about.  In the past, I have gotten the huevos rancheros and the enchiladas.  Best I have ever had for both.  Today, I got the Trio which was Swordfish, Salmon and Mahi Mahi.  Came on a tortilla with asparagus and carrots.  Outstanding!  They have five dollar mimosas, bellinis, and bloody marys during brunch hours.  Had one mimosa and one bellini.  I wish I had just come to Richardson's straight from the airport when I arrived last Tuesday.  It is that freaking good!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trio - Swordfish, Salmon and Mahi
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Today&#39;s Specials

Gf1ZkFpwNEpnIDQcsoySDQ.text: This place is amazing.   How does a restaurant top rated on Zag ats and Thril list not get top billing on Yelp?  No idea! I was blown away by the quality, service, and atmosphere.   Authentic Southwestern cuisine at it's finest.  You won't regret coming here.

us7bUzz0AAbG2hOmtewDcw.text: Not that impressed at all.  The food and drinks were way over priced and the service inside was so bad.  We had to ask for water 3x, food took forever to get and it just seemed like our group of 7 was an inconvenience.  We got there early and had drinks outside, which was lovely, but we were told all the tables outside were reserved so we only had a short time to sit and enjoy until we had to move.  I would have rather gone across the street to the City Grill.

14WKqeSOBZPxT3dAMsJJsg.text: This is one of the best restaurants in Phoenix. It's been around seemingly forever and hasn't skipped a beat. With the influx of new, trendy restaurants lately, Richardson's has managed to keep its charm and amazing food. Must order the skewer trio!

MpuGXrh1b-4ob31iEoDYAQ.text: Love this place. Great staff. Great food. Great environment. Tops all around.   I recommend the specials. Their fish is fantastic. The prime rib is ridiculously good.  Everything on the menu is top-notch. I especially like the sausages, so give everything a try it's worth it.

12RJAgCRK6ypw8d9vFtPgQ.text: I searched yelp and found that this place had pretty good reviews for New Mexico style food (note it's not "standard" Mexican food or Tex Mex)  I don't get any NM food in California so when I visited Phoenix yesterday and today, I jumped at the chance to get even a temporary fill.  I had the huevos rancheros (Christmas style- Red and green chili) with potatoes and beans and a tortilla.   The portions were big and I left content! The food was tasty and is making me miss New Mexico even more. The service was excellent. The place has a cool decor too.  If I'm back in PHX, I'll definitely stop here!  By the way, they said the name of the restaurant isn't related to the family of Bill Richardson... Former NM governor.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ambiance
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Decor
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros!

qGkcSp63RFrbHlUzXUM5Kg.text: The food and service was amazing. A few dollars more than usual but, the quality was well worth it. It has a great vibe and comfortable environment.  Three seperate businesses entities squeezed into one building was a bit confusing and unnecessary and leads to confusion.   On the downside, the valet parking is stupid, pretentious, and completely without value to the customer!!

FEZ2q7R6x8Jm-0L_lOoT1w.text: We have been to Richardson's many times over the years and have always found the food to be consistent- steaks, seafood, fish, specials- have all been excellent. But we had a problem on our last visit that really affected our experience- The service was poor-our waiter recited the specials in such a low voice that half of our party couldn't hear him, and our drinks took 15-20 minutes to arrive and came out 1or 2 at a time for a party of 6. The bar appeared to be well staffed so not sure what the issue was, but it was disappointing  to have such lackluster service at one of our favorite places.

H1JfUN_4yuL5sGFl00cxZw.text: The breakfast combo is the best brunch meal I've ever had. My only mistake was ordering it Christmas because the green sauce is amazing! The only thing I might change is the meat choice for the benedict.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

baaCa8hNiRBa3A0Ds4qIJg.text: This place is amazing!! Best New Mexican grille around!! Breakfast is our favorite time to go!! Especially on the outside patio!!

Fp1jacsRN1Cvq0EjHyG8Rg.text: This is a hard review to write.  I really want to give the restaurant 1 star for the very poor service.  However, the food is good, I felt obliged to give it 3 stars.  Service - called last week to make a reservation for 3 for 6pm Sat night.   Was told they don't take reservations for parties of 3.  Show up to the restaurant at 5:30pm. Hostess says we can sit at the bar and she'll put or name on the wait list.  Meanwhile, at the bar we watch several parties of 2, without reservations, get seated at tables large enough for 4.  Hour and a half later...still no table for 3. Hhhmmmm...  Food - carne sliders were too sweet and the ratio of meat to bread was off.  Relleno was outstanding!!! Bacon wrapped shrimp incredible, Queso was just ok.  Not sure what the restaurant has against parties of 3, but FYI, parties of 3 tend to spend more than parties of 2.

od1yaFKezF1FfoWf6Dy97g.text: Always great food and great margaritas! Plenty of gluten-free options as well. I love the enchilada, garlic board and the classic dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margaritas on happy hour

_GxcnBk3uESNehWBy3auKQ.text: Service was fine. Place is decent. Here is my issue. And Hey, Richardson's I reached out to you via email first to see if you would respond and make good but I never heard anything back. So if this cost you guests so be it.   Ordered the Renello Platter, lots of food. Not complaining about the taste or the amount. But for the price this can't happen. The platter of food is enormous, so I got a take home container. The next day for lunch I went to eat the leftovers. I took a bite and got pierced in the roof of my mouth with a bone. Wasn't small. I'm a guy that takes big bites, so this bone wasn't something I noticed. It was sharp and over 2 inches. I took pics and complained. Nothing was done. I email management, nothing. I called, no call back.   For a place that charges what they do... Get bones out of your meat. Disgusting. Not only did I lose my appetite but I got a cut in my mouth.   Beware if you eat there for the bones in your chicken.  I won't be going back. And I hope you all reconsider before spending 20-50.00 a plate here.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bone. Sharp, long, and nasty.

MTNK8D7umfQ5Kjx5SR61gQ.text: First time I went with my wife sat at the bar and had a great experience.  Bartender was very attentive and friendly.  Drinks were tasty. Bar was crowded too.  Food was on point had ceviche app and spilt the surf and turf,  they spilt it up with an extra green chile potato and was easily a 4-5 star experience. Btw we just told them we were sharing and they spilt it up nice.  Second time, had reservation for 6 for a birthday.  We arrived on time and had to wait 45 minutes for our table.  Host seemed confused and had no one to go for help.  Service was extremely slow food took forever and didn't all come out at once.  Server seemed very frustrated.  Food was off and seemed like there was a major lack of leadership in the front and back of the house.   It's a shame because the flavors are good and group liked the food.  We were in the place for 2.5 hours easily. They did comp an appetizer for the wait but someone in our party had complained. Some of the meals are $40+ you expect them to do a little better.
