I will go back and hoping next time I can upgrade score.

yLgilJ63WpktMsNU_ECbHg.text: This is probably not the best Mexican food in Phoenix but it's also not the worst. However, it might be one of the most overpriced for an enchilada. However, the ambiance kind of makes up for it, I guess. Subpar but edible if you're looking for a quiet low-key spot. Just bring you wallet and cash for valet. Don't ask very unnecessary.

zXf8XP54zGRCoaiC8bqtQQ.text: One of my favorite places. Not kid friendly, no high chairs. But beautiful setting and delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

V-dfMN5gKDYHAhzW3yBJWw.text: Green chile stew is to die for. Complimentary valet parking. Great place for a date night and the customer service has been on point every time I come here (often). Outdoor seating on the patio with an outside bar and indoor seating with great lighting. The food has been amazing every time I order but as I said you cannot go wrong with the green chile stew. Definitely an all time Phoenix fevorite.

yIhDaAxwgdEmp6enx2gzRg.text: Very average new Mexican food. Have been to New Mexico, and while I don't expect a restaurant in Phoenix to match restaurants in Santa Fe, this one unfortunately is not even close. Both red and green chillies which really are the hallmark of new Mexican cuisine are very sub-par. Red chili was a bit bitter and the green chili was just a low on flavor gooey mess. The service was very inattentive as well, too long to take orders or pick up the check. Just remember sitting and waiting for something to happen most of the evening. A lot of mistakes were made as well, the waitress nodded to acknowledge our special requests like "only green chili and not Christmas"  but the dishes eventually came out as they were described on the menu. Don't think we'll be back

i0-FLgSQfKyUzB9nGDYyhQ.text: We have been frequenting Richardson's for the last three years at least 3-4 times a month. The last time we visited the hostess sat us in what I like to refer to as the concrete-hole booth where no one can see you and you cannot see out (if you've been there you know which one I'm talking about). The hostess then neglected telling our server we were there so we sat in the concrete abyss for nearly 15 minutes before our server peeked over the wall at us. That visit ended well as the server knew how upset we were and did everything she could to make it right.   However, today we had a server I never met before. She left us sit for a while too, but we were in full view of her and every other staff member. When she finally came to our table, we inquired about chocolate milk for my granddaughter and received an emphatic "NO", not "No, I'm sorry we don't have chocolate milk but we do have..." just a rude abrupt NO followed by silence. Then my scrambled eggs arrived with the entire top of the pile just sort of jellied, not runny but definitely 'jellied'. She kindly took them back to the kitchen to throw back on the grill for a second or two. She returned with a plate of rubbery, burnt eggs and told me next time I need to request "hard scrambled". Well, NO dear lady, next time I would like my eggs scrambled the way they should be, soft and fluffy with no jellied grossness hanging around the top or the middle. We then sat, and sat,  and sat, and sat staring at my pile of uneaten food and my companions dirty dishes. When she ignored us and walked away one last time I said, "Excuse me Ma'am. Can we get our check please." At this point I was met with a rude "Give me a minute!" accompanied by a feisty glare. My husband then suggested maybe I should wait outside while he settled the bill. Good thing for her I took his advice because I don't generally respond well to rude, feisty glares.   Richardson's... I am sorely disappointed and this last experience will probably keep me from coming back because if you try to seat me in that girls station I'll get up and leave. You should do the math: 3-4 times a month at nearly $100 a pop. That's a lot of lost revenue.  And since I'll be sure to share my experience with others, you should remember, word of mouth is a powerful advertising tool as well.   I used to love you. Now I'm just booooooo Richardson's, I'm taking my money down the street.

jJf1uqE8dN_LBI0laVY8RQ.text: Every time I walk in here, I think... I should eat here more often. Every time I walk out I'm reminded why I don't.   A Mexican restaurant is first judged by their salsa. Theirs stinks. Not the first time I tried it either. I can't believe there is a manager or owner that wants to serve this stuff.    I'm sure there are some solid things on the menu, but I'm continually underwhelmed.   5 star atmosphere. 2 star food.  This place could be famous...their food keeps them from it. Pride is needed from someone.

im8W7DOm-Xbr3TFC7jn3eg.text: Amazing atmosphere and superb margarita. I splurged and went with the $1 up charge for their new tequila and it tasted so smooth. The food is not at all comparable for spice level as Los Dos Molinos, but the ambiance was a lot nicer. Thanks!

DTUrUZqymH9YydU3MbtU7w.text: We loved Richardson's! Great date night restaurant. The food was fabulous and our server, Jason, was amazing! Best service we've gotten anywhere in awhile!

aZzpV6tWWzS1_SUck_RTmg.text: So me and a lady friend stopped here for a night out a month back.   We arrived, there seemed to be no self parking or maybe I'm just not aware of it. Because it was just valet at the front. So i of course had to valet it. Which to me is odd. I'm not a huge fan of a valet service. I'm a big boy, I'll park my own fucking vehicle, FOR FREE. But whatev's.   I tried to bypass that. We entered and found a both near the bar. The food is a mix/hybrid/fusion of mexican-new mexican food.   I forgot what I had at the time. But I remember it being REALLY REALLY good. We also shared a great bottle of red wine that our server recommended to us.   The service was awesome, the food was amazing. A bit pricy, but like i've said before. You get what you pay for.   Definitely a place to check out, a wonderful date environment.

jDB63PP6UXlW13mpC099sg.text: After hearing about this place for years, I finally decided to give it a try. My husband and I came here for Sunday brunch. We were seated promptly and served chips and salsa right away. I ordered a $5 bellini which was on special and decided on the tenderloin hash special and my husband ordered the crab cake benedict. My tenderloin hash was cooked to my specifications along with a nice runny fried egg on top with beans on the side. My bellini was a generous pour as well. My husbands benedict was amazing and full of flavor with a rich hollondaise and really good crab cakes , I was jealous I didn't order it. The portion sizes were huge, we probably could've shared one dish. Prices were a little on the higher side, but the quality and amount of food made up for it.

xmfdvjYqE24heu0VDASkpg.text: I asked for a straw for my water and the server told me that they aren't allowed to give out straws anymore, that it "came from the top".  Meanwhile, my boyfriend sees a glass at the bar completely filled with straws (as well as bar sitting customers' drinks with straws) so he gets up and takes one.  The next thing we know, someone has put the glass of straws out of sight.  The server comes to check on us, notices the straw in my drink and asks me where I got it.  Are you kidding me???  At $40+ a person she is going to interrogate me about a straw?  How dare they!!!!    Well they just lost previously loyal customers who have been coming her for over 18 years!!!!

IIxmQjPqT4qulyZi1-o0aw.text: I like places that are different. This place is like no other. Be prepared to try something you don't normally get. Our table ordered green chili meat loaf, green chili stew, breakfast burrito and a Carne avoda. They were all very tasty.   If you're a foodie and like food experiences, than this I a good one. I'll be back

31kLmeJAjvDsCcR3KeF8ng.text: This place kind of disappointed me. Whatta bummer.  First of all, it's 2 places in one. Did not know that. From reviews I read before going, I was lucky enough to grab a parking spot out front because they're tiny little parking lot is usually valet. I hate valet!  Anyway, the cobblestone, hanging plant walk-way was pretty cute. Oh and the firepit seating and couches look like they'd be really cozy and intimate for an evening cocktail. So they've def got that going from them. Although when I was walking through the entrance no one greeted me. There were two guys who looked like they worked there just standing around. Come on, man.  The host thre me off too. He wasn't in a uniform or anything that identified him as the host, so I was a little taken back.   But when we were seated, I loved the adobe like seating arrangements and the lighting in the place made me feel like I was in a 1950s New Mexico saloon having a whiskey at 2 o'clock in the afternoon with a surly old bartender... that's a good feeling.  Wasn't impressed that the waiter didn't bring us chips and salsa until 30 seconds before our meal arrived but they were tasty. I orded the Taos Club because I love avocados. It turned out to be more of  wrap cut into 3s and not wrapped tight enough because it was disaster to eat and nothing stayed inside. The accompanying salad would have been way better had it b=not been slathered in ranch.   I had such high hopes for this place, but I honestly can't say that I'd go back. Wah Wahhh.

Bff6vS98iwm6Acz5z4V6eA.text: I'm shocked this place only has 3.5 stars!  The food was awesome and the restaurant is unique - something I value in Phoenix.  We had a hiccup with seating but the manager quickly rectified the situation and made us feel welcome.  We will definitely be back!

5vbN4xkZIuBRl6a3fGwukA.text: C.J is a server to request . I have never seen someone work so hard . I have been going to Rich/Rok for years and he has made a huge impression. The food was amazing and the service was even bette .

AQOrE-Bqp1j5sTWRVs6XnQ.text: Had the Carne Adovada and was more than impressed!  Going back for some of the pricier dishes because they sound fantatsic.

_zhWkYCdWcnEsvL33DPGLA.text: The ambiance and location saves this place from zero stars.  Food wasn't good at all, specially for the price. Guac was boring and chunky with unexpected (and unpleasant) textures.  The chips were oily although the salsas were good.  I had the angel hair chilly pasta with shrimp. The shrimp were good but the pasta was packed with alfredo sauce and no hint of spiciness at all.  I tried my friend's lamb rack and it was boring and flavorless.   Besides the great company and great place ambiance wise, the food doesn't worth the visit.  I'll give this place a try someday soon with hopes that it was just a bad day because the setting and ambiance are really nice.   Public service: servings are humongous, so don't over order.

4Q-6jPrLZhIbODnw3goU5A.text: The food is unbelievable!  I love the smallness and ambience.  It strays away from the chain aura every other restaurant has.  The quesadilla dip is one-of-a-kind.

0EdeyXnLxmEHTGUM1eBWxA.text: We went there last Sun for brunch.  I'm impressed with the atmosphere most. Love their unique fun kind of foods.  I didn't remember what we ordered but there were  shrimp sandwich, grilled spicy pork, and crab omelet. It won't take long to get the food here and they all are delicious! Worth stopping by :)

zOeK48H_iTxAOaDgwrUD1A.text: I was suggested this place by a friend who recently had a date there. I made reservations for a Friday night and was very excited since she highly recommended it. I was happy to find that there was valet service considering parking was limited. We were not sat right away but I wasn't too worried about it. Our service was great. The server was not overwhelming and very informative. I am a steak guru and decided to order the surf and turf dish with steak. I ordered it rare and it was prepared perfectly. I was AMAZED on the quality of beef that was used. I'm very apprehensive to places that serve steak considering its basic USDA choice, not prime. However, I was pleasantly surprised and pleased. I love this place and have no been back, but plan to go back soon!  I also REALLY liked the wood burning smell in the restaurant. Was definitely a welcoming smell.

B0vKyso0mrVSXHWspdOQUg.text: I can't express how excellent the food was...five stars is not enough.  The Chimayo Chicken was one of the best dishes I've ever had....amazing.  Friendly staff and good drinks.   If you haven't tried this place you will be glad when you do.

Bldfhohy7dMUs3cfmE4eaA.text: The 3.5 star rating baffles me.  Maybe people aren't ordering the right menu items.  I come to Phoenix about once a year and usually find a way to eat here 2-3 times.  It's simply the best southwest food I have ever had.  This isn't Mexican, this is southwest.  There is a huge difference.  I several times debated making the 300+ mile drive simply to eat the Carne Adovada and then drive home.  It's that good.  Also, the Carne Adovada Benedict is great for breakfast, the orange juice is fresh squeezed.  I am sure there is also a Carne Adovada Flan that is to die for.  If you can get an appetizer with carne adovada, you should try that too.

H5D0TXtlShJBcwlWQKzvpA.text: This place was highly recommend by several people so I had to check it out.   My first impression was that the restaurant was way too dark inside. I had to use my phone flashlight to actually read the menu. I suggest sitting on the porch if at all possible. You'll be able to see better.   I ordered the New Mexico enchiladas and they were fantastic. I got a beef, pork, and chicken. I have to say out of the 3 the chicken was the best. Accompanied with the prickly pear margarita this meal was phenomenal.   If you enjoy spicy food ask for their spicy salsa. Great addition to the meal.

nkxSTnynF4cPIzk7r6GIEw.text: This is one of the few places in Phoenix that is truly unique.  Both the atmosphere and food are something you can't get anywhere else!  There is a back entrance which is really cool, a descending stone stairwell in front that leads to the underground bar, and a main entrance.  They call their food "New Mexican Cuisine" which is perfect.  It's not traditional Mexican, they have little tweeks and variations of many Mexican favorites.  Mixed in are modern American fish and chicken dishes with a new Mexican twist.  You can regularly catch them fire roasting the green chiles out back, and they are used in various dishes.  I love stopping in here anytime I'm in the area.  It is a must try if you like finding something that provides a break from the mass produced and safe, boring menus of the corporate culinary machine.

1YUwwShwY6EILGGtM9uxwg.text: This was by far the perfect find for our dinner last night. The atmosphere of the restaurant was dimly lit, romantic and had a touch of prohibition feeling. Valet parking was a plus. We sat at the bar but there were several seating options. The bartender was on point with his drinks and the food was amazing! The Carne Avado was spicy and so flavorful even my husband who does need eat spicy food enjoyed the complex flavors. I had a chicken Caesar with grilled chicken. A single position is enough for two but on the bright side we have our lunch for today. I would ram commend going and may go again during my trip to Phoenix. This restarting would rival anything in Portland, Or.

mXYVGz5U_6TrmrLxzqX-oQ.text: Sensational Carne Adova. I normally don't like beans, but this place changed my mind. The tortillas are fluffy, and the smoked pork is unbelievably tender. The decor is eye catching and features tables made of copper. This place is busy and rightly so!

geUuqT2VUDhzP9bs-W9ZsA.text: Amazing New Mexico cuisine!  I highly recommend the Carne Adovada with eggs for brunch or dinner... It has so much flavor with just the right amount of heat to make it enjoyable to the pallet.  My next favorite is the chili relleno stuffed with pork.  Can't get enough of this place.  Our server Susanna was amazing and is a definite must to sit in her area.  Great food and great service, what a winning combination!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special of the night
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The New Mexico
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stuffed pork Chile relleno with potato beans eggs and cheese.

YYZQK_ByYXxxjEkmLaag8Q.text: My husband and I have been here twice now. The first experience was great. The service was good the food was terrific. However, our most recent visit not so much. The food was good but the service was sub-par. It started with the parking, there is a sign that says complimentary valet, no one came out to get the car. When we walked into the Richardson's side a kid who looked like the host was not helpful. He told us there were no tables but offered no other information. We found a table on our own at the outside bar. The atmosphere was great.  The server took a long time to approach and again gave us no information until we asked. She walked away and we had to ask another employee to find her for to take our order. Like I said the food was good but the service could have been better.

QzVKih8mGPz6BYouE3dHoQ.text: I issued a challenge to my ex-pro baseball player buddy: Find me the best spot in the area for Southwestern cuisine. NOT Tex-Mex, but True Southwestern. Oh, and it needs to be a "spot I've not tried". He knows I camp out at The Mission and absolutely love the food, so getting close was a challenge.   Richardson's Cusine of New Mexico is a unique dining spot with an "Old Phoenix" ambiance. It helps that it's also located in "Old Phoenix" and is dark and cozy. I had a special called the Taos Trio or combo. It consisted of Carne Adovado, Bacon wrapped Shrimp and home made spicy sausage with green chili potatoes. Incredible food! Several people ordered the Chilean seabass which I tried and this was also wonderful.  Service was excellent and we really enjoyed dining for 4. Apparently, this place takes no reservations, but uses a call-ahead approach up to about 6:45. We were in Paradise Valley and gave the 10 minute warning and they greeted us as we came in.  Excellent food and really nice people!

XMmfZuwxnHq8FEDZxCiwOw.text: Excellent place to eat while visiting the area for a wedding. Very good food and reasonable prices. Only real negative was our server only checked on our table 1 or 2 times and we had to wait about 20 minutes to get the bill.

xb21FOhiBZcWP4xpKRTFAA.text: My husband and I went for an early dinner here for our anniversary.  We are crazy about this place after just this one visit, Jason was our waiter and he absolutely makes your evening so great !  We sat inside, it was not smokey in there at all.  We arrived about 5pm, Jason said all the tables were reserved at 6:00 and 6:15, so he sat us in a nice booth but we needed to out by 6:15 ( good to know going in, right ! )  Speaking of reservations, you cannot make a reservation for 2 at all, must be 4 thats because they only have a few booths inside, large outside seating on their beautiful patio with fire pit. The food, I had the three enchiladas and you can pick what you want in each one.  My pick was one with green chili pork, one chicken and one cheese, comes with rice and beans and a large very tasty tortilla.  Most places the rice and beans are filler, but here they are so good, you will eat every bite.  The green chili pork was my favorite, the chicken was really good coming in second and the cheese which is usually my fav comes in third  My husband had the carne adovada rice and beans and tortilla.  He really enjoyed it, and the portions were to large that we had it again for lunch the next day. Appetizer you must try the queso with spinach and chorizo comes with blue and regular chips so tasty, so spicy good we ate every drop, the blue chips were the best. We tried the flan, it does have cream cheese in it so its not like regular flan, but its good too. Love, Love, Love this place, their food and Jason ! At dinner all parking is valet.

tQLb3OL_GEBvr3rxI5pdEg.text: This review is super delayed, but I could not just forget to give this place the great recognition they deserve.  I recently moved to Oregon after living in AZ my entire life. I made my first trip back home to AZ to see my mom and sisters.The girls went out for a day filled with food, laughter, and love. We saved the BEST for last. RICHARDSON'S!!!!!!!  Between the 4 of us, we ordered some of the best items on the menu. Carne Adobada, Enchiladas, Mexican Chicken Cordon Blue, and ooooooohhhhh the Chili Relleno!!!!! Richardson's has the most impressive chili rellenos I have ever experienced. And I have experienced some freaking Rellenos!  I would not expect to find Mexican food this good out of a some what up scale restaurant in what my sister would call Cen Pho (FYI, I would NEVER call it that).  Great job Richardson's!!!!!

LYSvJIA2EJhLs_2ThTHtEA.text: My first time here and I have to say, it did not live up to its expectations. From the moment we got there, the hostess was rude and when I asked if they could turn the air up before my friend turned into a popsicle, we were declined. I then asked if we could turn the fan off right above us and she still said no without any explanation. I ordered the shrimp enchiladas and I would say there was MAYBE three pieces of shrimp in the entire dish.   Splitting up the check was a nightmare since we were told they dont do seprate checks , she came over probably every two minutes to make sure we were moving along in the bill splitting process. It was not relaxing, enjoyable or worthwhile. It was a going away dinner for one of my friends and I was sad to say that upon leaving, I knew she wasn't thrilled with the service or the food.

H78rwx7jZzad-fd913WeUg.text: Everyone in the "know" in Phoenix knows about the Rokerji / Richardsons. This place serves the best southwestern food hands down. Ask Esquire magazine, who awarded them best bar in America. And of course Phoenix Mag gives their nod to this place almost every year. These 2 restaurants occupy the same real estate but the Rokerji is in the basement and it is my personal favorite. The atmosphere is 5 stars. Big sofas, large booths in a Grotto like setting with a roaring fire. It doesn't get any better than this. The menu is the same whether you choose to stay up top at Richardsons or go down below to the basement. The food is hands down the best of its kind in town. Now if you are heat sensitive, listen to your server. The owner of these places means it when he says "spicy" but it's oh so worth the pain. My favorite here is the Carne Adovada with an egg on top. It is unforgettable. The egg is the magic touch to me with this dish. They tend to have this more on the breakfast side but don't let that deter you. You can have them add the egg anytime. The richness of the warm yolk melding into this dish sends it over the top. Trust me you will absolutely love it. I give The Rokerji / Richardsons 5 stars in spite of some of the tired burned out staff members. Unfortunately some of the servers here have forgotten the True meaning of being in the service industry.  It is my feeling that the owner, Richardson, needs to remind his staff that there is 3 parts to a great dining experience. The ambiance, the fantastic food and the SERVER.  But for now overlook the occasional subpar server and give this place a try. It will become one of your favorite spots right after your first mouthwatering bite.

kbb3ROfL16d43hWwAIxeiw.text: Good food, terrible service. Maybe nice for a bar dinner for two, but definitely not kid-friendly.  We went today to catch a celebratory brunch for a few family achievements. My wife and I tow along a toddler and an infant, and we wanted to get a table for 6, for the other family coming in. The hostess looked at us like we were blood-stained hobos or something, and seemed oh-so-upset that she had to take us to our table. When we asked if there were high chairs or accommodations for the infant in the car seat, she flatly replied no and suggested we could put our infant on the floor. You know, totally normal restaurant practice.  The staff, from bus boy to waiters, seemed to do just the bare minimum. No smiles or friendly talk, and it was almost like they didn't want to make eye contact. I'm Asian so with my squinty eyes I can understand if people have a hard time making eye contact. But my in-laws have perfectly normal eyes. One waitress, who was also attending at the bar, was nice enough to talk to us a bit, but was too busy and eventually had to ask another grumpy person to take care of us.   Anytime we had questions, like whether we could sit outside, or where the restroom is, or, oh I don't know, if we could I have a water refill, we'd be met with what looked like eye-rolling. We all felt uncomfortable. I actually felt relieved to leave, eventually.   Food was nice, but not good enough to warrant coming back for.

czCtk92z9GHgVGc5YkeOzw.text: Awesome food more awesome service thanks cj. Kendra one who knows all makes a great libation

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. People that made my day fun

-ovWCGR_qMYQ7RmzuOVCVg.text: As a long time patron of Richardson's I am always taking new people in and encouraging others to come downtown and try it!  This occasion, February 28, 2014, one of my good friends and I stopped in for a much anticipated lunch together.  This is the first time I have ever considered never returning.  The restaurant was not busy  There was only 12 people in the inside dining area between 11 am and 12:30. We arrived at 11am and chose to sit at the bar inside. The young woman at the bar greeted me and served me a glass of wine and then proceeded to continue her "set up the bar" duties.   When my friend arrived we waited several minutes and then I had to call to the server to ask someone to take my friend's drink order. 5 + minutes later our server/bartender still had not brought the requested beer although the server/bartender was right there on the other side of the bar in full view. 3 feet away from us. Remember the restaurant was not busy.  We ordeedr the bacon-wrapped shrimp appetizer to share and it arrived in a reasonable amount of time and was amazing, as usual.  Unfortunately we could not seem to get ANY service for a glass of water or a second glass of wine.  Again I had to ask the server to please ask the bartender, or whomever was supposed to be working behind the bar, to please see if someone was available to serve us. At this point we still had not been able to order lunch.  The Bartender/ young woman who initially served us come up to take the drink order and I asked if the three salads on the chalk board were good.  She assured me they were excellent.  I am used to the house salad, which is excellent, and we assumed we could count on something of that quality.   We ordered the beef tenderloin salad split and another glass of wine and a beer. 12-15 minutes later we still did not have our drinks. There was NO ONE new inside the dining room and one party out on the patio and several servers so as far as we could see there was no reason for the total lack of service.  Another 10-15 minutes and the salad showed up on one plate.   This salad was a very un-inspired 'Cesar" with limp flavourless beef flopped on top of a mound of rusty romaine lettuce and some basic croutons with some shaved Parmesan Crude and messy presentation and it was certainly not what we envisioned.  The server went to "find" some small plates and the salad was then deposited on the bar for us to split. No serving pieces were provided for us to accomplish this. She also did not offer to assist or to take the salad back to the kitchen to be re-plated.   Maybe I am being picky here but I can get a terrible salad at any Denny's or Village Inn. Richardson's is known for service and quality. The service was non-existent. The salad was terrible, overpriced and tasted flavourless. The only thing that was good was the wine (which we had to practically beg for) and the shrimp appetizer which is all on the kitchen's skill.  So feeling very un-welcome and very disappointed in the salad, lack of service, and our expectations for a great lunch - we gave up and decided to forgo anything additional. 60 dollars later we were happy to just leave.   I am terribly disappointed. Richardson's is my go-to restaurant for special occasions, lunch with friends, happy hour - you name it. I can go to Postino's (closer to my house) or Windsor, Zinburger - any number of other options for a great meal. I fully expect Richardson's uniquely prepared high-end food when I come here and for 60 dollars for lunch I would hope to be at least not frustrated and hungry when I leave.

6vQc0nt7UrMfmuoLohdsBg.text: Adore this place, seriously fabulous times spent here.   A+ - Ambience. Dimly lit, Architecturally comfortable, Open yet intimate seating A+ - Crowd. Meet great people here; professional, classy, intriguing  A+ - Service. They'll seat you where you prefer and will never leave your glass empty (;  A+ - Menu. Amazing food. Simple yet different and delicious. Fun to try something new, they always serve fab specials. Extensive wine list, Happy Hour has 1/2 half bottles!!   Go here when you're in Phx, Az

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fab time with friends @Richardsons!!

E_aeQVGglK8Hf1vJxO2f4g.text: Today (9/2), they fulfilled their promise... Richardson's.  It has taken over a month but they came through.  Sorry to have had to hound them but I guess ok.

0Oh0nj1cCcMOCcvnj8VT3g.text: Unfortunately, I had a sad, sad experience at Richardson's a few weeks back. I was tasked with planning a dinner for about 50 of my colleagues who would be traveling to AZ from various parts of the country. Because we have been having the most incredible weather and because Richardson's is known for authentic New Mexican cuisine (which I thought many would not have experienced before) I decided on this restaurant's patio for our setting.   Working with the events manager was great, she was very responsive and easy to work with, I had great expectations! Sadly, it all went to sh*t on the night of the dinner. First of all, they had two servers on a 50+ person party. Whaaa? I felt bad for the servers as they were completely set up to fail. Second, when one of my colleagues asked if some of our tables could get water, after waiting 45 minutes, the manager got in her face. Inappropriate!   The manager later apologized and our colleagues who had not yet been greeted or helped were quickly taken care of. I appreciate them stepping up but these thing should have never happened in the first place. As great as the food was, and that is the only reason for my two stars, I will not be heading back to Richardson's anytime soon.

QdztfdHfjh3kBztFQ2U5vw.text: Loved everything tonight, and always do when I come to Richardsons. Loved the chips, guacamole, salsas, and the chile rellenos. My friends loved the spicy chicken tostadas and the steak and shrimp plate. Just the right amount of spice in the food and in the waiter.

j88uZtyrnFq9PHZGPCiAMQ.text: How can a place with such great food have such terrible service....consistently terrible.  We went here for brunch and three of us got some variation of the carne adovada (there are multiple preparations available.); the other guest ordered the green chili stew.    All four meals were divine.  However, the service, the service, the service is still an issue.   We sat at the bar, and she didn't seem that busy.   Yet, she was too busy to take our orders....pretty much through the almost two hours we were there.   And I am almost positive I have never seen a manager on duty.  I am improving my rating from a 2 to a 3 because no one spilled anything on us and then pretended it didn't matter.

LxNpoD2-I6MBZG7Q22cT_g.text: Saturday was my 2nd time to Richardson's.   I swore I'd never go back after the first horrid experience a few years ago......but we decided to give it another shot.    The 2nd time was my last time!   Not much really changed!   The food is average.......the service is just OK.   Too many rules from our server!   Cant do this,  can't do that.   Not overly friendly.    It's a beautiful restaurant inside,  but that's about all it's got going for it, in my opinion.  Overpriced for what you get!   Not the best menu selection.    There are so many other wonderful restaurants to go to,  so I'll pass on this one and go to the others.

9ZWV1292oiwvPB8Md3uHVQ.text: The service there sucks esp down stairs. I love the food but service there sucks!  He made me feel like I was annoying him

A8Sn1yOrNrtRuIRqEh7c0g.text: Amazingly good food. Great cocktails. Ate dinner and brunch here. Rachel was our brunch bartender, really attentive, very charming. Great bartender. I will miss this place. Highly recommended. Real deal cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

i6pZxvNu5puw0xX1LjbUvQ.text: I came here again with a previous co-worker for lunch.  We were able to sit outside on a beautiful cool Thursday afternoon.  The service was great and the place was very clean.  We ordered the following: Chips and Salsa ($3): it came with 3 different salsas. Pico De Gallo, Tomatillo, and Habanero (it was mild though).  It was very good.  The blue and yellow corn chips were warm, light and crispy.  The salsas were great but I wished the Habanero had a stronger kick.    Blue Wedge Salad with Cajun Chicken ($9): The chicken was great, it was moist, tender and very flavorful.  However it had tortilla strips and black bean salsa, so it should have been called the "Tex-Mex Blue Wedge Salad with Chicken". It didn't come with Blue Cheese Crumbles only blue cheese dressing with very little blue cheese crumbles.  Cuban Sandwich ($9): last time I had a Cuban sandwich was at Porto's in Burbank, CA.  Porto's Cuban sandwich had very thinly sliced ham, pork, Swiss cheese in a delicious flatten sandwich.  However, the Cuban Sandwich had 1/2 inch thick ham, roast pork and a green sauce and a Swiss cheese (see picture). They should have renamed this the "Thick Cut Cuban Sandwich".   My visit was good, but I will definitely try another restaurant when I'm in Phoenix, AZ again.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cuban sandwich, with very thick meats. Not what I&#39;m used to.
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cuban sandwich with very thick meats. Not what I&#39;m used to for Cuban sandwich
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blue wedge salad will cajun chicken. Had tortilla strips and black bean salsa, no blue cheese crumbles only blue cheese dressing

bqqQ1No96jLaGcPVz8lHWQ.text: I really feel the service needs a major upgrade.  When our server came to us, he really didn't seem like he had time to answer questions about the menu.  It was our first time there.  There is no drink menu, so when I asked questions about some of the signature cocktails, it was like pulling teeth... and he kept trying to pull himself away while we were asking him questions...it was awkward, and felt like his other tables were more important.  There were huge gaps of time when he didn't check in with us, and I'm pretty sure he forgot about us after the check came, because we had to go to the bar to find him and he looked surprised, and I'm pretty sure he muttered "oh shit."  I would blast out his name, but he never introduced himself.  The food, was decent, but overpriced... I didn't really like the green chili potato thing.  The steak and shrimp was good, I liked the red chili sauce.  My husband asked for a baked potato and it was cold in the middle.  It just wasn't for me, and I hate that we spent $150 for 2 people, at a restaurant we were very unhappy with.  Will not be going back.

5VpaTpWAVCUU_xatiWDOpA.text: Beautiful dog friendly patio with cool air fans! Great place to take your furry friend for Sunday Funday!!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New Mexico Platter...  now THIS is BRUNCH!!
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tony loves Richardson&#39;s and Richardson&#39;s loves Tony *Sunday Funday*

re7H8MlcVLF_QXtadR1FJg.text: Best vegetable enchiladas with green chili sauce I've ever had. Spicey, but so delicious.

3KQnygoJHCnISaOJskT5_A.text: Rokertj is going straight downhill. I just got here and literally waited 20 minutes to get served. Then I ordered an espresso martini and the bartender told me the espresso machine was down. The same excuse they have me 3 weeks ago! You expect better from a place like this.

_LuDE8ILUKt4I2-svtjVsg.text: Such an amazing dinner! Porterhouse and Halibut entrees were amazing. Happy hour menu standouts included chipotle ribs, New Mexican sausages, bacon wrapped shrimp, and stuffed jalapenos.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NRQoGCGAPiznAohN8DyusQ.text: My go-to place whenever I'm in Phoenix. Love the smokey flavor of their chicken burritos.

WZ2_G0duhuPhSAk6I-E27Q.text: You fill up quickly in this place.  My wife has always told me how much she loved New Mexican from a summer spent there and this upscale rendering did not dissapoint.    I had a gimlet with a splash of grapefruit juice.  It was good  but with no room at the bar while we waited (make reservations of you have a chance) as they used it primarily as overflow for dinners at both bars and told not to go downstairs to the bar as no cell service down there...  We were offered a chance to dine at the bar and debated but decided against it which seemed to irk the hostess a bit.  We started with the scallops which were grilled perfectly, huge and on a flour tortilla which contained rice, beans, queso and green chillies.  Really wish I had taken a pic.  5 stars for this dish!   I had the New Mexican which included bacon wrapped grilled shrimp, chicken enchilada in red and green Chile sauce and a cheese relleno.  The cheese relleno which was not fully melted in the middle.  Not only hard but also a bit cold in the middle.  I would give 4 stars but the bar situation and no real waiting area irked me a little.  I give 3.5 stars for this, 4 but for the relleno.    We will be back!

x_qG19p00T2Xz8VPQhgTWQ.text: I have been here a few times over the years.  Similar to the other two places owned by the same people.  Unfortunately they have the Valet parking for no apparent good reason.  They just tend to be in the way, blocking the parking!  Anyway the food here us OK, I have never been blown away by this place so it has never been a regular of mine.  I first went here almost 20 years ago when it was down the street and remember being a little disappointed back then.  I went with my neighbor who raved about the place but he is from Iowa!  What do they know about Southwest cuisine?!  Like their other two restaurants they have a good atmosphere and friendly staff and their apps are usually better than the entrees and a better value, especially during happy hour.

Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Foegot ro ask for sauxe on side
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Adovada with eggs and hash browns

CJMWS8SV_8QNSRNthZNw7Q.text: New Mexican cuisine done right- this is the original of trifecta of restaurants (rokerij and dicks hideaway) that have similar menus.  A cozy patio entrance greets visitors in a warm welcoming way.  After 2 visits off peak times we have had no wait. I recommend the happy hour from 3-6 as most appetizers are a few dollars off.  A decent house margarita sets my mood with a happening bar area and fast moving staff.  Brooke did a great job on our recent visit.  She knows a lot about the dishes and can answer any questions that one may have.  So many great specials this evening including a cheese steak option!  We are in a Mexican mood every day so we order a beef chili relleno and smoked chicken toastadas.  Very crispy shells with yummy chicken and a salad atop- could have benefitted from a salsa or aioli.  The relleno was super classic on a grill pan with yummy bubbly sauce and delicious cheese.  Sharing the adovada was a smart move on our part.  You can substitute the rice and beans for a veggie or salad so we did a salad. This keeps the meal light because the red chili pork is very smoky and flavorful but a generous portion.  We loved it!  We did not hear about desserts and this is my one regret after dining at Richardsons.  We had 2 drinks each and everything came to about $75 for 2 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love the copper detailing
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili relleno
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Smoked chicken tostadas

p3tsZwjzGbQti3Q-LZYIvg.text: I didn't know what to expect with this place considering the menu isn't incredibly detailed. I have a gluten allergy and it looked like just about everything had gluten in it... again, couldn't tell. We asked the waiter (who showed up about 30 mins after we had sat down - not kidding, but it was late and he gave us free chips/salsa as an apology) about the possibility of corn tortillas, mentioned the gluten allergy and he claimed it was no problem. He would make sure our orders came out okay. One of the things we ordered had a panko crust, which he told us as he came out with it rather than as we were ordering it. Not a huge deal - I just didn't eat that one. The food took forever to come out after we had ordered and it was all super mushy. I really liked the enchiladas and the garlic appetizer, but they came with bread on top - and this is after we told him about the gluten allergy. This place is a nightmare for celiacs. Thankfully I don't react too strongly, so I ate around it, but it was so stressful and annoying.

sbYltIwTHEdCTKpPXGOHOw.text: Excellent food, excellent service.  Had the skewers with some wine.  The food was flavorful and cooked nicely.  The setting in comfortable and clean with a nice ambiance.  An excellent choice for nice food, wine and a classy setting.

1Xwm31yVEDGUxG8lgfEZDw.text: Well...I am quite frustrated at this place. I will be more than happy to change my review when I actually get a chance to try the food and experience the restaurant.  My fiancee wanted to take me to a nice dinner on Sunday night and I've heard great things about Richardsons and wanted to try something new. We did get a little bit of a late start, and didn't leave the house until about 9pm. The hours on Google are a bit misleading because when you type in "Richardsons" it says it's open from 8am-12am everyday. I called just to be sure.  The woman told me Richardsons closes at 10pm but the sister bar next door Rokerij closes at midnight. I hang up. I called back again because I just wanted to make sure, before we drove there, that Richardsons doesn't have a last call on food since they close at 10pm and we wouldn't arrive until about 9:20pm. The woman kept repeating that they don't close till 10pm so why would they turn is away or have last call? I asked again in a couple different ways, saying I understand that but do you have last call on food? (Only because I didn't want to show up and be told it's too late) Some restaurants will have last call on food 15 minutes before they close.. She said "then those restaurants should say they close at 945" she also said "We never turn anyone away"  Cool... So to me that means, they don't have a last call on food. We show up, and I commented on how nice the place was. I've never been there, and I was curious about the happy hour as well. Server came up while wiping sweat off his forehead, looking less than thrilled and was clearly not happy about us being there. He gave me the happy hour menu and just set it down without explaining anything to me (which is fine I'll figure it out,) and said "just so you know the kitchen closes in 5-10 minutes"  I was confused because I had JUST called about this so I didn't have to feel rushed and uncomfortable. We asked for 5 minutes and he just walked away... I'm a server and understand people coming in last minute buttt....I had already called and was told you don't turn people away before 10. He made me extremely uncomfortable and didn't want to give them my business at that point..I was really frustrated and we just left. I was really excited to try this place and apparently the communication between the staff needs to improve so that doesn't happen again.

r8YfuAhGmLeU7C8-et_8mg.text: Ate breakfast today at Richardson's for the first time. Had the meatloaf brunch special....if I could give 10 stars I would. Fantastic! Blood Mary is spicy. One of the best breakfast's I've ever had.

9glY4UdbUF2gChvAGCF8Nw.text: Richardson's is an excellent choice if you love high quality New Mexican food. Today we enjoyed a delicious brunch- enchiladas (cheese & beef) Christmas style (red&green chile), carne adovada & over easy eggs, a bowl of beans with red chile, onions & cheese, mimosas, and bloody Mary's.   All were excellent!!!  It was a beautiful day so the patio seating was full but we were able to grab a spot at the bar inside which is always a good place to sit and enjoy your meal and cocktails. Next-door, at the Rokerij, or just south on the opposite side of 16 th street, at Dick's Hideaway, sitting at the bar is definitely The way to go because you can watch as the cooks prepare your food and enjoy the wonderful smell of the pecan wood used in the grills.  Both the red and green chile are excellent- I generally prefer the red, but only slightly.  There's not a bad thing on the menu and they always have some great specials that are not on the menu- The only challenge is convincing myself to order something other than my favorites that are on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchiladas- Christmas style
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Adovada with over easy eggs.
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bowl of beans with red chile, cheese &amp; onions.

0PtZ_YzC7uq4YJH-ntCDDg.text: Being a True New Mexican I had to try this place out. When you pull into the parking lot it's valet only, I'm not a fan of that at all but it's complimentary and being the lots so small it's understandable. When you walk in you enter into the patio dining with lots of tables and room. The restaurant inside is extremely small and when I went it was packed, I recommend a reservation on weekends. I had to sit on the patio and it was a bit chilly. I ordered the Carne Adovado. It came with pinto beans and rice. The red chile was delicious, it was truly New Mexican no doubt. The pork was smoked which isn't in any way, shape or form New Mexican but it was extremely tender. I wasn't a fan of the smokey flavor with the red chile. True New Mexican restaurants serves chips and salsa before the meal and sopapillas with the meal. I missed that but all in all I would go back for the red chile alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pXCZHUQhkCHhxW5xG4IHqg.text: We came to Richardson's/Dick's Hideaway for brunch during my whirlwind trip to pay court to Vicki and Enzo.  Brunch is the whitest of meals and it is something I often look forward to with glee.   When you get to the restaurant you'll notice that it is very small and you'll be seated family/European style (sitting with people you may not know because there is space at the table).  If that's not your bag of tricks there is a bagel shop across the street that is home to many fond memories for me and is a perfect substitute.  The room is decorated like a dusty wine cellar and is a dusty wine cellar, there was a wood fire warming the room and the set up was charming.   It took us longer to order than it did for us to decide where to go, get ready, and leave the house.  This wasn't because we couldn't decide what to eat but the waiter - I didn't catch his name but I'm thinking this is his hideaway - took forever to bring our drinks, take our order, argued with Enzo and spoke to him in a dismissive tone, lacked personality, and was fairly rude (no thank you, just walked away when Enzo was speaking).  The other thing I didn't like was kitchen door that would forcefully swing open around where people were walking.  If your kitchen door doesn't have a window and there is a chance people may be moving around it then it's a solid idea to open it gently.    I had the breakfast burrito "Christmas style" which meant green and red chilies.   I'll be straight up pedantic and point out that Advent and Christmas' liturgical colors are white and purple, green and red are used other times .  It was good.  The terrible service didn't distract from the good food - and sometimes it can.  My friends enjoyed their food as well.    I wouldn't suggest this place if bad service, crowded seating, or dust, bother you.  If you're cool with this or you're pretentious this will be right up your alley.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

B1GzVrLTmmm5ZVaCt5m3XQ.text: A friend recommended this place after learning of my Phoenix trip. Located in a semi residential area, it has a unique set up: two separate restaurants (Richardson's and the Rokerij) sharing a common covered central courtyard with its own entrances; the latter was closed when we come for lunch. My dining companion preferred the bright, open courtyard than the dark interior (it looked cozy to me). The menu offered many tempting authentic Mexican dishes. We settled for the familiar rellenos & eggs and carne adovada burrito. Food came out piping hot in a proprietary metal dish with the restaurant names engraved on it. The portions were generous and hearty. However, the unique container likely accelerated the melting of all the components (like hash browns without crunchiness sitting in oil,.blending with neighboring beans and Chile) into one wet mush . Ditto the burritos. We could barely finish half of our brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nRqL34bvFmQcwqXGE5nUww.text: Excellent all around - Ambiance, Service, Presentation, and Food We've eaten at another site operated by the same company, and heard that this one was good.  Good is an understatement. Walking in is a treat - you walk through an outdoor patio dining and bar area that is designed for comfort and leisure. Service was fantastic from our choice of seating through the time we left.  The waiter had suggestions, and clearly knows the menu.  We came dinner, but plan to return soon to try the lunch menu.  Neither of us could eat half of the dinner portion, especially after that huge salad and great appetizers.  Since we rarely leave a restaurant planning our return visit, this says much.  We want to try everything on the menu, so Richardson's and the adjoining restaurant will be a regular stop for a while.

5kGF_E-t3sOx8aD3iLtuuw.text: Thanks again for Yelp! We're in Phoenix for a Memorial Weekend reunion at Hilton Resort Squaw Peak and seven of us wanted a Friday breakfast/ brunch place "off campus".  Richardson's was perfect. Beautiful indoor/outdoor shaded brick courtyard with copper topped tables. Full bar and extensive menu.  Our group enjoyed every dish, the Chile Relleno, tortillas and the Midwestern breakfast were all fantastic. Staff was super friendly and efficient, thanks Lauren. We are all planning to return this trip.

oQxweeiUmQBNt51fw6RXKA.text: I've been eating at this restaurant for 20 years, but after 3 bad meals in a row and prices that have gone through the roof, I'm done with Richardsons. If I'm going to pay those kind of prices for a meal, I expect the food to be cooked properly. The quality just doesn't justify the exorbitant prices anymore.

YFbOzm490SBv4AYZjn3d-A.text: Great place to Brunch! Authentic chilaquiles with juicy and tender steak. Their classic cheeseburger and fries are extremely savory. Just what we need after arriving at PHX airport. However, seems we got lucky to have arrived at a calm time. I will make sure to call ahead and make a reservation next time I return to bring the rest of the family.

eFcUtP0XhbdFA_dFynENTQ.text: Let's just say beyond yummy! Omg the garlic plate is so darn delicious! It's a must share! And I mean between 4 to 6 people if its just an api!

HawRAEzr4Oa-beO45BCvFQ.text: Awesome spot for Southwest flavor. The atmosphere is very old school Arizona, you must checkout out

xQrw26T3u3iW97O1_PQY-Q.text: Waiter took excellent care of our table. Made great recommendations and explained the menu extremely well. The food was exceptional as was quantity, so much great tasting food had to take half home. I had New Mexican Platter so good! Flourless cake was big hit!  Highly recommend!

u_YlfvNB2eyPYtapvU1d2Q.text: I was served raw scallops and sent them bag then I received the same scallops they didn't even refire new scallops and I was expected to pay for my meal the manager was rude and unprofessional I will never return to this place!

sSa4-TvCZWZ27yHvnuusMA.text: Love Richardson's, it's always a good choice! The food here is delicious, the garlic plate appetizer and the carne adovada are my go-to's! Great choice for birthdays or to bring guests from out of town. They also have excellent margaritas!

cToknLReDly8v6WSCjRIKA.text: Always terrific. Loads of energy and the best New Mexican food around. The green mole pork shoulder is ridiculously good, as is the carne adovado. Definitely try to get there for happy hour, great deals on appetizers and drinks.

ejGP1JC29lt5C2RJ-5d92A.text: As a New Mexico native, I'm always skeptical when a restaurant claims to have "New Mexican Cuisine". This place, however, is definitely the best of all making the claim. Their green chile is really good. I like the red, but it's a little more on the smokey/chipotle side for me. I love the brunch menu most!

ke1nsPBCtmc1TA2O0n3kBw.text: The absolute best enchiladas that I have ever had.... bar none.  Very cool place, nice bars, great menu, just the best!

MAbvp1ACVSxlfferW8fdAA.text: Wow .. took a to go .. burnt .. wish I could have tasted the food .. oh well not the first time ..

LBDxs8Qh9fBlU3Nic6MGyQ.text: Maybe my favorite restaurant in uptown.  Everything good on the menu has some kick to it so if you don't like spicy food then this might not be the best spot for you.  Great dinner, happy hour and brunch menus.

vhD8YqreUzGgTzd7XDGxew.text: Great ambiance and grounds!  We sat on patio and it was lovely, warm, had a fireplace, lots of plants and nice tile floors and warm inviting benches.  We ordered several appetizers which were very good and drinks were good too.  I would definitely recommend this place, especially for a party or bigger group and patio is a must!

txYS218ikzoruTHr-toYsw.text: Shawn, ultimate bartender & Anthony, manager made our experience amazing!  They know how to run a 5star restaurant!Thank you!!!!

xsdZEYsV34JkROZbTGq5cw.text: Was recommended by the hotel staff for a great dinner and boy did they nail it. I had the prime rib that was the size of Texas ( not really but it was huge)that was prepared medium rare! It was so good! The wait staff were attentive but not overly so. Ambiance was comfortable/casual. If your in Phoenix make this one of your destinations.

KfzTYhUawxfICr4blVgrRQ.text: Food was good, lots of choices and unique and/or interesting concoctions and combinations. However, I was not impressed with the service. First encounter was valet. The valet attendant told me, "just so you know, we only have one Handicap parking".  This was right in front of the valet stand and I wanted to park myself since all I had to do was turn my car left.  Valet parking is free so was he fishing for valet parking so he could have a tip? Disrespectful!  Next, the hostess didn't warn me about a step down to her to our table.  I almost fell but luckily caught myself. Lastly, our server was taking a long time to get our order. I had to go get her.  Then when I asked if I could have a piece of bread because I'm diabetic and was feeling my blood sugar going down, she didn't seem to understand me. I just asked for orange juice instead because I was stressed and didn't want a hypoglycemic attack. Otherwise, the food was excellent and everyone in our party really liked what they ordered. I will still go back as there are more items in the menu that I would like to try and if that one Handicap Parking is open, I would still park my car there!  If you like spicy food, then this place is a mit's try!!!!

UQJ-jLXRzJW66wFX4TZJ_Q.text: Every year I come to town I eat here. And every year I love it. The service from curb to bar to table is great. No valet to night so we parked in back no big deal. The margaritas were made perfect. We had several dishes in my group and all of them were made hit and tasty. I think you can not go wrong here and the bill was reasonable for a group of 6. Try this place you won't regret it. I would be patient if your on a time crunch it stays very busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EZBeFObIVtEAblG0RdioFQ.text: This is my favorite restaurant for Santa Fe style food.  I took my brother there last week and we both had the carne adovada. The meat is tender and nice and spicy. It is served with pinto beans and rice and tortillas.  The servings are so large, we took some home and had with eggs the next morning.  We also LOVE the prickly pear margaritas. And of course the guacamole and chips and salsa are favorites.  Superb!!

L_25VemLqCgoXUrevAsG-Q.text: Love the atmosphere. Staff was great. Food/flavors exceptional! Pricey but a lot of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New Mexico Enchiladas - green chile pork! Nom nom
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waiting for food!

44v1bYu-rVNolMSA_tuezg.text: Some buddies and I recently had a great meal at Richardson's. Great atmosphere, great food. The wait staff was first-class and especially helpful. They're doing it right.

tmCcCysyHMFa_HfUA2rlHw.text: It's Saturday morning at 11:27 am, and I should be at Richardson's savoring a Richardsons combo with a jalapeno benedict (with pork loin and jalapeno hollandaise) and two chicken enchiladas with both red and green sauce (why settle when you can have both).  I would also even have some of the asparagus they throw on the plate so you can feel that you had a healthy meal.  I should be washing it all down with a bloody mary requested to be "just a little spicy", so that it has just enough of a spicy kick for me.  Or maybe I should branch out and have the carne adovada and eggs or huevos rancheros or anything on that wonderful brunch menu.  And maybe I should go a second time to award the coveted 5th star, just to make sure it's excellence was not a fluke.  But instead, I'm writing about it.  Should have, could have, would have, but didn't.  Well this is just depressing, so I'm headed to the tamale festival instead.  But I'm thinking Richardson's tomorrow.

m_KCMni9xnLV5EEZvqUoHA.text: We celebrated a family birthday here.    Richardson's staff made it as wonderful as twenty years of memories there could have aspired to.  The New Mexico platter was absolutely the epitome of New Mexican Cuisine.  Our native New Mexican was impressed with the adovada entree.  My chorizo pork chop was simply amazing.  Nothing in New Mexico was on this level of service and flavor.  All said another wonderful visit to Richardson's.

WUwXCYUhVUTFL6A-3ak6pw.text: On our way for Valentine's Day breakfast.  Love  the Eggs Benidict w Filet Mignon & Crab Omelet

4KAe9EgGSV8wRU7gaE3PBg.text: Honestly hands down my favorites brunch spot in PHX. Every time I come I pick a new  menu item and end up ranting and raving about it. I've tried the jalepeno Benedict, the Richardsons Combo, then now the chille rellleno breakfast (pork and beef) . The $5 mimosa or bloody marry are always a winning choice. I can't wait to come for lunch or dinner! This place knows what they are doing.

Wi_ttqU-A0gxfJYygzDZyA.text: Went here with my husband and a friend for dinner. The ambiance is dark but nice. Our friend is from New Mexico and she said they do a very good job making authentic NM food; to me it was a little too salty. Perhaps that is the style of cooking there? The portion sizes are large so that does help to justify the high prices, however, I think in the Phoenix area there are more affordable places to try with food just as good or better.  With that being said, I've only been here once and maybe the chef was just a little too "happy" with the salt that night... I'd try it again if I was in the area. For now, just 3/5.

4PWEGSdXRQQ1adFCAvulHA.text: A friend and her wife brought me here one morning for breakfast because they were convinced it would change my life.... And they were right   I decided to try the Carne Adovada plate (around $16) and it was by far one of the best meals, breakfast or not, that I've ever had. The pork was perfectly cooked and tender, the beans were flavorful, and the eggs and potatoes were delicious. The amount of food was too much for me, so I was happy to have leftovers for dinner. The price is worth it, since it's basically 2 meals in 1.  Can't wait to go back!

mbh61usxTeFfFDddU_FTxQ.text: The food was good - I had the scallops which had three different sauces and beans and rice. My husband had the kabobs (I assume they were good as he didn't save any for me to taste!) I had a glass of wine however, the drink of the night was the prickly pear margarita. Not too sweet and very easy to drink. The only reason for the 4 star review was the service was not good at the start.

CS3wxukU9cm3zz0j6f8pWg.text: I came here just to get a prickly pear margarita.  All 3 were great!!   The food is covered in cheese and sauce, which is not the way I like my food, but I have to give the Manager Mario cudos, he patiently listened to our complaints and did not charge my friend for her dinner, which honestly she did not eat.  Please had a very nice outside seating area which would be great for a group of friends to enjoy some drinks and appetizers

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prickly pear margarita was great

0ldes-t-26OiLG6SQvmsuw.text: Let me get the negative out first, the lighting!  It makes me almost sick and takes a while to get used to, really dark purple colored lights, yuk!  The food is really good (try the garlic plate if your not on a 1st date).  Prices are a little high but not out of touch.  Would be a great place for a date.  Make reservations, it gets busy, hence service can be less than spectacular.

3-QOlai7G8kmmDVIZAer1w.text: Food is 5 Star stuff  Service was AWEFUL! From the moment we sat down, our server, an older blonde lady, was rude, passive aggressive and truly toxic.  Carne Adovada was amazing! Margaritas were solid but overpriced.  It is a total shame when a server ruins an entire evening. $375.00 check for 8 people. You would think she would try a little kindness considering there is a pretty good tip coming their way.  Oh well, maybe next time. The bus boy was nice!

WhV4i6xjpAT9IMKo1dB0Rg.text: I really enjoyed the food I had here. I had the daily special - a fish trio, with different sauces and preparations. When I left, I was sad that I didn't live in Phoenix. I was also sad that I was with a bunch of my co-workers who, when they were complaining that the food was too spicy, would have looked at me funny for stealing the remainder of THEIR dinners.   This place is an absolute winner.

Rf6amq-mNNDE-AbEKbyfTQ.text: Went for brunch yesterday and ordered the CARNE ADOVADA BENEDICT(twopoachedeggsonEnglishmuffinswithcarneadovada,jalapeno hollandaise, beans & your choice of potatoes or hash browns)And it was Delicious!!!!!! My friend and I also had 2 very good mimosas- I will definitely be back!

nXsojphkTqUVcw2aRJXeXg.text: This is as New Mexico as it gets. Everything from the Spanish tile on the floor to the decor and artwork in the building. This was my second time here and both times I left very satisfied with my meal and the service. As a warning you should like spicy foods if you are going to try this spot. The Adovado and New Mexican Enchilada are the 2 plates I have eaten. Both were really good. I am definitely making this a spot to stop at when craving a spicy dish. It can be pricy and is a bit upscale.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great food with great company!

HohWLVWHn4sEC1VG0jBNRQ.text: THIS IS THE BEST PLACE FOR BREAKFAST!  We had been going to dicks for awhile now and one day we walked in and they said that it was full that morning,  and the waitress told us that Richardson's was up the road.  We never knew this was there.    We usually order the french toast which is AMAZING both Dicks and Richardson's serve the same breakfast.    Service is great and the coffee is even better!

HU6ulOPl9TmeR1FJgub15Q.text: Good food, awesome ambiance and the patio is beautiful!! Will definitely visit again.

1REoATTfjYycSagQX9T9_Q.text: I like the style of food and the ingredients. Bueno "New Mexico Chilis".  The atmosphere is awesome for hanging out and the beer selection is fair. Valet park only helps you get on with the good stuff. Cheers

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You should ruin yourself too!!!

B-MqcAgTQdwAhYKKl7Q_5w.text: We LOVE this place. Food is consistently on point. The staff is super friendly and they make a mean jalapeno margarita. Keep up the good work Richardson's!

0Upe8WNccYSdNzdeb94koA.text: Just tremendous service, great food and a really nice atmosphere. We brought our kids and although there weren't any other kids there we all had a great time and loved the food. The pizzas are great, but they are better knows for their enchiladas and quesadillas - and for good reason. The portions are huge and they taste fantastic. Would highly recommend for a fun night out.

bPGtqvOd1u4gteGhmoG2Eg.text: How anyone can rate this place below five stars is ridiculous!!  Everything from the excellent service to the tasty and perfectly mixed margaritas to the perfectly spiced eats -- simply amazing!!!!

Sw5KFlCNpS7uRGz0bW7FCg.text: Best New Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. It's a 30 minute drive from the east valley, but worth it for the great food, good service, and ambiance. The free valet parking is a nice touch.

gZT9aZP8k0MRPa_r4MBTvQ.text: This was the worst experience EVER!! It is never a good start when on the Menu it is written "If you order it you eat it" To start those of us that drank soda had to send our drinks back more than once since they pour them out of 2 liters and it is flat and watered down.  Our waiter seemed clueless and a little like a deer in headlights when ever we asked about any menu item. For and example we asked what the size difference was for the large and small guacamole his answer was "Well you know the small is well a small bowl and the Large is like a large bowl"   When ordering a few in the group let him know that they did not like spicy food and asked what the best choice was and he directed them to the enchiladas with Red Chili Sauce. Four out of the seven of us ordered that and when the food was served it was so spicy they could not eat and and told the waiter and his response was "do you want me to box it up for you" No they were still hungry.   When we asked to see the manager the response was nobody new where he was and didn't know when he would be back.   He finally showed up 15 min later and would not exchange the food or comp for the uneaten meals and said that we should have seen the note on the menu that states "If you order it you eat it" and he does not know why the waiter would have told them the red chili enchilada's where not spicy because they were VERY spicy.   The service is awful and the food is Spicy and any restaurant that does not even try to make a customer happy is not worth the trip.   Way over priced and they treat you like crap!!

MOHBP5yuC0eKdWuSN-LQNg.text: Go!  It is really good!  In from the Northeast and sat ouside (True sign of an out of towner in January).  Great space, great decor, and great servie.  Just really good and fresh tasting New Mexican food.  Had a Jalipo Mule and enjoyed it very much.  We both ordered off the specials board and were thrilled,  I ordered a "trio" while my guest ordered Lamb Taco's.   The flavors are amazing and with a great balance.  Guaranteed visit next time I'm back in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Trio&#34; special
Photo of Richardson's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb Taco&#39;s

2pgWQXQw26Saqx_Rk5uu3w.text: Unfortunately, the drastically mixed reviews are are accurate- although unless the really good ones are purely nostalgic, I'm not sure where they are coming from.  I hadn't been t Richardson's since they'd rebuilt...remember when this spot was Timothy's??  Now, that...I miss!  Anyhow, our dinner for 8 went from bad- a bartender who had very good wine knowledge but then just poured my drink into a new glass after I discovered a crack in it and gave us serious attitude when questioned about the need to remake the drink....to worse- spoiled seafood with major ammonia smell.  2 stars- one for the Manager who when we finally complained took care of us properly and one for the cozy patio.  Just not sure if I can bring myself to give them another try... Sad.

tHOIPDcd9cjDN58R_MXcwQ.text: Visiting the area for work and had not found a great place to eat until now. Food is wonderful! What a great patio and dinning area. Service wa great. The carnitas are spicy but excellent and prepared the right way! I will return to try more dishes

mVjAfXlXwOVNKSp5fK3rBQ.text: Whenever we're in Phoenix, we make at least one stop at Richardson's. This is our go-to place for New Mexican food. The chiles here are killer, red or green. The New Mexico enchiladas are the perfect chile delivery system. (They'll give you red & green on same plate, but we're partial to the red.) Combined with daily happy hour until 6, what's not to like?  Btw, roasted garlic plate app is great but definitely a big portion. It's a lot for two people to eat and still enjoy full entrees. Rokerij, the sister restaurant next door, is very good, too.

j73TsvW1tTiY51JR6hTonA.text: We went to Richardson's last night because we had some family in town and wanted to treat them to a nice dinner.   They did not disappoint. I had the fish special which had swordfish, mahi mahi and salmon and it was simply delightful. For some of the older folks in my family some of the menu was off-limits because of the spiciness but that's not True for me!   I will be visiting this establishment again and suggest you do too, if you have a few extra bucks. (A little pricey)

qOg0itZ_iB5U-XR5UIgj0g.text: I am not sure if I just dislike Mexican fusion, so I have to preface with that. I don't think I do. The waitstaff was very friendly. The food was mediocre. I had a special, tilapia with cheese. It was OK. Tasted like something I could do. The other three diners seemed to enjoy their food. I think it was a little overpriced too.

PQjl8jqh5nRhXAL0FM-PWQ.text: I came to Richardson's straight from the PHX airport.  I was eager to eat good food and be outside as I had just came from Chicago aka Chi-beria (-9 degrees).  I was on a business trip, so I sat alone at the outdoor bar.  The bar tender was really friendly and whipped me up a skinny margarita (which was very refreshing).  The menu is huge and they also have a lot of specials.  I should've looked on Yelp prior to ordering to get some guidance on what was best.  I ended up with a fish special - Mahi Mahi w/ mango salsa, ranchero mashed potatoes, and broccolini.  I wanted so badly to give Richardson's four stars, but two things held me up:  1) Side salad was served w/ ranch...maybe I am being too harsh, but ranch dressing is one of the worst dressings for you and they could've offered me another alternative. 2) Mahi Mahi had a bit of a sour flavor (not sure how to describe it) and was kind of tough  Otherwise, the dish was plated very lovely - very colorful!  The mashed potatoes were served in a jalapeno.  The broccolini and asparagus were cooked perfectly and had a corn sauce over them.  The mango salsa was not very ripe, so it was not very sweet as I had expected.  I love the ambiance here and I would definitely come back to try one of their other many dishes.

eVAV6aZ5wgiJmzgI7ZneMA.text: We came here for Sunday brunch and they serve it till 4pm (yay!). This also includes very spicy margaritas and large mimosas for $5! Until 4pm! Our food took a while to come out and the staff was full of characters not good or bad just unusual service. I was lucky enough to nibble off of everyone's plate and it was all savory, satisfying and very very filling!  Portions here are gargantuan! Finishing your entire plate proved to be impossible for everyone in our party so order appropriately.   Also, the inside is very dark so if you are done with the sun this is a nice refuge. This place get 3.5 stars for me, but I think it's better to round up!

0bes1j8FaAGU17C6riLP2g.text: No matter what the knuckleheads say this is one of the finest restaurants in the greater PHX area.  There is NEVER poor service.  The service when it busy slows down is normal, but not excessive.  The drinks are awesome.  The food is always excellent.  They have spicey and nonspicey food.  Prices run from $15 to $40 and yet it is not cheap, but not expensive because u get quality and a great experience.  Just try it@!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

zifghkArppirPi2i2RkPng.text: Richardson's is the best restaurant in Phoenix. They have delicious enchiladas, killer pico, succulent steaks and amazing prickly pear margaritas .  They open at 8am for breakfast so you can start your day with mimosas and end it with fine wine.  Been going to Richardson's , Dicks and Rockerij for over twenty years at least twice a week and, if company is in town, they want to go every day.  Staff is crazy good , they have a great patio for my dog , and they never fail to deliver excellence.  You want see much advertising for this restaurant group; they don't have to:  the locals show up every day.  Get there early or you won't  find a seat.  Enjoy!

IFW7_wXyFcUiKMxpUIpX0Q.text: One of the best meals I've had in a long time.. I will definitely return. Had to prime rib special it was outstanding

ynAUWjZ8vS-Ffz8ON0inVg.text: Very good...service food and great customer service we arrived at six pm my fiance birthday wanted to make it special wanted Mexican steaks another application recommend this place very good we did not have reservations  (Saturday night) they made accommodations and made a spontaneous adventure very special my honey had a stuffed pork chop n green chili stuffed with sweet potatoes very good i had their special steak and roasted Brussels sprouts the steak had the best green chili sauce spicy.  Great service by Michelle thank you for making my honeys day that extra special

i7N08y7p4MA_3oKujwqWuA.text: Another GREAT restaurant. From the cocktails, to the appetizers, the main course, and the after dinner drinks, this was one of the best dining experiences I've had. I ordered the Carne Adovada but substituted a green chili potato for the rice and beans, and it was uh-MAZING. My husband got the Pork Mole, and if I hadn't loved my dish so much, I would've traded him.   I only wish it wasn't such a drive, because their happy hour items look just as good as everything else I had. Next time I'm in town, Richardson's, I've got a hot date with you.

zvaY4qne5V6tV8bFElpvkg.text: This is a must when in Phoenix.  Best carne adovada ever!  The new place is even better with a great patio and outside bar; moreover, the keep with the feel of the old place.  Great food, great atmosphere, and spectacular service!    LaDonna is phenomenal!  Have her make you a Jamaican Ten-Speed.  You'll love it!

Wu4accG-glqdMPcD0WYr1A.text: Dark lit, copper top bar (I think, it was dark), booze flowing and amazing comfort food makes this place a nice place for Tommy to go! Yeah, third person, so 1990's! Belly up here and get special happy hour prices on drinks and food! I usually stay clear of New Mexican food, but I have been here a couple times now and the flavors are amazing. Green chili, roasted peppers, garlic, smoked meats, fish, oysters, you name it, it's all amped up here. The heat of spice here isn't bad like most New Mexican food so don't be afraid and eliminate choices. Now I know some people aren't fans of the darker atmosphere here, but let your eyes acclimate and you'll see the warm inviting dinning room. Just be sure you don't drop your keys or wallet! JK. This place also has a great outdoor dinning and bar area in between the restaurants. Nice little patio to grab drinks and visit!

RfjfPOzzyCBzKB8WgBjr8Q.text: Went for lunch (same menu as dinner so a bit pricey) and enjoyed the Chimayo Chicken which is a stuffed chicken breast with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, poblano chiles and asiago. Not much stuffing and the cheese was all oozed-out but it was tasty with some nice vege's and a great house salad. Probably wouldn't get again. My guest had the Richardson's combo which was more of a brunch item - two chicken enchiladas (outstanding) and a jalapeno benedict (great ham and hollandaise - light) and a mess of tasty asparagus - would highly suggest this dish. The heat level on everything was a bit light but we had not specified more. That was a bit disappointing.
